loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Estela Ramírez S. cuenta con un abarrotes denominado Abarrotes Meche desde hace 8 años, donde ofrece a sus cliente mejor calidad y un bajo precio. Su negocio han ido incrementado sus ventas pero ella no cuenta con capital para surtir su negocio es por eso que pide el apoyo tener mayor variedad en artículos.
texts.en: Estela R. S. has had a grocery store, named Abarrotes Meche, for 8 years where she offers her customers better quality and lower prices. Her business has been increasing its sales, but she doesn’t have the capital to stock her business and so she is asking for a loan to have a better variety of items.

loans.use: increase inventory

loans.name: Tulipan Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tulipán está conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Luz Marina Jarquín de 40 años se dedica al comercio de comida desde hace 10 años. Ella invertirá el préstamo en materia prima arroz, frijoles, cebolla, aceite, carne, pollo, tomate…etc. con el fin de mejorar su negocio.

Las otras integrantes son María Salvadora O. Martinez de 34 años es una mujer trabajadora que comercializa gallina en el mercado Oriental, Yamileth del Socorro O. de 33 años tiene una pequeña comideria negocio en el que invertirá y Sandra R. de 41 años comercializa pan, cafe y cafe con leche.
texts.en:
The Tulipán (Tulip) group is made up of four hard working women.  One of them is Luz Marina J., 40, who has sold prepared meals for 10 years. She will use the loan to buy raw materials like: rice, beans, onions, cooking oil, meat, chicken, tomatoes, etc. to improve her business.

The other group members are: María Salvadora O. Martínez, 34, a hard working woman who sells chicken in the Oriental Market, Yamileth del Socorro Osorio, 33, who has a small eatery in which she will invest and Sandra

loans.use: For raw materials like: rice, beans, onions, cooking oil, meat, chicken, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 45 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “La Unión” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Magdalena alterna sus actividad del hogar con la pequeña negocio, ella tiene en su domicilio una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde expende productos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y muchas cosas más. 

Magdalena con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 2500 nuevos soles, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar para esta época navideña que se está acercando dulces, galletas, pasteles navideños, panetones, bebidas, etc. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 45 years old and lives in the city of Cusco.  She has been a member of Arariwa's “La Unión” community bank for a long time.  Magdalena divides her time between her household duties and her small business.  She has a small grocery store in her home where she sells products such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil and a lot more besides.

Magdalena will use her loan for 2,500 nuevos soles to increase her business capital.  She also wants to buy candies, cookies, Christmas cakes, panettones and drinks etc. for the approaching Christmas holiday period.

She is thankful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy candies, cookies, Christmas cakes, panettones, drinks, etc. for the approaching Christmas holiday period

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 45 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y de sus jóvenes hijos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa casual y calzado, en diferentes modelos y colores de acuerdo a la temporada. Este negocio le gusta mucho, ya que la convierte en una mujer independiente y durante este tiempo ha logrado captar buena clientela, entre amigos y conocidos que le compran constantemente a crédito, asimismo lleva su mercadería a una mina donde vende muy bien a los trabajadores; su gran carisma y la gran capacidad de persuasión le ha permitido vender y colocar los productos que ofrece, obteniendo muy buenas ganancias económicas. La mercadería que tiene es traída de la ciudad capital, aumentando su precio inicial, de esa manera, por tal razón se siente muy satisfecha, ya que puede ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Su mayor deseo es continuar en este rubro, y mas adelante instalar un negocio en algún puesto dentro de un centro comercial. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería y también en abrir su granja.
texts.en:
Juana is 45 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and her young children.  For 3 years she has been selling casual clothes and footwear in different styles and colors according to the season.  She likes her business a lot since it makes her an independent woman.  Over time, she has managed to attract a good group of customers, friends and acquaintances who buy from her constantly on credit.  She also takes her merchandise to a mine where she sells very well to the workers.  Her great charisma and gift of persuasion have allowed her to sell the products which she offers, making very good financial profits.  The merchandise she has is brought from the capital city, increasing its initial price.  She feels very satisfied since she can help her husband cover their household expenses.  Her greatest wish is to continue in this activity and, further down the line, set up her business on a stall in a shopping center.

This is Juana's second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being a part of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to those people who will fund her loan as it will help her a to make progress in her business.  She will invest the loan in buying more merchandise and also in opening a farm.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to have in stock.  To set up a farm

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl, de 42 años, convive con Delia, de 34 años, producto de su amor nació Ruger, de 11 años. Los tres, en unión familiar, viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio el palomar (selva central peruana). Este hombre trabajador menciona que hace poco tiempo decidió invertir en la siembra de más plantas de café. Ya tiene 4 años dedicándose a la agricultura, sus principales productos constan de café, plátano y maíz; los que negocia en el mercado de su ciudad. Pero según menciona, su producción de café saldrá recién a la venta, ya que la planta de café tarda 3 años en crecer y dar fruto, pero como son plantas nuevas darán un excelente grano. La seguridad de Raúl es sorprendente, ahora, desea invertir en la siembra de más café, pues sus planes son de adquirir más terrenos agrícolas para aumentar su producción y obtener más ganancias. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y como presidente de su banco comunal, se siente feliz de dirigir y apoyar a sus integrantes donde asegura saldrá adelante. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar 700 mamones (plantas de plátanos), así como también, 5 millares de plantas de café para el vivero que hará.
texts.en: Raúl, 42, lives with Delia, 34, and the product of their union, Roger, 11.  The three of them live in their own house, located in the town of Sanchirio del Palomar (in a forested region of central Peru).  This hard-working man says that he recently decided to plant more coffee.  He has operated his farm for 4 years.  He grows coffee, platanos and maize, all of which he sells at the local market.  According to Rodrigo, his coffee crop will soon be ready for sale.  Coffee takes 3 years to grow and bear fruit, but his plants are new and the beans they produce should be excellent.  His confidence is amazing and he now wants to grow more coffee.  He plans to buy more land to increase his production and, in turn, his income.  This is Rodrigo's third MFP loan and, as president of his community bank, he is happy to lead and support its members in their efforts to get ahead.  He will use this loan to buy 700 "mamones" (platano plants) and 5 thousand coffee plans for his next crop.

loans.use: Buy 700 platanos plants and 5 thousand coffee plants.

loans.name: Magda Rosa

texts.es:
Magda es una madre muy dedicada a su familia como a su pequeño negocio de cosméticos. El cual ha venido aumentando su clientela por vender productos buenos y accesibles de precios en donde vende por catálogos.
Cuando inicio lo hizo con liquidación de su trabajo, luego para lograr comprar más productos inicia con un pequeño financiamiento en donde mejora su comercio ya que compra más producto lo que coloca más ventas.

Los financiamientos han venido hacer de gran beneficio para lograr el nivel de ventas e inventarios que ha logrado. Lo que más comprara es perfumes de dama y caballeros que se coloca mas es esta época y que vienen en una variedad de olores como accesibles de precios.
texts.en:
Magda is a mother who is very devoted to her family and to her small cosmetics business where her clientele has been growing because she sells good products at accessible prices; her sales are catalogue based.

She started her business using her severance pay from work.  Then, in order to be able to buy more products she started with a small loan which improved her commerce because buying more products leads to more sales.

The loans have turned into a great benefit to reach the levels of sales and inventory she’s achieved.  What she will buy the most of is perfume for ladies and for gentlemen which sells very well during this season and which are available in a variety of scents and accessible prices.

loans.use: To buy perfumes for both ladies and gentlemen.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun, es casada, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo de 1 año y 4 meses.
Karina es feriante, vende ropa para damas caballeros y niños que trae de Lima, compra en Gamarra y lo lleva  a la selva de San Francisco donde lo vende le va bien.
Le gusta Finca por los créditos, puede ahorrar y la capacitaciones que recibe de negocio, como hacer trabajar la plata. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en surtir su mercadería.
El sueño de Karina es poder establecer su negocio en un lugar fijo la selva de San Francisco y poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the community bank Wiñarisun.  She is 24 years old. She is married and has a son who is 16 months old.

Karina is a merchant at fairs. She sells clothing for women, men, and children. She buys clothing in the Gamarra district in Lima and takes it to the countryside around San Francisco, where she sells it. This business is going well for her.

She likes Finca because of the loans it provides, because she is able to save, and for the training in business that she receives, such as in making her money work for her. She will invest the loan that she is applying for to stock her merchandise.

Karina's dream is to be able to establish her business in a fixed location in the San Francisco countryside and to build her house.

loans.use: Buy various clothing for resale

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Luz Angélica es una madre de familia de 18 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Olmos, una zona conocida a nivel regional por producir principalmente limón y maracuyá. La localidad pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la comercialización de prendas de vestir para todo público. Ella cuenta con mercadería que adquiere en la ciudad de Chiclayo y la suele ofrecer en base a pedidos. El negocio le brinda algunos ingresos que utiliza para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia. Ella se esfuerza continuamente por mantener su negocio y buscar nuevos clientes.

Luz desea adquirir más prendas de vestir para poder aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias que le permitan salir adelante y progresar. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Luz Angélica is an 18 year old mother who lives with her husband and young child in one of the villages that make of the farming district of Olmos, an area known at a regional level for producing mainly lemons and passion fruit. This community is part of Lambayeque Province and located more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Luz Angélica works by selling clothes to the general public. She acquires her merchandise in the city of Chiclayo and sells them according to orders. This business provides her with some income so that she can help her husband with supporting their family. She strives continually to maintain her business and look for new customers.

Luz wants to acquire more articles of clothing so that she can increase her sales and earn more income to allow her to move forward and make progress. To achieve this goal, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN.

loans.use: Acquire more clothing to sell

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Mrs. Yorn P. is a married woman located in Roluos village in Takeo province where she was born in 1986. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Ban Tet, is a construction worker. In the rice field, it is time to grow rice, so she needs some money to plant. Mrs. Yorn P. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and plow her rice field. She is the mother of two small children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and plow her rice field

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his business

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. They live in a home that she rents where she has access to neither electricity nor piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

Rehema has a business of selling sweet potatoes and cassava.  She works seven days out of every week selling her products at the market.  The main business challenges for Rehema include seasonality and defaulters.

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sweet potatoes and cassava to sell. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sweet potatoes and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Majid

texts.en:
Majid S. is a married man. His wife takes care of the household chores while Majid goes out to run their motorcycle business. They have two children aged four and two years old. Majid and his wife hope to give a good education to their kids until they reach university level. His business is located at the Nyalenda-Kachok area in Kisumu.

Kisumu is the region of Kenya known for the production of fish. It harbours Lake Victoria and is commonly known as the lake basin. 

Majid has been in the transportation business for five years and has two employees. He says that his business is profitable and his major challenge is theft. Thugs pretend to be customers and, on their way to the destination, they rob the person rendering the service. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He plans to use his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy another motorcycle to grow his business. He hopes to buy rickshaws some day. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita V. is from the town of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 57 years old. Jovita is married and has 10 adult children. 

To make a living, Jovita prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Jovita has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jovita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Jovita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Jovita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Jovita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Chon

texts.en: Chon S., 52, is married and has three children living at home.  She lives in the Kampong Chhnang province.  Since 2000, she has been selling meat and wine from home and is able to make about US$5 in profit each day. Her husband is a construction worker, making typically US$2 per day. Chon S. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase wood, cement and other materials to complete the construction of her home.

loans.use: to complete the construction of her home

loans.name: Meldred

texts.en:
Meldred works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Meldred requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.  Meldred has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Meldred would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 60 years old and married.  She has one child who is 34 years old.  Merlyn is a farmer and hog-raiser. She tills her land in Banga, South Cotabato, where she grows corn and rice. Merlyn also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market.

Merlyn needs fertilizer for her farm and feed for the pigs she raies.  She plans to use the requested loan for these necessary business supplies.  Merlyn hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 56-year-old Rosemary (holding the yellow folder) from Masvingo. She is married with four children. She also cares for two dependents. Rosemary runs a retail trading business  where she sells clothing, fruit and vegetables. She does have additional sources of income. Her business has been in operation for 8 years. She says the main challenge she faces is competition. 

Rosemary has requested a loan of $400 to increase her store's stock. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of her family. In the future, Rosemary plans to operate from an outlet.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en: Rolly is 42 years old and married. He is blessed with three children, all of whom are studying. Rolly is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been doing this work for 15 years. Rolly is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizers such as manure and seeds of corn to be planted on his farm. Rolly hopes that this loan will grow his operations. Currently, he earns PHP 40,000 each crop in this field of work. Rolly wants to enlarge his farm to earn a higher income and continue sending his children to school to finish their education.

loans.use: to acquire farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is married and blessed with three children. He is a hardworking farmer who has had a dairy for seven years.

Through Faulu Kenya Simon has developed his dairy, resulting in better milk production.

Simon has requested 20,000 KES to buy a dairy cow. He hopes to add more cows to his dairy so as to increase future milk production.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 75 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como profesora cesante, la socia también se dedica al negocio de manualidades, la socia hace colchas a croché y también teje pantalones para bebes, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de manualidades. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como lana e hilos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The loan recipient belongs to the village bank "AMAUTA", located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

She is 75 years old and single. She alternates her daily activities with work as a substitute teacher. She also has a craft business. She makes crocheted bedspreads and also knits pants for babies. Through this business she helps her children to get ahead.

She wants to increase her craft business. She asks for a loan to buy materials like yarn and thread. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy materials like yarn and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a responsible mother of four children. From the time she was young, she learned the honorable work of raising livestock, an activity that was passed down from her parents and that today brings her satisfaction. Thanks to her valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, she has been able to obtain good results from her sales. She has been running her own business for nine years.

Josefina's wish is to invest more capital in young animals. She hopes to continue her dedication to her work, believing that by improving her stock and feed, her livestock will bring better prices. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000. This support will permit her to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos de 48 años vive en el municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su esposa y sus dos hijos en las edades de 16  y 19 años respectivamente. Marco es pensionado de las fuerzas armadas de colombia, donde aprendió la decoración con nudos y la marquetería, con lo que a partir del momento en que finalizó su servicio, se dedicó a la elaboración de cuadros marineros y medallas condecorativas, las cuales, aprovechando el conocimiento tanto del mercado como del personal de la Base Naval, ha ejercido con mucho éxito para complementar los ingresos familiares. Él tiene un negocio que inició una vez salió pensionado y decidió generar ingresos simultaneos aprovechando el conocimiento obtenido  y los contactos con proveedores y clientes para potencializar las ventas y lograr compras de calidad.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará marcos pinturas, para lograr hacer adecuaciones en su local y proyectar una imagen de higiene y calidad en el servicio, con lo cual captar la atención de clientes potenciales y el confort de sus clientes reales. Porque su sueño es fortalecer su microempresa permanentemente mediante su expansión y con ello poder apoyar la profesionalización de sus hijos, potenciando su éxito.
texts.en: Marcos, age 48, lives in the Soledad municipality, 15 minutes from Barranquilla city with his wife and two children, ages 16 and 19.  Marco is a pensioner of the Colombian armed forces, where he learned knot decoration and marquetry. From the moment that he finished his service, he has worked making marine art and commemorative medals. He has had great success supplementing his family's income, thanks to his knowledge of the market and his personal knowledge of the naval base. He has a business which he started when he retired in order to make an income on top of his pension. He took advantage of the knowledge he had obtained and the contacts with suppliers and clients to boost his sales and make quality purchases. This Kiva loan is his first loan with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will purchase frames for paintings and make improvements to his store, in order to project an image of cleanliness and quality in his business. This will capture the attention of potential clients and create more comfort for his real clients. His dream is to strengthen his business permanently through its expansion, and to thus be able to support his children in becoming successful professionals.

loans.use: to purchase frames for paintings and to make improvements to his store.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 24 years old and married to Tabitha. They have one child. For the last six years, George has been working in the construction industry in Kinoo, Kangemi Town. He was introduced to KADET by a staff member. George repaid his previous loan well and in good time. 

George is requesting a loan to purchase house construction supplies such as tools, cement, and sand. In the future, he hopes to have a registered construction company which will increase his financial status.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools and supplies

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, vende lotería al por mayor, el cual lo reparte a sus clientes desde hace tres años, él vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas, todos los días sale a repartir los billetes de loteria de lunes a domingo.
El necesita el préstamo para aumentar en sus ganancias y tener clientes y comprar más billetes de lotería por mayor, y con el tiempo trabajar propio.
El sueño de juan es crecer en su negocio mejorar en sus ingresos darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan sells lottery tickets wholesale, which he has distributed to his customers for three years.  He lives with his wife and two daughters.  Every day, Monday through Sunday, he goes out to distribute lottery tickets.

He needs the loan to increase his profits and have customers and buy more lottery tickets wholesale, and in time work for himself.

Juan's dream is to grow in his business, improve his earnings, and give a better life to his family.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets wholesale.

loans.name: Somoina

texts.en:
Somoina is 42 years old.  She is married to Milia, who is a farmer, and together they have four children. She is a livestock trader in the busy Kitengela market. She has been in this business for the past two years. She has a monthly income of KES 5,000.

She was introduced to KADET by KADET staff. She is applying for her second loan in KADET. She paid her previous loan successfully. She will use half of the loan amount to purchase livestock and the rest to purchase food for the family. The anticipated profit will help her open a curio shop. Her dream is to own a ranch. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and food for her family.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
This is Merlita, 37 years-old and a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Dante, a cook, and mother to their three children. Two have their own family while the youngest is still under her supervision. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support her child’s schooling. 

Merlita oversees operations of their Tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of a Tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destinations within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 385 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Merlita dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business.. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 38 years old and married. She has four children and lives in Panay Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Carmen owns a piggery and sells swine to earn a living. She's been in this business for 15 years and she earns 8,000 PHP per month. 

Carmen requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase more swine for her piggery.
 
Carmen has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. Carmen's future plan is to expand her swine business and to support the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more swine for her piggery.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, Provincia de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4 filhos todos frenquentam a Escola. Fez a 9ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É negociante ha mais de 10 anos vende extensão de cabelos e mechas e tem um rendimento de cerca 7.000.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 21.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar mechas e estensões de cabelos, para aumentar a sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende investir mais no melhoramento do seu  negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the town of Matola, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is married and has four children, all of which attend school. She completed 9th grade and didn't continue because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been a businesswoman for over ten years. She sells hair weaves and extensions and earns an income of about 7.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 21.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase hair weaves and extensions so that she can increase the amount of her merchandise.
She promises to repay according to the schedule. In the future she plans to invest more in order to improve her business. For that purpose she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products for selling (hair weaves and extensions).

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 47-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two children; one attends university and the other attends school. He has been working as a nurse since 1993. In parallel, he has worked as a taxi driver since 2006 serving customers upon their requests. Today, he is asking to borrow $2,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his son’s university education fees. He will also use the loan to cover his other child’s school fees. His only target is to ensure a good educational level for his children until graduating.

loans.use: to pay his son’s university education fees and cover his other child’s school fees

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
La Sra. Marta es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora, emprendedora y por sobre todo humilde, quien día a día trata de luchar por darle un mejor futuro a su familia.
Tiene un pequeño taller de Costura en la Ciudad de Areguá, distante a unos 20 km. De la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, hasta donde se va para trabajar. Ella es separada, vive con dos de sus hijos mayores y su Mamá. Ella trabajaba como empleada para otras personas siempre en el rubro de la costura. Ella comenta que siempre tiene mucho trabajo por lo cual tiene buenos ingresos.
Con los créditos que obtuvo de la fundación logró comprar máquinas y montar su propio taller, donde actualmente ella trabaja y confecciona prendas. El Crédito actual lo solicita para comprar telas en cantidad, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda para su taller. Agradece a la fundación por la confianza que esta le da, pues gracias a esta está pudiendo salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marta is from the city of San Lorenzo. She defines herself as a very hardworking, entrepreneurial, and above all, humble woman. She struggles daily to provide her family with a better future. 

She has a small sewing workshop in the city of Areguá, 20 km. away from the city of San Lorenzo, where she travels to for work. She is separated and lives with two of her older children and her mother. She used to work as an employee for other people, always in the sewing industry.  She always has a lot of work which provides her with a good income. With the loans she received from Fundación Paraguaya, she bought machines to set up her own workshop where she works and makes clothing. This credit will be used to buy fabrics in bulk, which will be very helpful for her workshop. 

Marta is thankful to Fundación Paraguaya for the trust they place in her, thanks to which she has been able to move forward.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her workshop.

loans.name: Urumuri/bgrm Group

texts.fr:
Seleman fait partie du groupe Urumuri/bgrm. Il a 51 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 4 à 21 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Seleman est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir la surface de culture. Dans les prochaines années, Seleman voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Seleman is a member of the Urumuri/bgrm group. He is 51 years old and is married with six children ages 4 to 21, of whom four attend school. His own level of education has been six years of primary school.

Seleman is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his credit to buy fertilizers.

His strategy for growing his business is to increase the area he cultivates. In coming years, Seleman would like to become the supplier of rice for the region. With the profits, he plans to take care of his children's education.

loans.use: buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga, tiene 38 años, es madre de 2 hijos, casada y socia de Finca Perú desde hace un año.
Carmen es dueña de un Restaurante, da gracias por todos los beneficios que le ofrecen, esta muy feliz en Finca ya que le ayudan a seguir progresando, recuerda que su primer crédito en Finca lo invirtió en su restaurante y siempre lo invierte bien para poder crecer, las capacitaciones le ayudan a poder tener mas conocimiento en todo aspecto, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar al por mayor para el restaurante.
texts.en:
Carmen, 38, is a member of the Morenita Huamanga community bank.  She is married and has 2 children.  She has worked with Finca Peru for a year.
  Carmen owns a restaurant and she is grateful for the opportunities the business provides.  She is grateful to Finca because they have helped her grow her business.  She says that she used her first Finca loan to start the restaurant and uses the loans she gets now to grow it.  The training that she's received has also helped her.  She will use this loan to buy bulk supplies of rice, sugar, etc. for her restaurant business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Sanabel

texts.en:
Sanabel is a 27-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan.

Sanabel is selling cloth and she is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase more cloth to sell.

Sanabel is looking to improve her family's living conditions and increase their living standard.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth items to sell.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 26 years old, single, and has one child. She has been running a green grocery shop for five years earning a monthly income of 8,000 KES.

Faith is requesting her first loan with KADET for 30,000 KES, which she will to use to purchase onions, potatoes, and watermelons for her business. With the anticipated profits, she will educate her child. Her dream is to own a bigger grocery stall and become successful.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther de 29 años está casada con Rafael, con quien tiene a sus 3 hijos de 9 y 5 años y un pequeño bebé de 9 meses de nacido. Ella y su familia viven en una casa alquilada en el distrito de San Pedro de Cajas, provincia de Tarma. San Pedro de Cajas es el pueblo de artesanos de Tarma. Los turistas nacionales e internacionales visitan la zona para llevarse bellos recuerdos. Esther no pierde esta oportunidad, así que gracias a sus estudios en artes, ahora se dedica a la artesanía.  Hace 10 años empezó con esta actividad junto a Rafael, ya que ambos se desenvuelven en el mismo oficio. Esther confecciona chompas, chalinas, frazadas, chalinas, etc., con diseños creativos. Así también realiza cuadros en óleo y pinturas. “El telar y los cuadros son rentables, pero de donde obtengo más ganancias es de las pinturas”, menciona. La competencia en los tejidos hace que gane apenas 5 ó 10 soles por chompas, pero en las frazadas gana muy bien. Pero no hay nada comparado con los cuadros, que son los más solicitados. Gana de 120 a 150 soles por cada pintura de 1 metro por 1 metro y más aún en los días de semana santa. Le gusta lo que hace. Esther quiere instalar un stand en el centro cívico de su distrito, para eso deberá invertir en la compra de estantes, contenedores, anaqueles y en el mismo alquiler del local. Esther es una socia fiel de MFP, lleva trabajando 3 ciclos en un crédito grupal, del que le va de maravilla. Éste sería su primer crédito individual, manifiesta ser puntual en los pagos como ahora.  Esther desea abrir una galería en el centro cívico de su distrito, donde venderá su artesanía. Para implementar el local invertirá en la compra de estantes y anaqueles para ofrecer sus productos. Así como también pagar el alquiler inicial del espacio.
texts.en:
Esther, 29, is married to Rafael with whom she has three children who are 9 and 5 years old and a baby who is 9 months old.  She and her family live in a rented house in San Pedro de Cajas District, Tarma Province.  

San Pedro de Cajas is Tarma’s crafts town.  National and international tourists visit the zone to take away beautiful souvenirs.  Esther does not pass up this opportunity; thanks to her art studies, she’s a craftswoman.  She started this activity ten years ago with Rafael since they both are in the same occupation.  

Esther makes sweaters with creative designs, shawls, blankets, etc.  She also makes oil and other paint paintings.  She mentions that: “The weaving and the paintings are profitable but where I obtain the highest profits is with the paintings.”  Competition in weaving means barely earning 5 or 10 soles per sweater but with the blankets she earns very well.  But there’s nothing to compare to the paintings which are in most demand.  She earns from 120 to 150 soles per 1 meter x 1 meter painting and even more during Holy Week.  She enjoys what she does.

Esther wants to set up a stand in her district’s civic center but to do so she has to invest in the purchase of shelving, containers, and display cases as well as to rent the locale.  Esther is a faithful MFP client; she’s been working in three cycles of group loans where she’s done marvelously.  This would be her first individual loan and she states that she will be punctual with her payments like she’s been to date.  Esther wants to open a gallery in her district’s civic center to sell her crafts.  To furnish the site she will buy shelving and display cases to offer her products; she will also pay the initial rental costs of the space.

loans.use: to rent a locale and to buy display cases and shelving.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete his toilet by buying iron sheets, cement, and doors.

loans.name: Urugwiro Group

texts.en: URUGWIRO is a group led by Francoise, who is 29 years old. The group name means “Happiness” in English. She is married and has 2 children aged between 9 months and 4 years. She sells food stuffs and has been doing this business for the past 9 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives. With this loan, she would like to buy more maize, beans and potatoes for sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more maize, beans and potatoes for sell.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.en:
Concepcion is a responsible, honest person and love her family, she is 46 years old, and lives in Tampico, Tamaulipas. When she left her work to give birth to her youngest daughter, she knew that her husband`s salary would not cover the necessities of the family, for that reason, in October of 1999 with her husband`s support, in a place inside her house began a small paper sales business. Her biggest concern were her daughters, so she started very motivated.

Concepcion has 7 years with her business, however, she needs of your help to purchase merchandise and cover her demand for these next months during the busy season. Concepcion appreciates your generosity and she is requestin for loan of $750 Dlls.

**\\\\\\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\\\\\"

Concepción es una persona responsable, honesta y entregada totalmente a su familia, con 46 años de edad, Concepción vive en Tampico Tamaulipas. al quedarse sin trabajo y al nacer la mas pequeña de sus hijas, sabia que el sueldo de su marido no cubriría las necesidades de la familia, por lo que en octubre de 1999 con el apoyo de su esposo, en un espacio dentro de su casa inició una pequeña papelería, su mayor preocupación eran sus hijas, por lo que comenzó muy motivada.

Concepción tiene 7 años con su negocio, sin embargo, necesita de tu ayuda para adquirir los artículos necesarios y que la papelería pueda enfrentar la demanda esperada para estas próximas fechas de mayores ventas. Concepción espera tu generosidad para un préstamo de $750 Dlls.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena is a 35 year old mother of 4 children.  Both she and the husband are self-employed working together on their taro plantation.  Matalena is staying at her husband’s village, taking care of her husband’s parents.  Matalena’s only source of income is from her business, which she thinks, is not enough to take care of her children and the whole family. All her children attend the village school, which she prefers because it is affordable for her to pay.   Her aim is to expand her business, so that she can earn more to cater to the whole family, and provide a better education for all her children.  With this loan, she’s aiming to buy cattle to start a cattle farm business which is lucrative.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, chemicals, weed killer and a grass cutter.

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en: She started trading at her market with small table with limited number of goods on it and has continued trading for seven years Although she has a university degree, she could not find a good job and had to work at the market. She is married and has three little children. Her mother-in-law takes care of them while she is at work. The family income depends on her salary because her husband's salary it not high enough. With the new season Khursheda would like a loan in order to buy a new assortment of goods, buy thinner fabric for national dresses, and bed clothes that will be brought by her friend from China.

loans.use: Buy seasonal goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build two rental houses.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Phally was married in 1985 and has 5 children, 1 son and 4 daughters. Since 2006, she has been in the business of weaving scarves by using semi-automatic machines at home. She learned from her sister. She owns one machine and now wishes to purchase another semi-automatic machine to expand her business in scarf production. Her husband is a brick construction contractor in the Kean Svay district.

She is asking for a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $1,200. She will use this loan to purchase another semi-automatic machine to expand her scarf production and buy cotton fabric.

loans.use: Purchasing one more scarf semi-automatic machine and cotton fabric.

loans.name: Haydee Luz

texts.en:
Haydee Luz A. Q. belongs to a village bank called “Bonanza.”

Haydee earns her living making and marketing beautiful handicrafts (artesanías). The majority of her works are “tejidos al telar” which are crafts such as tapestries and carpets woven on a loom. Haydee says her specialty is in “artesanías finas,” which are very complex pieces stitched onto processed fabric. Together with her husband she owns a shop called “Qory Qayto,” which is Quechua (their native language) for “Thread of Gold.” Their clients, mostly foreigners, contract with them for specific projects which Haydee and her husband help design. The time it takes to complete one piece can range from one day for a simple tapestry to more than two weeks for large and elaborate orders.

To supplement their income and support their two children, ages 7 and 19, every Sunday Haydee prepares several dishes such as “ceviche,” Peru’s national dish of fresh raw fish soaked in lime juice, which she sells in the local market. Although she has been weaving tapestries for twenty-two years with her husband, Haydee loves to cook. She says her real dream is to open up a small restaurant to which she would be able to dedicate herself full-time.

Haydee loves to be a part of her village bank, which she says provides an enormous amount of support to the women who are involved. She is asking for a $400 loan, with which she will be able to buy the necessary materials for her weaving including fabric, thread, and various tools.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials for her weaving including fabric, thread, and various tools

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Mrs. Faith I. is a 28-year-old woman who is married with 3 children and lives in Benin city.  She sells yams, and is seeking a loan to enable her to buy more yams for sale.  This is a business she started in 2006.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more Yams for sale

loans.name: Sonia Ayde

texts.es:
I have a women’s shoes, clothing, and accessories business in my home. I would like to invest in the purchase of more merchandise this season. Thank God I have been able to establish a good group of clients who pay me in installments. My children and I make a living off this business. I got a divorce sometime ago, so now I have to work double for my family. I am requesting $ 1,200.00 USD to invest it in the purchase of merchandise for my business. 
 Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.
“Tengo un negocio en mi casa de venta de calzado, ropa y accesorios para dama, en esta temporada me gustaría invertir un poco en la compra de mercancía, gracias a dios he logrado hacer una buena lista de clientes, los cuales me pagan a plazos de este negocio vivimos mis hijos y yo ya que hace algún tiempo me divorcie de mi esposo así es que ahora hay que trabajar al doble. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en la compra de mercancía para mi negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Amparo Maritza's Group

texts.en:
Amparo and Herlinda have been members of the Kausachun community bank for four months. In that time they have learned to be punctual and to save.

Amparo is 36 and has four young children. Her cousin encouraged her to join the community bank. Amparo owns a car, which she uses as a taxi, but with her loan she will begin selling auto parts.

Herlinda is 25 and has two children. She runs a small but very well stocked store. She has had this business for almost one year. Before that she sold clothing, but prefers her new business.

Amparo and Herlinda need loans of 400 and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in expanding their selections of auto parts and candy.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest-earning savings account. Herlinda and Amparo plan to use their savings to improve their businesses and repair their homes. Their dreams are to continue improving their lives and see their children become professionals.

loans.use: Amparo and Herlinda need loans of 400 and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in expanding their selections of auto parts and candy.

loans.name: Nabukalu B(I) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Joyce N.. She sells firewood and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Joyce is 48 years old and is a widow. She has 5 children ranging from ages 15 to 30. Each week, Joyce makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start a charcoal-selling business.

Joyce is joined in her small group by Zamu N., Prossy N., Scovia N., and Prossy N.. Zamu N. has a retail shop and wants to purchase more stock. Prossy N. sells charcoal and wants a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell. Scovia N. also sells charcoal and wants to boost her business. Prossy N. is currently in the catering business and is requesting a loan to purchase food warmers and raw food.

loans.use: To purchase a tree cutter, and thus, increase her stock of firewood

loans.name: Art

texts.en: Mrs. Art C. lives in Tropeng Sva Village in Kandal Province. She is a 43-year-old housewife. She is married and the mother of six children, two of whom are working, while the rest stay at home.The whole family is relying on Mr. Sok Hon, Mrs. Art's husband, who is a wedding chef and can generate an income about $2.50 a day. Because of her poor standard of living, she decided to start an animal husbandry business in a local village. To do so she has to apply for a loan to buy cows to raise for breeding. (Mr. Hon is shown in the photo; Mrs. C. was not available).

loans.use: To buy cows for breeding.

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đào Thị Thái, 60 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2002. Her husband was ill and passed away 7 years ago. All her children are grown up. She inherits the family’s herbal medicine. In fact, her first loan of 70USD was used to buy herbs. She is now running a clinic at the center of downtown Sóc Sơn. The average monthly income is 300USD. This time she would like to apply for a loan of 1200USD to invest in her clinic.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Đào Thị Thái, 60 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2002. Chồng chị ốm bệnh mất đã 7 năm, các con đều đã trưởng thành. Vốn có nghề thuốc gia truyền, vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 70USD để mua thuốc nam, khám và chữa bệnh. Với uy tín và tay nghề giỏi chị đã chữa khỏi cho nhiều người bệnh quanh vùng. Hiện nay chị có một cơ sở khám chữa bệnh và bốc thuốc nam tại trung tâm chợ Sóc Sơn. Bình quân một tháng chị Thái thu nhập khoảng 300USD. Vòng vốn này chị tiếp tục xin vay 1200USD để mua nguyên liệu làm thuốc.

loans.use: Buy herbal medicine

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
Maria Raquel is a young single mother who has a young son. She lives in the Hialeah neighborhood in Managua She has made a living by selling used clothing and cosmetics for 5 years. She is always working to diversify the variety of clothing that she offers.

She needs this loan to buy packages of used clothing to keep increasing her sales. Her previous credits have also helped her to invest in her business and to get ahead, giving her the necessary means to support her small son. Because she is a single mother, her situation is more difficult, but she has been able to advance and grow economically.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Maria Raquel es una joven madre soltera que tiene un pequeño niño varon, habita en el barrio Hialeah de Managua. Se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y cosméticos, desde hace 5 años y está siempre trabajando para diversificar la variedad de ropa que ofrece.

Requiere del préstamo para comprar pacas de ropa usada para seguir incrementando sus ventas. Los créditos anteriores solicitados le han ayudado también a invertir en su negocio y ha podido salir adelante, dandole el sustento necesario a su pequeño hijo. Por ser joven y madre soltera la situación le es más difícil pero ha podido ir avanzando y creciendo económicamente.

loans.use: To purchase packages of used clothing

loans.name: Gf Degoo Group

texts.fr:
Thiane, Anna and Mayron are three women who live in the outskirts of Mbour. To get out of poverty, they formed a group in order to develop their income-generating businesses. An initial loan of 250,000 CFA francs allowed them to start their businesses of selling various products (vegetables, fresh fish, dried and smoked fish and fruit juices).

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Thiane, Anna et Mayran sont trois femmes vivant dans la périphérie de Mbour. Pour sortir de la situation précaire dans laquelle elles vivent, elles se sont réunues en groupement afin de developper des activités génératrices. Un pret de 250.000 f CFA leur a permis de démarrer des activités de vente de divers produits (légumes, poissons frais, poissons sechés ou fumés, jus de fruits).

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru:
Nargis S. has three children. Her husband works as a handyman. He contracts out his services and there are days when he is not working.

Nargis needs to work without taking any days off. She sells candy and other sweets at the market. Currently she purchases products from wholesalers on credit and pays them back after selling the products. Nargis has to wait until she sells her inventory before getting additional products to sell. She learned about KIVA and has turned to MicroInvest for a loan, which will allow her to pay back her suppliers up front.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Наргис замужем имеет троих детей, ее муж работает мастером ремонтных услуг. У него сдельная работа, бывает дни когда он не работает. Ей приходиться работать без выходных. Она продает на рынке конфеты и другие сладости. Ее снабжают поставщики около 10 % товаром. Ей это помогало продавать сначала товар , а потом расплачиваться с поставщиками. Сейчас она узнала об кредите КИВА и обратилась в Микроинвест, что бы наличными расплачиваться с поставщиками. Также она приобретает конфеты по мере возможности, т.е, когда у нее есть реализация (это получается в неделю 2 раза)на эти деньги она приобретает товар.

loans.use: Purchase candy for sale

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoeurn K., 24, is a villager in Taing Klai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer who cultivates twice a year. During the rainy season, she cultivates rice while she grows vegetable in the dry season.

On her plantation, Mrs. Hoeurn K. now does not have animals to plow; thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen to plow the rice field for cultivation. Her husband, Mr. Hael Pheun, owns a small kiln where he can make charcoal to sell in order to assist his wife in paying the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy two oxen to plow the rice field for cultivation

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is 49 years old. She is married with 3 children, ages 31, 20, and 17. She has been a charcoal, pots, and small fish seller since 1998. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 9:00 PM at her business.

In the past, Mwanahamis has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Mwanahamis is now looking for a loan to buy more charcoal for re-sale to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for re-sale to expand her business

loans.name: Dakan (Le Destin) Group

texts.fr:
Les huit (8) membres du groupe Dakan de l’association Lolo du village de Kimparana (préfecture de San) sont toutes mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 8 enfants. Elles vivent en générale dans des foyers polygames dans la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième région économique du Mali).
Liés par des relations de voisinage et de parenté, les membres du groupe Dakan font essentiellement le commerce des produits cosmétiques, de fruits et légumes. 
Dans le souci d’avoir des ressources financières complémentaires le groupe intégra le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il est à son cinquième prêt de groupe (prêt solidaire). Tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficultés. Les prêts précédents ont permis d’augmenter la taille des activités et de fidéliser la clientèle.
Le groupe compte acheter, 20 cartons de produits cosmétiques de différentes sortes et une grande quantité de fruits et légumes. Pour les fruits et légumes elles s’approvisionnent sur place au marché de Kimparana auprès des forains ou producteurs venant des villages environnants. Quant aux produits cosmétiques l’achat se fait à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes. 
Les produits sont vendus à domicile, au marché de Kimparana et dans les foires des villages voisins à une clientèle généralement féminine.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 50.000 FCFA qui leur permettra d’aider les conjoints à supporter les charges familiales et d’augmenter le fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The eight members of the group Dakan (meaning "destiny") of the Lolo association in the village of Kimparana (San Prefecture) are all married and average 39 years of age and eight children. They generally live in polygamous households in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of Mali). Linked by ties of community and blood, the group members essentially do commerce in cosmetics, fruit, and vegetables.

Concerned about supplementary financial resources, the group joined the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which the members are on their fifth group loan (solidarity loan). All of the preceding loans have been repaid without difficulty. The preceding loans enabled them to expand their business and to earn the loyalty of their customers.

The group intends to buy 20 boxes of cosmetics of different types and a large quantity of fruit and vegetables. For these, they get their supplies locally at the Kimparana marketplace from market vendors or producers coming from surrounding villages. As for the cosmetics, the purchases are made iin Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesalers. The goods are sold out of the home, at the Kimparana marketplace, and in the fairs of neighboring villages, to customers who are generally women.

The group members each envision realizing a profit of 50,000 francs CFA that allows them to assist their spouses in supporting the family and to increase their working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Marta P. es muy esforzada y se dedica desde hace 12 años al negocio de venta de frutas y verduras comercializadas en el mercado La Estación de la ciudad de León. Es de importancia destacar que ella es madre de dos hijos y debido a que es soltera tiene el deber de mantenerlos ya que ella hace el papel de padre y madre a la vez.

Hoy en día la razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito el cual le permita la compra de los perecederos como lo son las frutas y verduras para continuar comercializándolas en el mercado La Estación de la ciudad de León.
texts.en:
Marta P. is a very hard working woman who has been selling fruit and vegetables for 12 years in “La Estación” market in the city of León. Marta is a single mother with two children. She is the only support to her children, being a father and a mother figure at the same time. Today, she is requesting for a loan from Ceprodel to buy non-durable goods such as fruit and vegetables to continue selling them on “La Estación” market in the city of León.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Mabel Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Mabel está solicitando su 1er crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de una habitación), trabaja como Admistradora de crédito de la Curacao,  a que no tiene hijos ella ayuda a su abuelita con sus gastos familiares  y le compra los medicamentos que ella necesita ya que por su edad se mantiene enferma, su esposo trabaja como policía y le ayuda con los gastos familiares, vive en la zona # 2 de Nueva Guinea, actualmente Mabel esta estudiando una licenciatura en la Universidad URACAN Recinto Nueva Guinea, su sueño es seguir estudiando, tener trabajo y salud, y poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda para tener mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Mabel is requesting her first loan in order to invest in home improvements (a room addition). She works as a credit administrator for a home appliance and furniture store called La Curacao. As Mabel has no children, she helps her grandmother with living expenses and buys any medicine she needs because her grandmother is in poor health due to her age. Mabel’s husband is a police officer and helps support the family, and they live in zone two of Nueva Guinea. At present Mabel is studying for her degree at the Nueva Guinea campus of URACCAN University. Her dream is to continue her studies, have her work and health, and to gradually make home improvements so the house is more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of an addition to the house

loans.name: Yuldosh

texts.en:
Yuldosh J. has been an agricultural producer for the past 10 years. He is the father of three children and he is focused on their education. His wife is a very hardworking woman who supports Yuldosh in his production activities in order to improve their lives. Aware of the needs of his family, Yuldosh requested and received a loan from IMON International a year ago. He used the loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for his harvest. He comes to IMON International today again to ask for a loan that will allow him to go on with his business and support his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Say

texts.en: R., 26, lives in the province of Pursat Province, Cambodia, where she owns and farms a plot of land next to her house, growing both rice and vegetables. She plants her crops twice a year. She was taught these farming techniques by her grandfather. She is currently a young mother of two children; both of them are still minor and under her care. She is married to Phoun, age 29, who works with her in the farming business. In the past, R. always hired a cow from a neighbor to help her in plowing farmland. Now, she hopes to purchase her own cow and has applied for a loan as capital in order to buy a cow.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr: Issa D., 48 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Goudomp depuis 3 ans.. Elle veut renforcer son commerce avec l'achat et le revente de thioub (tissus teintés). Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie et la prise en charge de la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Issa D., age 48, is married and has five children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Goudomp for three years. She wants to boost her commerce by buying and reselling thioub (dyed fabrics). This income enables her to improve living conditions and to cover the children’s schooling costs. She’s requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell dyed cloth

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr: Monsieur Saliou H. est un vieux qui habite au quartier Ndayane de Diourbel.  Il a une petite boutique de denrées alimentaires dans son quartier.  Ce prêt lui permet de renforcer ses marchandises dont les revenues lui permettent de nourrir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Saliou H. is an older gentleman who lives in the Ndayane district of Diourbel. He has a little grocery store in his neighborhood. This loan will allow him to purchase more merchandise and the income from his sales permit him to feed his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of merchandise for his little shop

loans.name: Vaimauli

texts.en: Vaimauli T., 61, is married with seven children. She has five years of experience in the taro plantation business. She sells to the village people and general public four days per week. Vaimauli has one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 80 tala. SPBD loans are Vaimauli’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will also spend part of this loan for her home improvement.

loans.use: To purchase knives, fertilizers, chemicals, cement, and iron roofing

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a direct seller of AVON products. She is 28 years old and married to Allan, a tricycle operator.  The couple was blessed with two children: Mark Angelo, 7 years old, an elementary student and Emmanuel, one year old.  Marites is happy that through their patience and hard work, her family is able to eat three times a day.  She hopes that they can continue to provide for the needs of their children.  

She would like to assist her husband in maintaining their tricycle. This is the reason why she is asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 that they will use for the maintenance of their tricycle.  By helping one another, they are positive that they can send their children to school.

loans.use: Tricycle Maintenance

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony N. is single with no children and has received an education through Senior High School. Anthony works as a businessman, selling phone units for all networks at Yamoransa in Cape Coast.  He has been in business since 2007.  Anthony uses his income to pay for his own school fees. Anthony will use the loan to purchase more phone card units in bulk and with his newly gained profits Anthony plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: Anthony will use the loan to purchase more phone card units in bulk

loans.name: A Primary School In Makeni Ii Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a Primary School in Makeni. Their school was built in 1985 to help educate the children of Makeni city and its surrounding villages. The school has a total of twelve staff and 450 pupils.

Teachers are one of the lowest paid workers in Sierra Leone. Because of this, many of them find other additional means of making a living. Some engage in businesses or agriculture and others organized extra classes for the pupils (though this is a practice the government is trying to abolish). Teachers therefore seek a loan in order to embark on meaningful projects and then, out of their monthly salaries, they gradually repay the loan.

Mabel C. (second from right) is a senior teacher at the school and head of this group. She is age forty-five. She was born in Matamp village in the Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and they have four children together. One of her children is already a grown-up and training as a lab technician, while two others (the twins) are in Junior Secondary School III (JSS III) and the last is in JSS I.

Mabel has been a teacher for over twenty-five years now. She will use this loan to buy a piece of land for the purpose of constructing a house. Buying a plot of land will improve her life, she told me. With subsequent loans, and with the little she has and will be saving, she will be able to build her house. She needs a home for her children and for her old age.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for constructing a house

loans.name: Oscar Moises

texts.es: El Joven Oscar Moisés Ampie, tiene la edad de 29 años, habita en el barrio Dennis Larios en la comunidad de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa, la cual le poya con las actividades del hogar, ellos tienen a su cargo un hijo, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, desde hace diez años se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas ,la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento ,   inicio esta actividad por cuenta propia , sus objetivos hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo ya que si le va mal en un producto se recupera en otro . Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertlitizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder lograr una mejor cosecha.
texts.en:
Oscar Moisés Ampie is young man who is 29 years old. He lives with his wife and child in the Dennis Larrios neighborhood of the Ticuantepe community. She helps with the household chores. Having worked in the agriculture business for ten years, Oscar plans to improve the living conditions of his family.

He experienced great difficulty starting his business due to a lack of funding. As a farmer, his goal is to grow a variety of crops so that if one particular crop isn’t profitable, then he is able to recover his losses through the sale of his other crops. With the loan he received, Oscar will purchase fertilizers and other supplies to cultivate his land and achieve a better harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and farming supplies

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (1038071564) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, H. operates a family member's business raising water buffalo to sell. H. has been engaged in this business for over 9 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. H. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be H.'s fifth loan from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima A. is married and has two children. She has received no formal education. Her husband is a sawmill operator.

Fatima runs a cold store where she sells frozen meat and fish at Abura, which she has done since 2007. She uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses.

Fatima will use the loan to buy more meat and fish to satisfy her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more meat and fish to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is married and has two children. He makes a living selling agricultural produce from his van. He buys produce in bulk in nearby villages and transports it to his customers. Vasil is known for selling fresh fruits and vegetables and has many regular clients. 

Vasil has been in this business for 15 years. It's not an easy way to make a living, because he has to be driver, delivery man and sales person all at once. But the business allows Vasil to provide for his family. He is a very optimistic person, and believes he can manage his work successfully, however hard.

Vasil would like to borrow $1,850 to buy more produce. Increasing sales would help him make more money and take better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy more produce to sell to his customers

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilina A. is engaged in fish selling. She is 32 years old and has six children, 16 years old is the eldest. She dreams of sending all her children to college to be able to provide them a brighter future. She started her business back in 1995 and until today, she sells fish.

She needs a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will definitely go far in buying fishing materials and fish to resell. 

She is truly amazed with CEVI's ways of educating people about savings and business. She is provided with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials and fish to resell

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris es una persona trabajadora y jovial, ella  tiene 30 años de edad y es madre de tres niños, todos menores de edad; se dedica a la costura (lencería) para ello cuenta con una máquina de coser y una remalladota; su esposo se dedica a la venta de madera. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “ Las  Heroínas” desde hace un año. Doris empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles y lo invirtió en el mantenimiento de su máquina de coser. Con este préstamo de 1800 soles, comprará telas, hilos, elástico y dará mantenimiento a su motokar. La meta  de Doris es tener su propio taller de costura y ser propietaria de un restaurant.
texts.en:
Doris is a hardworking and cheerful woman. She is 30 years old and is the mother of three young children. She is a lingerie seamstress and has a sewing machine, as well as a specialist sewing machine. Her husband sells wood. Doris has been a member of the “Las Heroínas” community bank for the past year. She began with a 300 PEN loan, and invested it in the maintenance of her sewing machine. With this loan of 1800 PEN, she will purchase fabric, thread, elastic, and invest in the maintenance of her “motokar”. Doris’ goal is to have her own sewing shop and to be a restaurant owner.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, elastic, and the maintenance of her 'motokar'

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Flor de María es una mujer dinámica  y trabajadora, tiene 30 años de edad, madre de dos niños, se dedica a la venta de artículos de pasamanería, su negocio es en su casa, cuanta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la venta de madera. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Esperanza”,su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en productos de pasamanería.  
Con este préstamo de 1200 soles, invertirá nuevamente en su negocio de pasamanería. La meta de Flor de María es poder llegar a tener una tienda bien surtida y también poner un negocio de venta de comida al paso, como por ejemplo salchipapas ,arroz chaufa, ya que su casa se encuentra ubicado en una zona muy transitable.
texts.en:
Flor de Maria is a 30 year old, dynamic, and hardworking woman. She is also the mother of two children who sells passementerie (the braids and tassels on drapes and upholstery) for a living. Her business is located in her home and she has help from her husband who works in wood sales. She is a member of the communal bank “Nuestra Señora de la Esperanza”. Flor de Maria’s invested her first loan of 300 soles in passementerie. She will again invest this loan of 1200 soles in her passementerie business. Flor de Maria's goal is to eventually have a well stocked shop. She would also like to start a business selling fast food like French fries, and fried rice since her house is located in a well trafficked area.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reinvest in her passementerie business.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es:
La señora Marisa vive en casa de sus suegros en la Av. Buenos aires de la zona de las lomas de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposo e hijo; se dedica a la venta de ropa juvenil como ser deportivos, poleras, etc., según la temporadas. Con esta actividad ayuda a su familia junto al esposo.
