Este comité del Barrio San Pedro Curupayty ha surgido por contacto de otro grupo formado en el mismo barrio. Se han realizado las reuniones requeridas para la conformación y actualmente el comité esta integrado por 15 mujeres trabajadoras.

Las actividades de estas señoras consisten en: despensas, costureras, peluquería, venta de ropas, venta de cosméticos, venta de mercaderías varias, venta de comestibles, venta de pescados, venta de ropa interior, venta de joyas de plata y otros.

Cada integrante recibe en promedio la suma de 800.000 Gs. El destino de estos créditos son para ampliar sus negocios con la compra de más mercaderías e insumos como ser: telas, hilos, botones, elásticos, cierres, harinas, panificados, productos enlatados, bebidas, prendas de vestir, artículos para el cabello, productos cosméticos, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, hair products, raw materials for preparing meals, meals, canned goods, rice, noodles and drinks in general, fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, elastic, lace, cosmetics, jewelry, seeds, purchase of seeds to grow, and others items

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita A. runs a grocery store in the Chanika area of Dar Es Salaam. She has been self-employed for the past six years, and learned her business and entrepreneural skills from an organization known as the Youth Self-Employment Foundation. She has applied for a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her grocery store

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 31 years old, married and has two children ages 12 and 5. In 2001, she went into business selling juice and biscuits. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25.

Fatma has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Chris

texts.en: Chris O. is 42 years old, and he is married with 4 children. He lives in Uromi Town, Edo State, Nigeria. He has been in the ice cream and drink selling business for the past 9 years. He also sews clothes and renders laundry services. He is a LAPO client. He needs the loan of $875 to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en:
Bakhtiyar A. is 33 years old and is married with one son. Bakhtiyar is a cattleman. He has been raising cattle for about 9 years. He works hard. His son is getting older and their needs are growing. He dreams of being able to provide his son and future children with everything they need. 

His business is quite stable and generates the main income for the family, but does not generate enough to expand the current business. He requests $1200 USD to purchase one cow and two calves. This is Bakhtiyar's first loan. He thanks all who support him for their trust, and he promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida has been selling juice and water in Zanzibar for three years. She begins work at 7 a.m. every morning and earns approximately $45 in profit each month. She intends to use her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more juice and water so that she can increase sales and profit at her shop.

Hamida is married and has five children, ages 18, 16, 11 and 3 years old and one infant of 2 months.

loans.use: To buy more juice and water to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en: Mrs. Sarum K. is a villager in Ream Ankdeouk Village in Kampong Chnang Province; she is a widow with two children who are both employed in a garment factory. She is a fruit seller in the local market, but as a widow it is difficult to make ends meet in her household. To improve her situation, she is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 Riel with a plan to use the loan to purchase a wider variety of fruit to resell and thus expand her customer base.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruit to resell

loans.name: Maria Asuncion

texts.es: La señora Maria Hernández tiene la edad de 56años,  habita en el sector de la Francia numero uno  ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo Y  hijas, su esposo  de la señora trabaja como transportista y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa al igual que sus hijas trabajan y aporta para los gastos del hogar, esta señora es comerciante y a la vez se dedica a la agricultura  desde hace treinta años la mayor dificultad que ha tenido es falta de financiamiento por lo cual no a sacado una producción muy buena por falta de insumos , los sueños de doña Maria es llegar a expandir sus cultivos para ayudarles a sus hijas y  brindarle un mejor  futuro .con esta solicitud va a comprar abonos y venenos para sus cultivo y lograr a si una buena producción, Por lo cual ella solicita la mano amiga de afodenic para obtener ferlitizantes necesarios a sus para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Maria Hernández is 56 years old and lives in Ticuantepe along with her husband and daughters. Her husband works as a driver and helps her with household expenses, and her daughter also work and help with the bills. Maria is a merchant and at the same time has been making a living as a farmer for the past 30 years. The biggest problem she has is a lack funding, which doesn't allow her to get a good yield from her crops because she can't afford enough planting supplies. Maria's dream is to be able to expand her crops so she can better help her children and provide them with a better future. With the loan she is requesting she plans to purchase fertilizer and insecticide for her crops and hopefully achieve a better yield. For this, she turns to Kiva partner AFODENIC so she can get the necessary fertilizers for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and insecticide for her crops

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 32 years old, married with 4 children of whom one is in school. This hardworking lady sells motor spare parts in Iganga town. She earns an average of Ush 500,000 profits per month, from which she pays Ush 100,000 monthly rent. The loan proceeds are helping Sarah purchase yana tyres, and some brake pads.

Based on her 5 years' experience in the business, Sarah now dreams of opening up a number of spare parts outlets around the country hoping the income from the business will enable her to build a modern residence for her family.

loans.use: To purchase yana tyres and some brake pads.

loans.name: Som Ol

texts.en: Mr. Som Ol M. is a villager in Tnaut Bak village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He is a rice miller who is a rice middleman. His wife, Mrs. Heim Neang, owns a small grocery store and also breeds pigs. Since her breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Som Ol M. is requesting a loan to buy 12 more piglets and pig feed for breeding. He hopes to increase his income and provide a better life for his family. He is 46 years old and the father of three children who attend the local school. His wife is shown in the photo to his left.

loans.use: To expand a pig-breeding business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina O. is thirty-five years old. She is a married woman with four children: two boys and two girls. She says one of her children is in senior high school, one is in junior high and the rest are in primary school. Her husband is a cocoa farmer.

Paulina lives with her family in a house in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region. Berekum is a busy business centre about twenty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Paulina trades in fresh yams to help support her husband financially. She says she also fries some for sale. She procures the fresh yams from Techiman, where the price is quite economical, then sells the yams on a table top in front of her house. She has been in business for ten years. Paulina wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure tubers of yams in bulk. She hopes to help her husband improve their standard of living and give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yams

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua D. is 50 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two boys and two girls. She says one of her children is learning a trade while the rest are in senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production. Her husband is a farmer and commercial driver.

Akua is into palm oil production. She procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. She says she also harvests some of the palm from her husband’s farm. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Akua wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to her increasing number of customers. She has been in business for 15 years and is hoping to improve her living standard and give her children the best support she can.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her palm oil business

loans.name: Fiataua

texts.en: Fiataua S., 70, is married with 11 children. She has two years of experience in the Plantation business. She sells to the village people and public four days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 425 Tala.  SPBD loans are Fiataua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase spades, wheelbarrow, fertilizer, and chemicals

loans.name: Chamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед и его жена живут в поселке городского типа Шуроб. Доход жителей данного поселка раньше был за счет угольной шахты расположенной неподалеку, так как все там работали. Сейчас шахта не работает и жители перебиваются различными видами заработков. Чамшед посоветовавшись с родителями решил открыть небольшой магазинчик и стал там торговать с женой. За товаром ездит Чамшед, а жена ему помогает в магазинчике. Чамшеду 24 года, имеет 2 детей. С МикроИнвест сотрудничает уже 1,5 года и сейчас собирается получить новый займ для расширения своего маленького бизнеса.
texts.en:
Chamshed and his wife live in a town-like village called Shurob. The income of the residents of this village previously came from a coal mine located nearby as everyone worked there. Now the mine does not work and the residents get by via different methods of earning money. Chamshed after discussing it with his parents decided to open a small store and started selling there with his wife. He travels to purchase products and his wife helps him at the store. Chamshed is 24 years old and has 2 children. He has worked with MicroInvest for 1.5 years now and now plans to take out a new loan to grow his small business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Paraiso Group

texts.es: Los miembros del grupo “Paraíso” están representados por la señora Melby y conformados por 12 miembros dedicados en su mayoría al comercio D. diferentes productos como cosméticos, comida, zapatos, ropa y abarrotes algunos D. los miembros se dedican a la elaboración D. muebles D. madera, al servicio D. peluquería y al transporte público pero todos ellos cuentan con una fuente D. ingresos. Dentro del mercado existe mucha competencia en la cual los socios deben competir por ganar clientes y poder generar un ingreso diario para el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la mejora D. sus herramientas D. trabajo, compra D. insumos y materiales para poder prestar un servicio D. mayor calidad y un producto más competitivo para el mercado. En lo que respecta a la experiencia una mayoría D. los socios ya trabajo con grupos solidarios en nuestra institución por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo y cuentan con la responsabilidad para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Paraíso" are represented by Señora Melby, and are composed of 12 members who for the most part work in the sale of different products such as cosmetics, shoes, clothing, food, and other groceries. Other members work in the manufacture of wooden furniture, haircutting, and in public transportation, but all of them currently rely upon a steady source of income. Within the market there is much competition in which the members must compete in order to gain customers and generate a daily income to sustain their families. This loan is designated to be put toward the improvement of the members' tools of work, and toward the purchase of goods and materials for their businesses, so that they will be able to offer higher quality services and more competitive products in the market. With respect to their experience, the majority of the members have already worked with affiliated communal banking groups, and have proven themselves to know the morality of work, and the responsibility they must exert to fulfill their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John O. is fifty-three years old, married, and has four children: three sons and a daughter. Some are in the senior high school while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Goaso is one of the busy business centres in the region. John’s wife is a trader.

John deals in hardware – paints, glue, locks, carpentry tools, etc. which he sells in a shop by the roadside. John buys his wares from big shops in nearby towns such as Kumasi. He has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure goods in large quantity. He is hopeful to expand his business and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy hardware in large quantity

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa K. est revendeuse de céréales au grand marché de Lomé. Agée de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Kossiwa désire avec ce crédit acheter des sacs de maïs, mils, haricots et riz pour la revente. Elle opère dans ce secteur depuis 6 ans.
texts.en:
Kossiwa K. is a retailer of grains at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three. She would like to use this loan to buy sacks of corn, millet, beans, and rice to sell. She has been operating in this field for six years.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, millet, beans, and rice for resale

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana vende mercadería como ser carteras, bolsas, chamarras de cuero.
Vive en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz. En casa alquilada.
El crédito será destinado para compra de mercadería ( Chamarras, carteras bolsas, de cuero).
Es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro y la quinta vez que solicita el apoyo de Kiva. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago se sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Juliana sells merchandise like leather wallets, leather bags, and leather jackets. She lives in the Irpavi II area in the city of La Paz in a rented house. The loan will be used to buy merchandise (leather jackets, leather wallets, and leather bags). This is the sixth time she has requested a loan from Impro, and the fifth time that she has requested the support of Kiva. Her history qualifies her as a good client in terms of making her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for investment

loans.name: Moses Wainaina

texts.en:
Moses K. is 24-years old and married with one child. He lives and carries out his business in the Githurai 45 neighborhood of Nairobi.

Moses shines shoes and sells secondhand clothes.  His clients are middle-class income earners in the urban setting. Before taking loans from KADET, Moses never borrowed from any MFI. He was introduced to KADET by a friend.

This will be his first loan and he is requesting it to set up a proper shop for shoe shining and selling secondhand clothes.  One day, he hopes to own a fleet of public transport vehicles.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To set up a shop for shoe shining and selling second hand clothes

loans.name: David

texts.es: David tiene 24 años, es un joven padre de familia que vive con su pareja y madre de su hijo, a quien ama mucho. Por el momento habitan en la casa de sus padres. Asimismo, ellos le facilitan sus chacras para que pueda realizar sus propias siembras, ya que aun no posee terrenos propios, adicionalmente también trabaja en los cultivos de papa de sus padres, quienes le pagan por su trabajo. Cuando su esposa le propuso sembrar arvejas, David aceptó muy contento tal propuesta, ya que ha visto que varios vecinos, gracias a este cultivo se han levantado rápidamente y él también espera tener buenas cosechas. Con las ganancias que vayan obteniendo desean construir su propia casa, en aras de evitar algún problema futuro por vivir todos juntos. Por lo demás, está muy contento con sus cultivos de arvejas y más aún porque no tiene que realizar mucha inversión en fertilizantes, puesto que usa las tierras que sus padres abonaron para la papa. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, durante el ciclo pasado pagó puntualmente sus cuotas y también asistió a todas las reuniones de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy bien en compañía de sus demás compañeros. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de dos bolsas de arvejas y fungicidas para evitar las plagas.
texts.en:
David is 24 years old and a young father. He lives with his common law partner and the mother of his son, whom he loves very much. At the moment, they live in his parents’ house. They also allow David to use their fields so that he can grow his own crops, since he does not yet have his own land. He also cultivates his parents’ potato crops, and is compensated for this work.

David’s wife suggested that he begin planting peas. He happily accepted her advice because he has several neighbors who are potential customers. Thanks to his wife’s suggestion, this crop is growing rapidly and he also hopes to have a good harvest. With the profits he will earn, he plans to build his own house to avoid problems that exist with his current living situation. He is very happy with his crop of peas because it doesn't require much fertilizer and it occupies the same land used for growing potatoes.

This is David’s second loan with MFP. During the last cycle, he made all of his payments and attended every one of his communal bank meetings, which was appreciated by the other members. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase two bags of peas (seedlings) and fungicides to prevent infestation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase peas (seedlings) & fungicides

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah M. is 38 years old and she is a 'sari-sari' store owner. Aside from that, she is also a rice farmer and pig-raiser in Trento Agusan Del Sur. She has two children and the 19-year-old is her eldest. Her husband is a farmer and both of them work hard on their farm and barn to have an abundant harvest and healthy pigs.

The reason why she wanted to apply for a loan from CEVI is to buy additional merchandise, rice seeds, and piglets. She also wishs to buy pig feed in case she is granted a CEVI/KIVA loan.

She likes CEVI so much because aside from loans, they are offering education for all their clients.

loans.use: additional merchandise, rice seed, and piglets

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda  es  una persona colaboradora y dinámica, tiene 66 años de edad, tiene seis hijos  mayores de edad y profesionales. Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, tiene un pequeño negocio frente a su casa, ella es muy conocida por ser una persona atenta . Integra el Banco Comunal “ Las Águilas”  desde hace cinco años y siempre ha sido una socia puntual. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en la apertura de su negocio actual. 
Con este crédito de S/. 1000 soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes, debido a que planifica aperturar una tienda de abarrotes con algunos productos básicos aptos para el consumo humano (arroz, azúcar, fideos, ,etc.). La meta de Florinda es tener una tienda bien surtida de productos y también tener una negocio de lubricentro, en esto va a trabajar con una de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Florinda is dynamic and helpful. She is 66, mother of 6 who are all adults and professionals. She works selling soft drinks and has a small business in front of her house. She is known as a courteous person. Part of the communal bank “Las Aguilas” for the past 5 years, her first loan was for 300 soles which she used to open her current business. With this loan of 1000 soles, she will invest in the purchase of groceries, since she plans to open a grocery store with some basic products for human consumption (rice, sugar, noodles, etc). Florinda’s goal is to have a well-stocked store and also to have an oil change shop where one of her daughters will work.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a supply of groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk for her business

loans.name: El Milagro 2 Group

texts.en:
Juana is the group coordinator for Banco de Esperanza (Bank of Hope) El Milagro (The Miracle).  Her story is representative of the others in her group and also more generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients.  Juana lives in Hato Mayor, a rural area in the Dominican Republic.  Her house has unreliable access to running water and electricity.  She lives in her mother's house with her three-year-old son. 

Juana has successfully completed three loans with Esperanza and this is her fourth.  She sells accessories and clothes from her home to others in her community.  She would like to continue to expand her business by finding new clients and selling more products. She wants to spend time looking for clients who are reliable and will pay her what they owe her for her products. 

Juana's dream is to someday have enough money to have her own house.  Right now she and her son live with her mother, but she hopes to make enough money with her business to be able to buy her own house.

loans.use: To buy accessories and clothes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The client is a breadwinner for the family of five. This is his second loan from the microfinance institution. His first loan was $2,500 for his mini-market. With that loan he was able to increase his income and make regular and timely loan repayments. This loan is to purchase a vertical refrigerator and inventory for his store.

loans.use: To buy a vertical refrigerator and inventory for his store

loans.name: Nelda Ebil

texts.es: Doña Nelda Ebil es soltera, tiene 2 niños,  una pequeña productora que está solicitando su 1er credito  para invertirlo en compra de ternero desarrollo y aumentar su inventario ganadero, se dedica a la actividad ganadera y agricola desde muy joven obteniendo ingresos económicos que le permiten el sosten familiar.  Nilda Ebil  posee su finca en una comarca de Nueva Guinea la cual presenta buenas condiciones técnicas para el desarrollo del hato gandero, también realiza todas las actividades de sanidad animal y nutricional brindandoles manejo fitosanitario para su inventario ganadero, sus hijos le ayudan al trabajo del campo, ella es una mujer emprendedora que lucha dia a dia con su pequeños niños para salir adelante, espera ser beneficiada con el fondo Kiva, su mayor sueño es tener buen inventario ganadero, para ayudarle al núcleo familiar y tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Nelda Ebil is single, and she has two children. She is a small producer who is asking for her first loan. She will buy a calf to raise and increase her cattle inventory. She has worked with cattle and in farming since she was very young. She was able to get income that allowed her to support her family. Nelda Ebil has a farm in the Nueva Guinea region. It has good conditions for raising herds of cattle. She also works in the area of animal health and nutrition. She manages the health for her inventory of cattle. Her children help her with the field work. She is a hard-working woman who fights day to day to get her small children ahead. She hopes to receive a loan from Kiva. Her biggest dream is to have a good inventory of cattle. This will help her family have economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy four calves

loans.name: Samrith

texts.en: P. has been married for years and is blessed with two kids. P. is a garment factory worker who gets a salary of $7 each month. Her husband, Khun Samphors, 38 years old, drives a motorbike taxi. Recently, P.’s husband hasn't been able to earn as much income as before, because his taxi is too old and not attractive to the customer. Because of that, P. is requesting a loan of $1000 for her husband to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Mrs. Julieta T., 44 years of age, is widow and is a resident of Bintana, Tangub City. She is blessed with 8 children. One of her children is married and three are still minors. To support her family, she buys and sells bananas in her area. Her neighbors provide her banana supply. She started this buy and sell business 6 years ago. She now earns an average net income of PHP 2500.00 a month. She is also supported by her children who work for different employers. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC just a year ago because she was interested in our products and services and because we are one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and won an award for being the Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006. As member of the PDP-LP Program, because of her outstanding credit record, she was able to borrow multiple loans. 

For her fourth loan, Julieta is privileged to to borrow PHP 14,000 to add her capital to her banana business. She will use the additional income that she earns from her investment for her family's basic needs and as savings for her children.

loans.use: Additional capital for her banana business

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en: Meriam B. is from the village of Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 37 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Meriam owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for almost five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Meriam joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. Meriam is now requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her sixth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion S. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old. Concepcion is married and has seven grown children. To make a living, Concepcion owns and operates a business of buying and selling of a variety of fruits and vegetables in the local community. Concepcion is just starting this business.

In 2009, Concepcion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Concepcion is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Pamela Sandra

texts.es:
La Srta. PAMELA, es una cliente que ingreso a la institucion el 2008, es una cliente que trabaja exclusivamente con la Institucion, de ahí que se lo toma en cuenta para que ingrese al programa Kiva, para cubrir sus nesecidades de estudios, ella se encuentra estudiando y trabajando a la ves es una persona responsable y trabajadora, tambien ayudar con la manutención de sus hermanos menores ya que ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, de su familia es la unica que trabaja, ella corre con todos los gastos del hogar.

El destino del credito sera para la compra de material escolar que le  ayudara para el crecimiento de su actividad, y fortalecimiento en su capital de trabajo.

La Srta. Pamela esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Pamela is a client who joined the institution in 2008 and works exclusively with us. She joined the Kiva program to cover her necessities for her studies. Currently, she is studying and working at the same time. She is a responsible and hardworking person who also helps support her younger brothers, who are of school age. In her family, she is the only one who works and takes care of all of the domestic expenses.. This credit will be used for the purchase of school materials, which will help her grow and strengthen her working capital. Pamela is very appreciative of Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided to her through the grant of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school materials

loans.name: Ourng

texts.en: Ourng R. is a villager who lives with other family members in Kampong Chhnang province. She cultivates a rice crop to make a living. She is a widow blessed with four children. Two are married, and the others are single. A daughter works as a dealer in a casino club. Ourng R. is taking out her loan to buy housing materials that she will use to construct a new house.

loans.use: To buy housing materials.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Mr. Sokhon K. is 43 years old and he is a villager who lives in Srae Vong village in TaK. province. He is a farmer who owns a 2 hectare field where he cultivates rice. His wife is a grocery seller and also a pig breeder, from which she can earn a small income to support her family.

Mr. Sokhon K. is now requesting 2,000,000 Riels from AMK to buy piglets, pig food, and the rest of the loan he will use to purchase supplies to support his farming activities. This couple has five children, one of whom is seamstress in the garment factory, another one is a laborer in Malaysia, while the other three are students in the local school and also help their parents' businesses. His wife is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy piglets, pig food, and farming supplies.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine R. is from the village of Olingan. She is 54 years old, is widowed, and has two adult and one school-aged children. Josephine owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used purchase feeds and vitamins for her new hog-fattening business. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and vitamins for her hog-fattening business

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has five people who are villagers in Pou Bay village in Takeo province. Mrs. Srey S. is the group leader who has been selected by the other four members.  They will all use their loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Srey S. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice for supporting her family and on the side she is also a pig breeder.  Her husband, Mr. Hieng Phrom, is a construction worker.

Although they try to work hard, they earn little income, so Mrs. Srey S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is the mother of a child who is enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to start a new business

loans.name: Enrique Avenamar

texts.es:
El señor Enrique Avenamar E. está agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual ye ayudo a que se negocio tuviera mas inventario. 
Está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía y material para la venta de helados ya que tiene la propuesta de distribuir su producto por varios centro comerciales de la ciudad. 
No cuenta con el dinero necesario para esta inversión es por eso que está solicitando su cooperación para esté otro crédito, y así invertir en el negocio para que tengo mas ingreso. Y con el cual planea pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Sr. Enrique Avenamar E. is grateful for the assistance of his previous loan, which helped him acquire more inventory for his business.

He is requesting a new loan in order to buy more merchandise and materials for selling ice cream. Enrique plans to distribute his product to various shopping centers throughout the city. He does not have the money needed to make this investment, so he is requesting your cooperation through another loan. This investment in his business will allow him to generate more income, which he will use to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making ice cream

loans.name: Dzhumataeva's Group

texts.en:
Dzhumataeva T. is the leader of the group and a resident of Karabalta. T. is 51 years old and a widow. She has raised five children: three sons and two daughters. All the children except the youngest son are married and live separately with their families. Her son always helps her with housework. T. has been engaged in cattle breeding activity for 25 years. The initial amount of her business activity was 16000 soms ($343.27). She took out a loan to buy a cow and now makes 8200 soms ($175.96) per month. Thanks to this profit, T. could buy a house and pay for her sons to marry. Now, she wants to take out a loan to purchase fuel and seeds needed for farming. In future, she plans to pay for her younger son to marry.

Ushunbaeva A. is the treasurer of the group. She's 40 years old and is married with a 22-year-old daughter and a 20-year-old son both of whom are students. A.'s husband always helps her with housework.  A. and her husband are engaged in cattle breeding and milk sales. Twenty years ago, they acquired livestock through inheritance so thanks to this, they earn 8200 soms ($175.96) per month and could pay for their children's education. A. wants to take out a loan to purchase fuel and seed potatoes. In future, they wish to buy a car.

Algozhoev R. is 42 years old and is married. He has a daughter and a son. His daughter is eight and studies at school while his son is preschool age. R. and his wife have been engaged in cattle breeding for 20 years. The initial amount of their activity was 18000 soms ($386.26), and from this money they bought a cow. As a result they make 9000 soms ($193.13) per month. They also bought home furniture and built a shed. So, now R. wants to take out a loan to buy fuel which is needed for the sowing process. In future, he plans to buy a car.

Djumalieva A. is 38 years old, is married and has raised three daughters. The older daughter is married, the others study at school. When the children have free time, they help A. with housework. A.'s husband works as a tractor driver. He's also engaged in cattle breeding. Twenty years ago, having an initial amount of 16000 soms, they bought a cow. So their monthly income is 14800 soms ($317.60). Thanks to this, they bought a vehicle and paid for their daughter to be married.  Now they need a loan to purchase fuel and seed potatoes.

Isakova C. is 53 years old and is married. She has three sons and a daughter. The older son is married and lives separately with his family, the second son works as a tractor driver and the younger one helps C. at home. The daughter is 19 years old and works in Bishkek. C. and her husband are engaged in cattle breeding. Several years ago they took out a loan of 18000 soms ($386.26) with which they bought a cow. As a result, they make 5900 soms ($126.60) per month. So, now C. wants to take out a loan to buy fuel, which is needed for farming. In future, she plans to build a house, to purchase a vehicle and to pay for her sons to marry. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan which delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase fuel and seeds needed for farming

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina vive en el distrito de Socos, tiene casa propia, es casada tiene 47 años y 6 hijos de los cuales solo 1 vive con ella. Albina tiene una tienda en donde vende verduras, abarrotes en general. Además Albina viaja a la ciudad de Lima en donde vende quesos, carne, panes que lleva de la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus ventas son de casa en casa. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite y jabón.
Lo sueños de Albina son seguir trabajando para ayudar en la educación de su hijo y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Albina owns and lives in a house in the Socos district. She is 47 years old, married and has six children, only one of whom lives with her. She has a store where she sells vegetables and other groceries. In addition, Albina travels to Lima to sell cheeses, meat, and bread that she brings from the city of Ayacucho, which she sells door to door. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of rice, oil, and soap. Albina's dream is to keep working and help her children with their education and to better stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, and soaps

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is married with four children of whom two attend higher secondary school. She rents a house with electricity but no piped water and her greatest monthly expenses are transport and food. She hopes to use the Kshs 25,000 loan to pay school fees for her two children.

Jacinta has been selling vegetables from her home to her neighbors for the past six years. Her other source of income is her husband’s salary. She cites transportation and competition as her major challenges.

Jacinta hopes to become a wholesaler at the market someday. She decided to join Yehu so as to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To pay school fees for two of her children and to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: El Haddji Djibril

texts.fr: Monsieur El Hadji Djibril C. est un jeune électricien  de 30 ans qui habite à Whakhinane a Guediawaye. Il a vécu  15 années de dur  apprentissage. Il  est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis aout 2006. Actuellement il a note un ralentissement de son activité  et c’est la raison pour laquelle il sollicite un crédit  de 100 000 frs pour démarrer  une activité  de commerce qui lui permettra de gérer  les périodes  de non fonctionnement  de sa profession. Il est célibataire, mais les revenus qui seront générés par son activité  lui permettront d’assister ses parents et aussi de se prendre en charge financièrement. Il a aussi l’intention de développer  son épargne.
texts.en:
Mr. El Hadji Djibril C., aged 30, is a young electrician who lives in Whakhinane, in Guediawaye. He has fifteen hard years of experience in an apprenticeship. He has been a member of the Baye Laye credit association since April 2006. At present, he has noticed a slowdown in business, and this is the reason for his request for a loan of 100,000 francs in order to start up a business that will enable him to manage when his work is slow. He is unmarried, but the revenues that will be generated from his business will allow him to help his parents and also to support himself financially. He also intends to develop his savings.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo por los que siempre ha luchado. Maria tiene 9 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de pan, los cuales distribuye luego a los negocios cercanos. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues han sido de gran ayuda. Pues sus esfuerzos han dado resultados por la difícil tarea que realiza a diario para mantener a su familia. Siempre está soñando con mejorar cada día su actividad y ofrecer la mejor calidad de pan. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de harina, huevo, mantequilla, queso y leche ya que mantiene almacenada estos productos para que cuando suban los precios no le afecten en la elaboración de sus postres.
texts.en:
Maria is responsible for two young children, for whom she has always worked hard. For 9 years she has baked bread, which she then distributes to nearby businesses. This is not the first time that she has taken out a loan, since they have been a great help. Her efforts have given results through the difficult work that she completes every day to support her family. She is always dreaming of improving her business every day and offering the best quality bread. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of flour, eggs, butter, cheese, and milk, since she stocks up on these products so that when the prices rise they will not affect the production of her desserts.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angelica vive en casa con sus tres hijas, una de las cuales se encuentra culminando sus estudios superiores, motivo por el cual Angelica desea invertir en la titulación de su hija, para lo cual ella es esfuerza mucho trabajando en su panaderia-bodega que tiene en su casa, sus clientes son los vecinos de la zona quienes regresan siempre ya que ella los atiende con gran simpatia y amabilidad, el sueño de Angelica es poder expandir su panaderia y poder tener asi mayores ingresos para la munutención de sus hijas, se le otorga el crédito por contar con capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Angelica lives at home with her three daughters. One of them is finishing her bachelor’s degree. Angelica wants pay for her daughter’s graduation expenses. In order to do that she is putting forth much effort working in her bakery-general store, which is in her house. Her customers are her neighbors in the area. They always return because she waits on them with great congeniality and kindness. Angelica’s dream is to be able to expand her bakery. She also dreams of being able to have more income to support her daughters. She qualifies for the loan because of her ability to pay.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her daughter's graduation expenses

loans.name: Laurente

texts.en: Laurente F. is from the village of Gata Daku Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 42 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Laurente owns and operates a business providing motor transport "habal-habal" (a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2 - 6 passengers) services. Laurente has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2004, Laurente joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laurente has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Laurente is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Laurente from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Creciendo Para El Futuro 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Veronica is the coordinator of her group Creciendo para el futuro 4 & 5. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have her own store.  In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy being dedicated to her business.

Veronica is excited to be taking her 3th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 3 years after she started selling 4 to 5 pieces of clothes at home every month. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying pants, shirts, accesories and bed linen. She will use the profits to buy school supplies, to invest in more products, and she is planning to buy a computer; she also wants to have telephone service and to have a store with all kinds of merchandise. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she need the loan to her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy clothing and bed linen

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita B. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba Mismais Occidental. She is 53 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. Nenita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, canned goods, powdered soap, diapers and cotton in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Nenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Nenita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en: Mahmud is married and has two children. For the last eight years, he has made a living running a grocery store that offers a large variety of foods. It's a great place to shop because customers can buy everything they need in one place. He also has good prices and discounts that help him to attract new clients and retain existing ones. Mahmud has applied for a loan to increase his inventory of items to sell. His goal is to continue to expand his business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs to increasing the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel started working in the trucking business to travel and see new things. Trucking companies contract Miguel and his truck to transport goods all over the country. After 5 years of use, the tires and engine of this particular vehicle are now wearing down and eventually the truck will stop running. In order for Miguel to continue working, he has to make the necessary repairs to his truck. Without a loan, Miguel would have to find another job. While this loan will not create a job, it is of equal importance in that this small loan will help Miguel retain his job so he can continue supporting his family of six.

One day, Miguel hopes to enter the real estate business. After his son graduates from school, they plan to build homes together.

loans.use: To repair his truck

loans.name: Tomasa Candelaria

texts.es: Doña Tomasa, tiene 34 años de edad, soltera, tiene oficios domesticos, labora como conserje en una establecimiento educativo, con lo devenga un salario para su sostenimiento. ha laborando de hace un buen tiempo y tiene deseos de superacion, ya que solocita un prestamo que le servira para compra de libros, los cuales le servira para tener un mejor conocimiento en cuanto a la actividad que realiza. Quiere superarse intelectualmente, para que de esta forma devengar un mejor salario.
texts.en: Tomasa is 34 years old, single and does domestic work. She works as a janitor in an educational establishment thereby earning a salary for her support. She has been working for a good time and has desires to get ahead since she is requesting a loan which will be used to buy books which she'll use to gain better knowledge of the job she performs. She wishes to move forward intellectually so she can earn a better salary.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jose Aben

texts.es: José Aben tiene 30 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de barbería. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio. El aprendió por que anteriormente aprendía en otra barbería, José puso mucho empeño en él para aprender este negocio así con los pocos ahorros que obtuvo logro establecer su propio negocio y está ubicado en lugar en donde es muy visitado por diferentes personas el ofrece una muy buena calidad de corte a sus clientes y también se esmera en brindar buen servicio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de tijeras, talcos, espumas, brochas entre otros productos que son necesarios. Sueña con mejorar su negocio y su hogar.
texts.en: José Aben is 30 years old.  He works as a barber.  He has been in this business for more than 6 years.  He learned his trade in another barber shop where he used to work.  José put a lot of effort into learning the business and used the small amount of savings which he had to set up his own business which is located in a place where he gets a lot of different customers.  He offers a very good quality of cut to  his customers and takes care to provide a good service.  He is requesting a loan to buy scissors, talcum powder, shaving foam and shaving brushes as well as other necessary products.  He dreams of improving his business and his home.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa Dolores

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 53 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Motupe, una zona conocida por sus festividades religiosas que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con un pequeño establecimiento ubicado en el centro de su domicilio en donde suele ofrecer en venta ropa y calzado para todo público. Como ya cuenta con varios años de experiencia su establecimiento es uno de los más conocidos de la zona. Ella se ha valido de este negocio para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Rosa desea adquirir más mercadería con motivo de la proximidad de las fiestas navideñas, ya que la demanda durante esta temporada suele aumentar, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Rosa es bastante conocida en la zona por su buen carácter y porque siempre gusta de ayudar a los demás. Ella es muy querida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 53, is a mother living with her family in Motupe, an area known for its religious festivals, located in Lambayeque province over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small establishment in her home where she sells clothes and shoes to the general public.  Since she already has several years experience, her establishment is one of the better known ones in the area.  She has relied on this business to help her husband support the family’s economy.

Rosa wants to acquire more merchandise due to the approaching Christmas festivities because this is when demand rises.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan.

Rosa is quite well known in her area due to her good character and because she always likes to help others.  She is very loved and esteemed by her neighbors.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Zenaida Rosana

texts.es:
Zenaida es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en la ciudad de Lambayeque, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
 
Ella cuenta con un establecimiento en su domicilio, en donde vende comida todos los días, sus principales clientes son los estudiantes y trabajadores de la zona, además complementa su negocio con un pequeño puesto de venta de golosinas. El negocio cuenta con mucha acogida debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus alimentos y al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes. Con los ingresos que ella percibe de estas actividades se encarga de ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Zenaida desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más insumos, de modo que pueda preparar más platos de comida y percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales pretende lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Zenaida is a 44 year-old mother who lives with her family in the city of Lambayeque.  This is quite a commercial area which is located more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Zenaida has an establishment in her home where she sells meals every day.  Her main customers are local students and workers.  She also complements her business with a small sales stall where she sells candy.  Her business is very popular owing to the good taste of her food and the good service which she provides.  She uses the profits she makes from this business to help her husband support their family financially.

Zenaida would like to expand her business, acquiring more supplies so that she can prepare more meals and make more profits on her sales.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa that she will use to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy supplies to expand her business selling meals

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en: Natalia belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. She is 25 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children. Natalia is a street vendor selling toys. She also sells food in the mornings in the bus terminal to Quillabamba, Peru. She is requesting the loan to invest in her businesses. Natalia is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in toy sale and food business

loans.name: Delia's Group

texts.en:
Delia S. is from the village of Casalatan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 45 years old. Delia is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Delia is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a business selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables to the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Delia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used for working capital and to purchase additional inventory. Delia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es: Rosa Lidia A. de 68 años habita con su esposo en San Salvador, en casa de un sobrino quien los ha dejado a cargo; ella es una señora mayor pero con un espíritu de superación, por lo cual decidió montar un negocio de comida que esta ubicado en las cercanías de la Universidad de El Salvador, adonde es ayudada por su compañero de vida elaborando alimentos para desayunos y almuerzos que son comercializados entre los alumnos de dicha universidad.Este es un trabajo pesado pero es la única fuente de ingreso para su hogar y es la forma en la que ellos mantienen todas sus necesidades; el préstamo solicitado es  para la compra de más materia prima como arroz, frijoles, maíz y algunos vegetales; además de bebidas y golosinas, también se espera hacer un  mejoramiento de su pequeño negocio que esta hecho de láminas y así poder hacerlo crecer al igual que sus ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa Lidia A. is 68 years old and she lives with her husband in San Salvador. They live in a house belonging to a nephew. She is an older person but she has the will to improve, which is why she has decided to set up a food stall near the university in El Salvador. She gets help by her life partner to make the breakfast and lunch foods that are sold to the students at the university. It is hard work but it is the only source of income for their household and it is the way they are able to provide for all of their needs. This loan will be used to purchase ingredients such as rice, beans, corn, some vegetables, soft drinks, and snacks. They will also carry out some improvements to their small stand. It is made of aluminum sheeting and they want to expand the stall as their earnings grow.

loans.use: To purchas vegetables and basic grains.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 35-year-old married man living in Bibt Jbeil with his wife and two children. Jihad has been working in transportation for 20 years.  He transports general construction materials. He used to drive others' trucks but seven years ago he bought his own and everything had changed since that time.  His income became better and he became more ambitious about buying another truck in the future.

Jihad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new wheels for his truck. Most of his clients are construction builders and neighbors who may need him to transport furniture or other heavy things.

loans.use: To buy new wheels for his six-wheel truck

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Byambabaatar

texts.en: Byambabaatar, 49, is married and lives with his wife and four children in Uvs, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on the outskirts of town. His two older children attend college while the younger two attend a local secondary school. He and his wife are both doctors who operate a pharmacy in addition to their regular jobs. Their business is very helpful for the ger-district residents who live far from downtown. Their current working capital is 1,500,000 MNT and their monthly gross income is 350,000 MNT. They want to expand their business and enlarge their pharmacy by increasing the amount of drugs they sell. Byambabaatar is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT for this purpose.  He is a sociable person who says: “I want to expand my business and enlarge my pharmacy and open a private hospital with a laboratory.”

loans.use: to purchase more medicine for his pharmacy

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 33 years old, married, and the mother of one. She runs a food stall so as to earn a living. She has been running the business for two years. She joined a group in Faulu Kenya so that she could save money, get business ideas, and access loans easily. She has been guaranteed a loan of 15,000 KES by the group members. She will use the loan to buy cooking fat, potatoes, plates, and cups. In five years, she sees herself running a big hotel.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, potatoes, plates, and cups

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 46 años, es soltero, y reside en Monsefú, distrito de Chiclayo, el cual está ubicado a 20 minutos del centro de Chiclayo.  Este distrito es conocido como Capital de las Flores, esto por la producción elevada de flores en esa comunidad.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace mas de diez años.  Contando a la fecha con un campo de cultivo donde siembre todo tipo de grano .  Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le ayudan en sus gastos personales y los de su familia.

Actualmente ha sembrado maíz en su terreno de cultivo y se encuentra trabajando arduamente para que esta siembra le brinde una buena producción, por este motivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes con los cuales brindará mantenimiento a su maíz.
texts.en:
Victor is 46 years old, single, and resides in Monsefú in the District of Chiclayo, which is located twenty minutes away from central Chiclayo. This district is known as “Capital de Las Flores” (The Capital of Flowers) since there is a higher production of flowers in the community.

Victor has been performing farm work for more than ten years. At the time he started, he acquired a plot of land on which he grows all types of grain. The income that he generates from this activity helps him cover his personal expenses and those of his family.

At the moment, Victor is growing corn on his farmland and is working hard to make sure that his crop results in good production. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN to invest in the purchase of fertilizers to maintain his crop of corn.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh  T. N.  is  45  years old with 2 children  who are attending University and College. To provide  good education conditions, she has to work very hard.  Anh is mostly focused on growing  rice, vegetables and raising chickens for meat. This meets her family's  food needs.  Being a client of our credit program since 2007, she has used loans effectively in expanding farming. For this reason, her loan sizes are higher year after year. Now, Anh needs to have a loan of 7,630,000 VND to buy  fertilizer for her next crop.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizer for the next crop.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 25, is a farmer living in the Kitale area of western Kenya. He is married though not yet blessed with children. He has been active in mixed farming for the past three years, producing and selling eggs, tomatoes and onions to the local market.

John has requested a loan of 31,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This will be his second loan with Juhudi Kilimo. He says the milk produced will supplement his family meals and the income generated will be used to expand his business so as to cater for the family's future needs, such as education. He hopes to make a strong foundation for his family out of the farming business. John adds that water is still a challenge during dry seasons. 

He is focusing on repaying this loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old and married with three children who all attend school. She has been raising chickens for the last fifteen years and sells her eggs at the local market. She also earns income from her grocery shop in Kitale, western Kenya. Her main difficulty is facing the challenge of poultry diseases, which are rampant and expensive to treat.

Rose has requested this loan of 60,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase an additional flock of chickens and chicken feed. She says that with this loan she will be able to practice commercial poultry farming, and this will increase her margin. She hopes that the extra income from this project will help improve her family's standard of living.

Rose would like to be the major supplier of eggs at the local market in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional flock of chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr: Née en 1976 au Bénin, Alimatou est mariée à Issa, un commerçant. Le couple à quatre enfants, tous à charges et scolarisés. Trois sont leurs propres enfants. Alimatou n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Alimatou prépare de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs, igname, accompagnés de diverses sauces) qu'elle vend dans son quartier depuis près de huit ans. Grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité, Alimatou contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Alimatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin.  Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour améliorer son niveau de vie et son revenu, Alimatou sollicite pour une troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Born in 1976 in Benin, Alimatou is married to Issa, a shopkeeper.  The couple has four children under their care and attending school.  Three are their own children.  Alimatou never attended school.  To help meet her and her children’s needs, for about eight years she has been preparing food (rice, corn mush, yams, accompanied by various sauces) to sell in her neighborhood.  She buys her ingredients in the market of Benin.  Thanks to her income from this business, Alimatou helps to pay her family’s various expenses.  With the goal of satisfying her customers and improving her quality of life and her income, Alimatou is requesting her third loan through ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, corn, yams, and condiments.

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es: Doris Elizabeth de 38 años de edad, vive en casa de su esposo con sus 2 hijos de 17 y 15 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando. Doris trabaja duramente para sacar adelante a su familia y poder darles lo que ella nunca tuvo. Ella se dedica a la venta de artículos de belleza como lociones, cremas, champo, jabón con aroma, cosméticos etc. Este negocio lo hace de manera ambulante en la zona donde reside y en los alrededores de su comunidad. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que es una mujer amable y muy honesta en su trabajo siempre garantiza calidad en los productos que ofrece y además los precios y variedad de productos que ofrece es lo mejor.  Ha decidido aumentar  la variedad de productos que ofrece para que los clientes puedan tener más opciones a la hora de seleccionar o solicitar el producto que desean. Con la fe puesta en Dios de ver florecer su negocio a decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar variedad de cosméticos, lociones tanto para hombre como para mujer, cremas, jabones con aroma, desodorantes, etc. Y de esta manera espera lograr mejorar su calidad de vida y ofrecer a sus hijos una realidad diferente a la que ella tuvo.
texts.en:
Dora Elizabeth is 38 years old and lives at home with her husband and two children (ages 17 and 15) who are in school. She works hard so that she can help her family get ahead and provide them with what they need. Dora sells beauty products such as lotions, crèmes, shampoo, scented soaps, cosmetics, and other items. She operates her business as a traveling vendor in the area where she lives and in the surrounding areas. Dora has many customers because she is a friendly and honest woman. She always guarantees the quality of her products and offers a variety of merchandise at the best prices. Since she decided to increase the variety of products that she offers, her customers have more options from which to select or they can request the products that they want.

Dora places her faith in God to see her business prosper, so she decided to request this loan from Apoyo Integral to buy a variety of cosmetics, lotions for men and women, crèmes, scented soaps, deodorants, and other items. She hopes this loan will help her improve her quality of life and provide her children a different path than the one she has taken.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cosmetics, lotions for men and women, crèmes, scented soaps, deodorants, and other items.

loans.name: Mahukpego De Agbato Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUKPEGO DE AGBATO est composé de quatre personnes qui habitent la même localité C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe du nom de Toussaint est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Toussaint a 57 ans et vit au Bénin. Toussaint est une veuve qui a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et qui ne sont plus à sa charge. Pour subvenir à ses propres besoins, Toussaint mène comme activité depuis onze ans la vente de la pâte du manioc qu'elle prépare. Toussaint s’approvisionne en manioc dans l’un des plus grands marchés du  Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Toussaint sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKPEGO DE AGBATO, un premier crédit.
texts.en: The Mahukpego de Agbato Group is made up of four people who live in the same area.  This is the first time that this group has asked for financing from ALIDé in order to enhance the capacity of their business.  The group representative is Toussaint; she is the one raising her hand in the photo.  Toussaint is 57 years old and lives in Benin.  Toussaint is a widow and has four children, all educated, who no longer live with her.  In order to support each of their needs, for eleven years, Toussaint has taken up the sale of prepared casava.  Toussaint purchases her raw casava at one of the largest markets in Benin.  In pursuit of better satisfying her clients and to increase her sales and revenues, Toussaint and the other members of the Mahukpego de Agbato Group are asking for their first loan.

loans.use: to purchase casava.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: For almost three years Cristina, 46 years of age, married, and blessed with three children, has operated a food stall in her village selling fruits, vegetables and some grocery items. Now requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items to sell such as canned goods, noodles and bread, Cristina would like to continue receiving loans to aid the growth of her business and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles and bread to sell.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine‘s group is comprised of two hardworking women. Christine is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala Central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Christine has a beauty salon business, which she has run for two years.         
To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hair braids for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.  
Christine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has aided her prospects for the future by helping her to pay her school fees from the earnings from her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair braids for resale.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad has owned a barber shop since 2010. He is 24 years old, married and has one child. This borrower is from Iraq. He has good experience and a deep understanding of local consumers. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

Mohamad decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to buy a generator and to make an outdoor ceiling and a lighting ad board. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can have the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a generator and to make an outdoor ceiling and a lighting ad board.

loans.name: Merys De Jesus

texts.es: Merys de 26 años de edad vive en el municipio de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolívar, con su hijo de 2 años. Su negocio data desde cuando su hermano vendía mercancía proveniente del municipio de Maicao en el departamento de la Guajira y con toda esta experiencia Merys, hace 4 años empezó su aventura de negocio con poca mercancía, distribuyéndola a crédito entre su mercado inicial de familiares, vecinos y amigos. Gradualmente su creciente clientela empezó a reconocerla y a solicitarle, ropa, electrodomésticos menores etc. y  con esto ella amplió un poco su espectro. En la actualidad vende a crédito en plazos pactados uno a uno, con sus clientes, recupera su dinero semanalmente, mensual y quincenalmente, de acuerdo a lo convenido con ellos. Su credikiva es su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cortinas, abanicos, licuadoras y mercancías que tiene encargadas y con esta inversión estaría aumentando su capital de trabajo.
