Su sueño más adelante, es tener un almacén para vender al por mayor y con sus ingresos educar a su hijo, con un nivel de calidad para cumplir su gran propósito de ayudarlo a ser exitoso. Mientras esto ocurre, Merys trabaja en su negocio manejando una liquidez de 16 a 1 o sea que por cada $1COP tiene $16 COP para responder y  desde aquí, con sus inyecciones de capital de trabajo producto de sus credikiva, planea su crecimiento futuro.
texts.en:
Merys, 26, lives with her two-year-old son in the town of San Jacinto in the department of Bolívar.  Her business dates back to when her brother was selling merchandise that came from the town of Maicao in the department of La Guajira.  With this experience, Merys began her business venture four years ago with a small amount of merchandise, distributing it on credit to her initial market of family, neighbors, and friends.  Gradually her growing clientele began to recognize her and ask her for clothing, small electric appliances, and so on, and from there she expanded her range a little.  At present Merys sells on credit in terms agreed upon individually with her customers; she recovers her money weekly, twice a month, and monthly, in accordance with each agreement.

Her Kiva loan is her first funding from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Merys will buy curtains, fans, blenders, and merchandise that has been ordered, and with this investment she would be increasing her working capital.  Her long-term dream is to have a store for selling wholesale and, with her earnings, educate her son at a level of quality that fulfills her objective to help him be successful.  In the meantime, Merys is working on her business managing a liquidity of 16 to 1, or better said, for every 1 Colombian peso she has 16 in reserve, and, from this point, with the injection of working capital from her Kiva loan, she is planning her future growth.

loans.use: to buy curtains, fans, blenders, and merchandise that has been ordered.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda, 42 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is an electronics repairer with an income of $15 per day.  Her husband teaches electronics repair  to get  additional income. This couple has five children and all of them are studying.  Every month, Chenda has to spend $80 on food, $10 on electricity, $50 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy electronic spare parts for her husband's business.  In the future, Chenda's husband wants to expand his career and teach more students. Chenda wants her children to at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy electronic spare parts for her husband's business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del banco comunal Siete Estrellas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 57 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 6 hijos mayores.
Son cinco años  que lleva trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos  y se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catálogos, negocio que viene realizando por muchos años.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 juegos D. aretes, 3 lápiz delineadores, 1 rubor, 1 polvo para cara, 1 base, 2 labiales, 3 shampoo, 2 cremas para el cuerpo, 2 enjuagues, 1 fijador D. cabello.  Cuenta con una pequeña vitrina donD. exhibe sus productos en stock.
Estos son productos que están en ofertas, aprovecha en comprarlos para venderlos a crédito o al contado y conseguri más ganancias y sobre todo recuperar el dinero invertido para seguir trabajando.  Su dedicación es exclusiva porque el beneficio es para ella, por ello se esfuerza.
D. Manuela Ramos ha recibido el apoyo económico que necesitaba para surtir y ampliar su negocio, está tranquila porque vive tranquilamente gracias a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Señora Juana is a memeber of the Siete Estrellas (Seven Stars) Community Bank in Calleria district, Ucayali department. She is 57 years old, a widow, and has six adult children.

She has had loans with Manuela Ramos for five years and earns her living selling beauty products from a catalog, a business she's had for many years.

With this new loan of S/.3,000 she plans to buy boxes of the following: two of earrings, three of lip liners, a blush, one face powder, one base, two lipsticks, three shampoos, two body lotions, two conditioners, one hairspray. She has a small display case in which to show her stock.

These products are currently on sale, and Juana wishes to take advantage of this by buying them now so she can sell them on account or for cash and earn more money. Most of all she wishes to get back the money she has invested by continuing with her work. She makes a great deal of effort as she is the one who stands to benefit from the results. 

From Manuela Ramos she has received the financial support she needed to stock and expand her business. Juana is at ease because she leads a quiet life thanks to her work.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, lotions etc.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is on track to repay her first loan in full and on time. She and her family are doing well and her business has grown steadily since receiving the loan. She now wants more assistance so she kindly requests another loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 61-year-old married woman. She has 10 children with ages ranging from 15 years to 39 years. She describes herself as quiet and likes to share ideas. She operates a stall where she sells bananas, mangoes, sugar cane, cassava and others. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy shopping centre. 

Rose describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to add stock of cassava, sugar cane and other fruit. Her business goal is to grow her business into wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her last-born child at the university.

loans.use: To buy cassava and sugar cane.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth has had seven years experience in farming in her home area of Litein, South Rift, Kenya. Her farm produces tea and milk for the local market.  She also runs a retail shop to supplement her farming income. She is married and has five children, ranging in age from 2 to 13 years.

Janeth has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She says she will be able to provide for the family’s basic needs with much ease. She is optimistic her businesses will continue to improve in the future.

Janeth says rampant drought is the major challenge in farming.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gauda

texts.en:
Gauda is a 49-year-old married woman with five children, and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been dealing in the production of maize and bananas for ten years. She was initially producing for home consumption and now is on a commercial basis. 

Her hardship is price fluctuation and her vision is a well established poultry farm plus an educated family.

Gauda needs the loan to buy chickens for rearing.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He is married and has three school going children. He runs a chemist (pharmacy) which has been in operation for the last three years. He employs two more people in his current business.
He was invited to Milango by his colleague and decided to join in order to access credit to fund his business. Joshua is applying for a loan of Ksh 100,000 to purchase more pharmaceutical drugs and cosmetics for sale. Joshua sees no major challenge facing his business. His business is located in an area of much activity. It is believed that the market next to his premise is the largest open air market south of the Sahara.
The extra income will help Joshua provide good education to his children. He also intends to open a cereal shop from the income.

loans.use: To purchase more pharmaceutical drugs and cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Weuya W.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Weuya W Group in Western Kenya! Selina is the facilitator of the Weuya W group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Selina takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds at a cheap price and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Selina had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Selina was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Selina and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Selina will educate her children and repay her loans.

In 2012, the members of Weuya W group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Selina with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 40 years old, and married to Wairimu. They have four children.

Nelson has been in the welding business for the last 11 years. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his fourth loan, this one for KES 45,000. He repaid his previous loans on time. 

He intends to use this loan to buy more welding machines and to improve the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy more welding machines.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es: La joven Sandra Milena a sus 25 años en madre soltera de una hija de 4 años por quien decide iniciar su propio negocio de venta de prendas de vestir femenina con el animo de poder generar los ingresos necesarios para su sostenimiento puesto que no cuenta con el apoyo de padre de su hija. La joven Sandra Milena cuenta con experiencia de 5 años en esta labor que espera realizar a la par con su trabajo en una empresa de flores en la cual trabaja únicamente en las mañanas. Para iniciar su negocio, la joven Sandra Milena necesita de la compra de surtido en prendas de vestir femeninas que pueda ofrecer a sus familiares y amigos. El sueño de la joven Sandra Milena es tener su propio almacén de venta de ropa y brindarle a su hija una excelente educación y bienestar.
texts.en:
Sandra Milena is a young woman who is 25 years of age and a single mother of a four-year-old daughter. She decided to start her own business of selling women’s clothes. Sandra is excited about generating the necessary income to support her family since she does not receive assistance from the father of her daughter. Young Sandra Milena has five years of experience in this type of work. For the past two years, she has been employed at a florist where she only works in the mornings.

In order to start her business, young Sandra Milena needs to buy women’s clothes that she can offer to her relatives and friends. Her dream is to have her own clothing store so that she can support her daughter and provide her with an excellent education.

loans.use: to buy women's jeans, blouses, and undergarments for starting her business.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
This is Daisy.  She is 42 years old and a resident of Manila, Philippines.  She is married to Jacinto, an employee, and a mother to her five children.  Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business.  At this time, she is working hard to provide a consistent income to meet everyday expenses.  

Daisy operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages in small quantities to individuals in the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil or a single egg.  She earns money by acquiring supplies in bulk at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece.  She also sells cooked viand, or food items and tasty dishes, to earn additional income.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Daisy is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP.  She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Daisy hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future by working hard on her business.  She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Road To Success Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is the leader of this group. He was born in Malal Marah, a big village in northern Sierra Leone. He is forty five years of age. Mohamed is married to a petty trader and the couple has four children together – three in primary school and one in secondary. 

For many years now, Mohamed has been selling used bags. He and his teammate have requested a loan of 1,500,000.00 SLL each from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to expand the size and qualities of their respective businesses. Mohamed is going to use his loan to buy a bale of used bags to add to his stall inventory.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used bags to add to his stall

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz es una  mujer de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Mala con sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, lastimosamente Luz sufrió la pérdida de su amado esposo, desde entonces ella dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, Luz no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Luz trabaja brindando servicios de mantenimiento en un campamento de extranjeros en su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días un aproximado de 12 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Luz se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de tramitación y formalización del terreno que su esposo le dejo como herencia para la construcción de su hogar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Luz is a 32 year old woman who lives in the city of Cañete in the district of Mala with two small children, who she loves and considers to be her primary reason for living. Sadly, Luz suffered the loss of her beloved husband, and since then she has been working hard to help out her family.  Luz was not able to study at the university in the field of education because she had to start working at a very young age to help her parents. In her free time, she likes to listen to music, and sometimes she cooks a delicious meal of chicken and rice to share with her family.

With a great deal of dedication and effort, Luz works doing maintenance services in a settlement of foreigners in her city.  She works every day for about 12 hours, and she feels content doing her work and thinks it is going well because of her hard work and the good service that she gives to her customers.

Luz is very thankful for the lenders at Kiva, since it is thanks to their help that she will be able to cover the costs of processing and formally transferring the title on the land that her husband left her as an inheritance to build her house on.  In this way, she will be able to continue working and struggling to reach her greatest dream, which is to see her children grow up to be educated professionals and good people.

loans.use: to cover the costs of processing and formally transferring the title on her land.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has 2 children and has been doing farming work for 9 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea.

She said that what is most enjoyable about farming is dairy farming. Her biggest challenge is raising funds. Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Lily was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "because of its low interest rate."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "That Juhudi Kilimo is dedicated to improving lives."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked "How will this loan benefit her family?," Lily replied, "by selling the milk produced,she will increase her income base and thus be able to educate her children."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Lily owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, sewing machine, TV' but does not have 'electricity, running water, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married with five children. She has received some schooling till the end of middle school. Currently, Aba is a food vendor, selling dishes like rice with stew in Domenase near Elmina. She has been involved in this industry for about ten years now. Her husband is a mason. Aba’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Aba will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to make her tasty food. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Aba plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to make her tasty food.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a single mother of three children and two attend school. She operates a restaurant from home on retail basis for now  several years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, peas, beef, sugar, and beans. Her major business challenges include seasonality of food. She would like to buy a plot of land.  She resides in a rented house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, Irish potatoes, tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a business

loans.name: Soloao

texts.en: Soloao is a retired teacher, aged 66. She’s a strong mother of 14 children, one deceased, 4 living overseas and 9 staying in Samoa. Soloao is a very hard working mother. When she was teaching, she realized that her salary couldn’t provide for all her kids, so she helped out her husband set up a fishing business. She started with a single canoe with just her husband alone. One day she resigned as a teacher because she realized that their business was growing and her husband needed support. From that single canoe, they now own 3 fishing vessels, with 3 employees on each boat. Her business has become really successful, but she still wants to do more. So she’s requesting a $850 loan for upgrading her fishing gear and maintenance of her boats.

loans.use: Buy fishing gear, maintenance of boats

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.en:
Mr. V. started his accessory and novelty shop about a year and a half ago and has had good business since then. But he has not been able to increase his sales because he hasn't been able to purchase items in larger quantities. "I would like to grow my business and to do that I need your help. With a $1,000 loan I can achieve it."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. V. inicio su negocio aproximadamente hace un año y medio y a tenido ventas buenas, solo que no ha podido escalar en las ventas pues no ha logrado invertir en cantidades mayores. "Quisiera consolidar mi negocio y para eso necesito su ayuda, con $1,000.00 dlls se logrará.

loans.use: Invest in new products at his accessory and novelty shop, like toys and dolls.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es:
Ms Felicidad lives in her own house with her husband and her youngest child on Avenida Buenos Aires in the Las Lomas zone of the city of La Paz. She is 50 years old, and since a young age she has sold food at the door of her residence (by contract) to chauffeurs (taxi and bus drivers) and construction workers. Her clients make an agreement with her to prepare food every day.

With her savings, Felicidad was able to construct a small shop in her house. She asks for a loan to furnish her business (to purchase tables and chairs) since she now has the possibility of opening an eatery, which would mean a more stable clientele and an increase in income.

Felicidad's past history with Impro certifies her as a very good client and one who can access new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Felicidad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija menor en la Avenida Buenos Aires de la zona de las Lomas de la Ciudad de La Paz. Ella tiene 50 años de edad y desde muy joven se dedica a la venta de comida en la puerta de su domicilio atendiendo a los chóferes (taxi and bus drivers) y albañiles por contrato, es decir que sus clientes tienen un acuerdo con ella para que les prepare comida todos los días.

Con sus ahorros, Felicidad pudo construir una pequeña tienda en su casa y el crédito que ahora solicita es para amoblar su negocio (comprar mesas y sillas) ya que ahora tiene la posibilidad de abrir una pensión, lo cual implicaría una clientela mas estable y mejoras en sus ingresos.

Su antecedente histórico con Impro, la califica como muy buen cliente y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To purchase furnishings for her expanding business

loans.name: Susana Neh

texts.en:
Susana was born in 1942, is married, and is a mother of four children. She will never forget the death of one of her children, which left her emotionally disturbed for a long time.

She first joined GHAPE in 1999, and since then she has managed and invested loans amounting to $1200. This has raised her profits and enabled her to sponsor some of her children in school and vocational training.

With a loan of $1200, she plans to run a motor bike taxi business and cultivate yams. The motor bike will be ridden by her son, who is trained in that domain. She will use the profit from the business to continue sponsoring her children in vocational schools.

Susana plans to repay her loan in 24 months. The first installment repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of motor bike, documents, yams

loans.name: Santos Euralia

texts.es:
My name is Santos H. and I sell basic grains such as: corn, beans and sugar; I started my business several years ago, my clients are very good since in my community there are not many other people selling basic grains so the demand is very high; At the present time I need to buy more grains because the demand for my product is quite high; with the profit I make I will feed my family, I am a senior citizen and selling grains is the only thing I can do and it’s the only source of income for my family.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

mi nombre es Santos H. me dedico a la venta de granos basicos como ser maiz, arroz, frijoles y azucar, tengo mi negocio hace varios años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que en mi comunidad somos pocas las personas que vendemos granos basicos y la demanda es grande, en estos momentos necesito comprar mas granos porque las exigencias de los clientes son grandes, con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia ya que soy una persona de la tercera edad y en esto e lo unico que puedo trabajar y es mi unica fuente de ingresos tambien,

loans.use: To buy grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of more cosmetic merchandise

loans.name: Please Delete Group

texts.en:
Dafroza , age 26, is married with 1 child (age 4). She owns a business of making bread, which she began 1 year ago. She opens her business from 7am to 10am, and makes a monthly profit of about $136.

Dafroza hopes to take a loan with Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business. She will be sharing this loan with her sub group members, who have businesses dealing in selling shop, charcoal, livestock, and stationary.

In the picture Dafroza is in the centre.

loans.use: to increase business

loans.name: Saraí

texts.es:
Three years ago, Saraí began to sell fruit in her parents' home because the money her husband earns isn't enough to pay their bills. Saraí decided to sell fruit in her parents' home because more people pass by it than her own house. Little by little, she made a name for herself, and now she is well-known in her area.

Nevertheless, on occasions, people ask Saraí for items that she doesn't have. This is why she is requesting a loan of $200, which she is willing to pay back in 3 months. With this money, Saraí will be able to buy more seasonal fruit so her clients don't go to her competition. She will also buy some shelves on which she will put her vegetables. This will enable her to help her husband with their home's expenses. With your help, Saraí will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hace 3 años que Saraí comenzó a vender frutas en la casa de sus papás yas que con lo que gana su esposo no es suficiente para pagar los gastos de la casa. Saraí decidió vender las frutas en casa de sus papás puesto que en esta el tránsito de gente es mayor que ne la de ella y su esposo. Poco a poco se fue dando a conocer en el rumbo y actualmente ya es reconocida en su colonia.

Sin embargo en ocasiones le piden a Saraí cosas que ella no tiene. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $200 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero Saraí podrá comprar más fruta de la temporada para que sus clientes no se vayan con la competencia además de comprar unos estantes para poder poner la verdura y así poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Con tu ayuda Saraí podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy shelves

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena F. is married to a taxi driver and has three children. She hopes to start a cosmetics selling business. She is requesting $225 to buy cosmetics. Philomena has been a trader for the past 3 years, but is seeing increased demand in Cape Coast for cosmetics. Philomena is also a member of a lending group called “Calvary Group”, which consists of eleven members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: Philomena would like to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Rose's Muungano Group

texts.en:
Rose is 40-years-old and is married with three children; ages 14,12 and 8. Rose began a business in 2007 printing and selling T-shirts. She works from 6AM to 6PM and can earn a monthly profit of $90.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory and supplies for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses dealing in cloth and T-shirt sales.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and supplies for T-shirt printing

loans.name: Mirna De La Cruz

texts.es:
Mrs. U. C. and her husband are owners of a general goods store. They also own a tortilla-production plant. She's been working with our organization for three years, investing into her business. She receives the support of her husband who oversees the business while she tends to the selling of tortillas at home. Currently there are two people who work with her. Her son also lives with her.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora U. C. es dueña en conjunto con su esposo de un negocio de mercadería en general así como un taller de tortillas, ella trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace tres años invirtiendo en su negocio, ella tiene el apoyo de su esposo quien se encarga de ver el negocio de mercadería en general y ella atiende en la casa la venta de tortillas con ella trabajan dos personas en las toritllas, tiene un hijo el que vive con ella.

loans.use: Capital to purchase shoes, clothing, cosmetics, corn, fire wood.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer is 34 years old and lives with his partner in the Hugo Chávez neighborhood of Managua, Nicaragua. He and his partner have a two year-old child. Wilmer works as a production assistant.

Wilmer is in charge of maintaining his family, since his life-partner is a stay-at-home mother. Wilmer is asking for credit in order to finish building a protective wall around the outside of his house. He has been improving his home little by little since he earns very little and is unable to complete the entire project at one time.

Wilmer hopes to raise his child in the best way possible and one of his dreams is also to be able to be officially married.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Wilmer tiene 34 años de edad, es acompañado, habita en el barrio Hugo Chávez, tiene 1 pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad. Wilmer trabaja como auxiliar de producción. La manutención de su casa está a cargo de él, ya que su compañera de vida es ama de casa. Wilmer está solicitando su crédito para terminar de construir el muro delantero de su casa de habitación, las mejoras a su vivienda las ha venido haciendo poco a poco ya que el dinero que gana es muy poco para poder realizar la construcción de una sol vez. Espera poder criar a su hija de la mejor forma posible y también uno de sus sueños es poder consolidar un matrimonio.

loans.use: To finish building a protective wall around the outside of his house

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 23 years old, single, with no children. He is a native of the neighborhood Ndavarù in the city of Carapeguá, 100 km from the capital. He lives with his parents.

Jose is a young entrepreneur who walks around selling his crafts. He has done this for 10 years, since his first work experience was learning this profession from his parents and siblings. Moreover, he is pursuing his fourth year of a Science Administration career in a private university; thanks to his work revenue he can afford his studies. With this loan, he will buy bedspreads, hammocks, shoes, and sheets.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (bedspreads, hammocks, shoes, sheets)

loans.name: Marisa's Group

texts.en:
Marisa and Romula are members of the Santa Rita Village Bank. Marisa is a married, thirty-three-year-old mother of three children. Marisa has a store in her mother's house where she also lives. She sells groceries like vegetables, fruits, and meat; she's had the business for six years. Romula is a forty-three-year-old mother of five children. Romula has been running a beauty salon in her house for the last four years.

Marisa and Romula need loans of 600 Peruvian Nuevos Soles each to invest in rice, oil, soup, display cases, dyes and liquids for their respective businesses. Each has a dream to expand her business, furnish her house with all the necessities, and provide all the best for her children.

loans.use: To invest in supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Veasna

texts.en:
Mr. Veasna C., 29, and his wife, Mrs. Man Tivoe, 26, live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2006 and have one son.

Mr. Veasna has been a motor taxi driver in Phnom Penh for five years, while his wife has been a garment factory worker for ten years. Currently, his motorcycle is very old and broken so often; he needs to replace it with a new one to run his business. Thus, Veasna is requesting a loan of $200 to help him purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.use: To help replace his old motor taxi

loans.name: Sevinj

texts.en:
Sevinj A. is a 21-year-old woman who works as sales person in local medicine store. She has been in this business since 2005. Because she is from very poor family, she was pushed to start working at a very early age. Now she is only 21, but she is quite an experienced young lady. She also attended courses in medicine to be better prepared for her current job. 

After being in this business for such a long time, Sevinj has decided to open her own business. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of $1000 USD. She will use this loan to open a store on her own corner, where she will be selling different kinds of medicine. Your help and support will be very much appreciated.

loans.use: To open her own pharmacy

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.en:
Gavhar is a divorced mother of two adorable children. Since she must support the family, Gavhar works hard selling groceries to earn enough money to pay her expenses. By being very polite and nice to everybody, she has many customers.

Gavhar wants a loan so she can buy more grocery products and offer them to her clients.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory of grocery products

loans.name: Ni Nengah Weli

texts.id: Ni Nengah Weli seorang ibu rumah tangga,yang kesehariannya bekerja hanya membantu suami di ladang, sedangkan sekarang penjualan hasil pertanian turun drastic karena musim kamarau dan harga pupuk yang mahal. Oleh sebab itu Ni Nengah Weli berusaha untuk mendukung pendapatan suami dengan menjalankan usaha beternak babi. Namun usaha ini dijalankan masih secara tradisional dengan cara mengikat babinya pada sebatang pohon, hal ini dilakukan karena Ni Nengah Weli tidak mempunyai modal untuk membuat kandang. Kemudian Ni Nengah Weli mengajukan pinjaman ke Yayasan Dinari, karena selain mendapatkan pinjaman modal, Dinari juga memberikan pelatihan yang berkaitan dengan pemeliharaan babi agar nantinya mendapatkan hasil yang bagus. Modal pinjaman ini akan dipergunakan untuk membuat kandang babi dan membeli  pakan ternak sampai nanti babi ini siap dijual. Dengan adanya usaha ini diharapkan  dapat meningkatkan perekonomian keluarga dan anak –anak mereka tetap bisa bersekolah. Sesuai dengan program Dinari bahwa pinjaman ini akan dilunasi setelah akhir periode pinjaman selama 6 bulan.
texts.en:
Ni Nengah Weli a homemaker helps her husband in the crop field everyday, but recently income from the sale of crops dropped drastically due to the dry season and the high price of fertilizer. Due to that Ni Nengah Weli make an effort to supplement her husband’s income by carrying out pig farming. However, this effort is still done in the traditional way where the pig is leased to a tree, the reason that this is done is because Ni Nengah Weli does not have the funds to build a pigpen. Thus Ni Nengah Weli submit loan request from Dinari Foundation, because beside receiving loan, Dinari also provides training relating to proper pig farming so that later generate good returns. This funding loan will be used to fund building the pigpen and purchase livestock supplies until the pigs are ready for sale. With this effort hopefully will improve the family’s financial condition and their children have a consistent education. In line with Dinari’s program this loan will be repaid at the end of 6 months.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build pigpen and purchase livestock supplies (Membuat kandang babi dan membeli pakan)

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
La dama Luz N. desde hace varios años se ha destacado por ser una excelente costurera teniendo su establecimiento en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en la ciudad de Managua.

Se ha destacado debido a que ha aprendido a elaborar todo tipo de trajes así como camisas, pantalones, blusas, etc. La situación que hoy en día ella está atravesando es que necesita el material de trabajo para continuar y este material es tijeras, hilos, telas, agujas, centímetros, etc. Por esta razón espera que Ceprodel le beneficie con un crédito para la compra de estos materiales y para beneficio propio en su negocio.
texts.en:
For several years Luz N. has been well known for being an excellent seamstress. Her establishment is located in the municipality of Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua. She has stood out due to the fact that she has learned to make all kinds of suits in addition to shirts, pants, blouses, etc. The situation that she finds herself in today is that she needs to buy materials to continue working and they include scissors, thread, fabric, needles, measuring tape, etc. For this reason she hopes that Ceprodel will give her a loan in order to buy these materials and so that she benefits from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Khanimaga

texts.en: Khanimaga A. has an established business selling kids' toys in her store in the southern city of Azerbaijan called Imishli. She started her business about seven years ago. She has an entrepreneurial mind, and she has worked hard to develop her business. Buying inventory from Baku city, where she can get better prices, is one way in which she is able to gain a competitive business advantage. Khanimaga is married, and she has four children. One of her goals for the future is to provide all of her children with good living conditions and an education. Khanimaga is requesting a loan of 1200 USD in order to purchase more toys to sell in her store. She will be able to increase her sales and will continue to provide a better life for herself and her family.

loans.use: Increase her inventory of children's toys

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeab Y. is a 49 year old mother of two from Knach Krosang village in Kampong Cham province. Both of her children are currently attending a local school. She is also a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Leang Kim Hat, is a construction worker who earns a small salary. Mrs. Yeab Y. is asking for a loan to save up and buy an electric cow that will help her start a new business. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family.  

Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy an electric cow

loans.name: Fiagan

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur habite le quartier de Soviépé où il tient un bar qu’il appelle Bar ELEGANCE,
Son bar est très animé les weekends et les jours fériés, il doit augmenter son stock de boissons pour répondre convenablement à la demande c’est pour cela qu’il sollicite de WAGES un prêt pour pouvoir acheter des casiers de boissons au près de la brasserie.il  est  célibataire et aide beaucoup ses frèresv et sœurs dans les charges
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who lives in the Soviépé district, where he has a bar he calls “Bar ELEGANCE”. It’s a very busy place on weekends and holidays. He has to increase his inventory of beverages to respond appropriately to the demand. That’s why he’s requesting a loan from WAGES. The loan will be used to buy cases of drinks from the brewery. He is unmarried and helps his brothers and sisters a lot with their responsibilities.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cases of drinks

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor Andina”, del barrio Mendoza,  en el distrito de Platería, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y esta al cuidado de 06 hijos, posee estudios de primaria incompleta (primer grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 02 años, su negocio es la artesanía (tejido a mano), su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de lana para sus tejidos.  
Actualmente requiere un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, con el dinero podrá adquirir mas materiales para sus tejidos al por mayor (lanas de diferentes tonalidades y materiales); ella también se dedica al hilado y con la lana que compra puede elaborar vestidos, chompas, chullos y otros que entrega a los intermediarios en la Feria Acora, su anhelo es comprarse una casa en la ciudad de Puno, para sus hijos y el bienestar de su familia..
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Flor Andina” (“Andean Flower”) cooperative bank, located in the Mendoza neighborhood in Puno. She is 38 years old, married with 6 children, and did not complete her primary school education. She has been working with the Manuela R. movement for two years. Her work is crafts (knitting). She received a first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles, an amount she invested into purchasing yarn for her hand-knitted goods. Currently, she needs a loan of 1,500 soles, which she commits to repaying in 4 installments. With these funds, she would be able to buy more supplies for her craft at wholesale prices (different color yarns and materials). She also dedicates herself to embroidery, and with the yarn she buys can make dresses, sweaters, hats, and other items. She delivers these to intermediaries at the Acora Market. Her wish is to buy herself a house in the city of Puno, for her children and the overall well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her knitting business, such as different color yarns and other materials.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru: Шариф мужчина мужчина 38 лет, женат имеет троих детей. Шариф работает постухом в своём селе.Он посёт всех коз села под названием Апон.Его жена занимается прядью шерсти коз и баранов, а также вяжет носки из этой пряжи.Шариф хочет получив кредит закупить скот для увеличения своего оборотного капитала, т.к. это основной источник дохода в его семье.В районе Сомгар в основном все мужчины занимаются бизнесом животноводства и выращиванием сельхозкультур.
texts.en:
Sharif is a 38-year-old man, married, and has three children. Sharif works as a shepherd in his village. He herds all the goats in the village of Apon. His wife works spinning goat and ram wool, and she also knits socks from this yarn. Sharif wants to take out a loan to buy more livestock and increase his working capital since this business provides the family’s income. In the Somgar area, basically all men work in animal husbandry and agriculture.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying livestock and feed

loans.name: Laura Leticia

texts.es: Laura Leticia R. R., vive en Soyapango departamento de San Salvador, Laura es empleada medio tiempo de un consultorio médico, pero nació de ella una idea que ahora es su principal fuente de ingreso; en vista de la necesidad de muchas madres que trabajan y no hay quienes cuiden de sus hijos, Laura monto una guardería;  de la cual ahora muchas madres están felices  y reconocen lo indispensable que es tener una guardería en la zona. Laura solicita un crédito para la compra de inmuebles, para su guardería.
texts.en:
Laura Leticia R. R. lives in the neighborhood of Soyapango in the city of San Salvador. Laura works part time in a doctor's office and while she was working there she got the idea to start her business, which now is her main source of income. When she was working at the doctor's office she realized that there are many working mothers that did not have anyone to take care of their children. Laura started a daycare center. Now the mothers that she serves are happy and they are so thankful that Laura started a daycare center in their neighborhood. Laura is asking for a loan to be able to buy furniture for her daycare center.

(Translated by Nigel of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture for her daycare center.

loans.name: José Eduardo

texts.es:
José Eduardo Z. R. es un  joven señor de 21 años de edad, soltero y vive  actualmente solo con su madre, su padrastro y sus dos hermanos.

La comunidad en la cual vive José Eduardo se llama El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que azotan la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. 
Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en la Zona Atlántica de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado, por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona y de esta forma evitar migrar.

Como parte de las respuestas a esa situación, desde hace dos años se instaló en la comunidad una planta de elaboración de quesos, propiedad de la Asociación de Productores de Leche de El Sauce, hecho que motivó a José Eduardo  a iniciar en la producción de leche para luego venderla a esta planta. 

Asegura que su familia  se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante mucho tiempo, por lo que ha podido experimentar todos los cuidados que demanda, además de la instrucción recibida por parte de sus familiares  a lo largo del tiempo. 
El queso de la región donde vive José Eduardo es famoso en todo Costa Rica. Es un queso fresco que se le conoce tradicionalmente como “queso tipo Turrialba”. A los “ticos” (como se les conoce a los habitantes de Costa Rica) les gusta mucho consumir este producto; se le encontrará en las mesas acompañando cualquier tipo de comida.  Por esta razón, el mercado para dicho producto es realmente bueno.

José Eduardo desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera y poder iniciar con su negocio ya que desea ser un microempresario exitoso y  así poder ayudar a que su familia siga adelante esto es una de las cosas que lo motiva a esforzarse y trabajar con mucho esmero. 

José Eduardo es socio de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
José Eduardo Z. R. is a young gentleman of 21 years of age, single and currently lives with his mother, stepfather and two brothers. The community where he lives is called El Sauce de Santa Teresita of Turrialba, Cartago Province. It is a small rural community of about two thousand inhabitants. They are engaged in milk production and coffee planting. It has an irregular topography and is kept as a moist tropical forest. The community has very picturesque landscapes that combine the beautiful tropical forest gaps with coffee plantations and dairy farms. El sauce is located about an hour and a half by bus from Turrialba, the nearest trading center. However, several times a year the road becomes impassable due to the rains that hit the area. This is undoubtedly one of the main challenges for the community. When there were no activities many people chose to leave to look for work in Turrialba or at banana plantations located in the Atlantic zone of Costa Rica. Currently the prices of coffee and milk have improved, so the neighbors look how to invest in projects in the same area and in this way avoid migration. As part of the response to this situation, a cheese processing plant was established since two years ago. It is owned by the Milk Producers' Association of El Sauce, which motivated José Eduardo to start in milk production and sell it to this plant. His family has been in this activity for long time, so he has experienced all the care it demands, in addition to the instruction given by their family members over time. The cheese from the region where José Eduardo lives is famous throughout Costa Rica. It is a fresh cheese that is traditionally known as "cheese type Turrialba”. For the "Ticos" (as the people of Costa Rica are known), they love to consume this product, you'll find in the tables accompanying any kind of food. For this reason, the market for this product is really good. José Eduardo wants to obtain a micro loan of ¢ 500,000 (five hundred thousand colones) to buy a cow and be able to start his business and be a successful micro-business owner and help his family to keep going, this is one of the things that motivates him to strive and work very hard. José Eduardo is a member of the Association of Producers of El Sauce, one of 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan, and he hopes to continue to grow personally and financially. He also stays that with this type of organizations and facilitators of credit he can spend more time on productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 45 años, es natural D. Chancay (ciudad al norte D. Lima), vive soL. en su casa propia. DesD. hace 13 años se dedica a L. atención D. su pequeña bodega, donD. ofrece paquetes D. piqueos diversos, golosinas, bebidas, entre otros productos, para solventar sus gastos, ya que trabaja soL.. Le gusta L. atención porque le permite hacer amigos y conversar con L. gente que llega a su bodega, ya que estando cerca D. una carretera muy transitada, muchos choferes y pasajeros se detienen para tomar alguna bebida para refrescarse y algún bocadillo para saciar su hambre. María considera rentable su negocio porque siempre tiene muy buena clienteL., y piensa en un futuro cercano, tener una tienda más granD. con productos D. primera necesidad y así saciar las necesidades D. sus clientes, que cada vez comienzan a ser más. Este es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, siendo muy puntual en los pagos, además le gusta el trabajo en su banco comunal, ya que sus compañeras son sus amigas y trabajan muy bien juntas. Con el dinero que solicita abastecerá su tienda con diferentes productos y así logrará atraer a más clienteL..
texts.en:
María is 45 years old, is a native of Chancay (a city north of Lima), and lives alone in her own home. Since she was 13 years old, she has dedicated herself to tending to her small grocery store, where she offers packets of snacks, sweets, drinks, and other products to settle her expenses since she works alone. She likes the attention because it allows her to make friends and converse with the people that arrive at her grocery store. Since she is located close to a well-traveled highway, many drivers and passengers stop to have a drink to refresh themselves and a sandwich to satiate their hunger. María considers her business to be profitable because she always has good clientele. She thinks in the near future she will have a bigger store with essential products and in this way satisfy the growing needs of her clients. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she is very punctual with her payments. In addition, she likes the work in her community bank since her partners are her friends, and they work well together. With the loan that she is asking for, she will supply her store with different products and in this way attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita M. is from the town of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 35 years old. Elenita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elenita sells daily-use snack products such as biscuits, banana chips, and candies at Lumbia International Airport. Elenita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elenita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP that she will use as additional capital to sustain her business. This loan is Elenita's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Women For Development Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres para el Desarrollo son D. L. comunidad D. Erusco, Distrito D. Cayara, Provincia D. Víctor Fajardo. L. comunidad se dedica a L. agricultura D. cereales, tubérculos, crianza D. animales menores, venta D. animales y cereales.
Hermelinda es casada, tiene 2 hijos, Hermelinda tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, además tiene un molino en donD. brinda servicio D. molienda y también elL. misma los procesa y venD. en las ferias, su préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. cereales. Los sueños D. Hermelinda son ampliar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos en L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Por otro lado Dolores es casada, Dolores se dedica a L. crianza D. cuy en su casa, actividad que realiza con L. ayuda D. su esposo, sus ventas los realiza en las ferias, su préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. cuy mejorado. Los sueños D. Dolores son tener mas galpones D. cuy y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the Village Bank Women for Development are from the Erusco Community, Cayara District, Victor Fajardo province. The community is dedicated to agriculture of grains, tubers, small animal husbandry, and selling animals and grains.

Hermelinda is married, with two children. Hermelinda has a small house where she sells general groceries, further she has a mill where she offers grinding services, also processing it herself and then selling it at fairs. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of grains. Hermelinda dreams of expanding her business and to proviD. a better education for her children in the city of Ayacucho.

On the other hand there is Dolores, who is married. Dolores is dedicated to raising guinea pigs in her home, an activity she carries out with the help of her husband. She sells them at the fair, and her loan will be invested in the purchase of better guinea pigs. Dolores dreams of having mO. guinea pig farms and to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grains, guinea pigs, rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es:
La señora Maricruz M. es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a dos hijas menores de edad, para las cuales quiere lo mejor para ellas. 
Tiene poco que le adquirió la vivienda por medio de un crédito gubernamental, pero le está haciendo falta la barda alrededor de la casa, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de elaborar la barda. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder realizar la mejora  y así ella y sus dos pequeñas hijas estarán más seguras en su casa.
Maricruz trabaja en un despacho contable como contadora publica, este es el ingreso que genera para su familia y con el cual un parte cera para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Maricruz M. is a single mother, and she has two young daughters under her responsibility, and she wants the best for them. She has little that she acquired for her home by means of a governmental loan, but she is missing the fence around the house, but she does not have the money necessary to buy the material and pay the person that is in charge of building the fence.

She requests a loan to be able to make the improvement, so that she and her 2 little daughters will be safer in their house. Maricruz works in an accounting office as a public accountant. This is the income that she makes for her family and with which in part she will pay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a fence in the back of the house

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora tiene 37 años de edad, es una mujer muy serena y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Desde pequeña trabajó labrando la tierra, ahora que es madre aprendió a medir su tiempo y organizarse en sus labores de casa para después trabajar en sus chacras. De trabajar con su esposo termina de cultivar rápidamente y dispone de tiempo libre, el cual aprovecha en trabajar en las chacra de sus vecinas, removiendo la tierra y otras veces recogiendo arvejas, por este trabajo le pagan al día 13 soles, pero ella prefiere ganar según la cantidad que recoge, por lo que se esmera en recolectar la mayor cantidad de arvejas. Cuando tiene que cosechar sus propias siembras se levanta a las 3 de la mañana para cocinar los alimentos y posteriormente procede a la recolección de las arvejas, para que en la tarde ya estén listas para llevarlas al mercado de la ciudad, donde generalmente obtiene un buen precio, y eso la hace muy feliz y la motiva a seguir sembrando. Este su quinto préstamo con MFP, con los préstamos anteriores demostró pagar sin dificultades y promete hacerlo así, con este nuevo crédito. En su banco comunal es muy paciente en explicar a sus compañeras cuando no pudieron entender con claridad algún tema, por lo que le tienen mucho aprecio. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su próxima siembra de papas y arvejas.
texts.en:
Doña Nora, aged 37, is married and the mother of four children. They live in their own house. She is a very quiet and hard-working lady who has worked in agriculture since a very young age. Now that she is a mother, she has learned to organize her time and take care both of her home and her farm.

As Nora works with her husband, they finish early and she has enough time left to work on her neighbors' farms, where she usually turns over the earth and harvests peas. She earns 13 nuevos soles (US$4.40) a day for this work, but she prefers to be paid depending on the amount of harvested peas, as this motivates her to pick as many peas as possible. When she has to harvest her own crop, she gets up at 3 a.m. to prepare the meals and then pick peas. In the afternoon of the same day, she sells her peas at the city market where she can usually get a good price for them. This makes her very happy and motivates her for a new sowing cycle.

This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She repaid her previous loans without difficulty and promised to do so also this time. In the meetings with her Communal Bank she patiently explains to her group members any topic which they might not fully understand, and they are grateful for this. Nora will use her loan to buy chemical fertilizers for her next crop of potatoes and peas.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene C. is from the village of Poblacion,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Irene is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Irene owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Irene has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1,560.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Irene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Irene from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Betty Luz

texts.es:
Betty tiene 42 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su madre en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, ubicada a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica al comercio mayorista de medias desde hace 5 años, ella adquiere su mercancía en la ciudad de Lima una vez por semana y luego la distribuye en los principales mercados de las ciudades de Trujillo, Piura y Bagua.

El negocio ha ido creciendo con el tiempo y por ello ahora vende medias para todo público, ocasionalmente también compra medias recién fabricadas y las manufactura para  luego distribuirlas. Esta actividad es la que le provee el sustento diario, además, de ella también depende el sustento de su madre que por ser de edad avanzada no puede trabajar.

Ella desea seguir ampliando su negocio con la compra de más medias para distribuir, por ello está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más mercadería para ampliar su negocio y seguir apoyando en el mantenimiento de su hogar.

Betty anhela otorgarle a su madre una mejor calidad de vida y ampliar su negocio para dar oportunidades de trabajo a sus familiares jóvenes. Ella es muy conocida por la zona, sus vecinos la consideran una mujer optimista y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Betty is 42 years old. She is not married and lives with her mother in the city of Ferrañafe, located 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been in the business of selling socks for the past five years. She obtains her merchandise in the city of Lima once per week and then distributes it in the main markets in the cities of Trujillo, Piura, and Bagua. The business has been growing over time and so now she sells all sorts of socks. She occasionally also buys socks that have been recently made and embellishes them and then distributes them. This business is what provides her with a living. Her mother also depends on this business because she can’t work due to her advanced age. She wants to continue growing her business through buying more socks to distribute. To this end she is requesting a loan of 2,500.00 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. She plans to use to it to invest in the purchase of more merchandise so she can expand her business and continue to support her household. Betty wants very much to provide her mother with a higher quality of life and to expand her business so that she can give work opportunities to young family members. She is well-known in the neighborhood and her neighbors consider her an optimistic and hard-working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy socks for re-sale.

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es: Don Octavio O. de 51 años de edad, casado con tres hermosos hijos que le tiene su esposa, reside en el bario Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, desde hace treinta años se dedica a comprar y a vender cerdo, se vende bien ya que se come mucho la carne por su exquisito sabor, para adquirirlos a mejor precios viaja a los departamentos a comprar los cerdos, entre las dificultades que se ha presentado la mas afectada que tuvo fue la de la gripe porcina el cual casi quiebra su negocio por que nadie quería invertir, a si como su enfermedad de obesidad. Con este préstamo comprara más cerdo para vender y obtener mejores beneficios en las ganancias. Y poder sastifacer las necesidades de su familia.

loans.use: Comprar cerdos

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 23 años y 01 hija que aun dependen de ella. 

Deseando ver profesional, mas adelante a su pequeña hija y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Se dedica a la venta de quesos.
Beatriz, poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes, lleva 01 año en el negocio y sus principales clientes son sus amigos, vecinos; a diario sus ventas le van muy bien. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 2,800.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: leche en litros, sal, limón, moldes, para brindar un buen producto.  

Beatriz, se siente con muchas fuerzas todavía para seguir con sus ventas de comidas, posteriormente desea implementar un local mas amplio e incrementar sus productos, así brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y atención. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a member of the "Virgen del Rosario" communal bank located in the Bellavista District, Bellavista Province, San Martin Department. She is married, 23 years old, and has one daughter who is dependent on her. Wishing to see her daughter become a professional as an adult and wishing to have her own source of income in order to reach that goal, she decided to open her own business. She sells cheese. Little by little, Beatriz has made herself well-known among her customers. She has been in business for a year and her main customers are her friends and neighbors; her daily sales are quite good. With this 2800 new sol loan she intends to purchase raw materials for cheese making such as: milk, salt, lemons, and forms to provide a good product. Beatriz feels the strength to continue with her food sales and would like to have a larger store in the future with a variety of products in order to offer her customers still better products and serivices. She is thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her reach her goals and helping her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for cheese making.

loans.name: Milly's Group

texts.en: K. Milly is the leader of her lending group in Kampala. She is a widow with four children, two of whom are orphans. Ever since her husband died, she has taken up the responsibility of caring for her children and paying their school fees. Two are in candidate classes and the others are in lower grades. Loans have helped Milly reinvest in her salon business. She has purchased more hair extensions, hair chemicals, a hair dryer and so on, and these have helped her build up her salon and attract more customers. Milly needs a loan to help restock her salon with more items for increased income.

loans.use: To restock her salon with more items like hair chemicals, braids, weaves and others.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La socia ASUNTA pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”, es natural D. la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 48 años D. edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos varones.

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo D. atender su pequeño negocio D. venta frutas al por mayor y menor en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” D. la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio D. venta D. frutas.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Asunta is a member of the communal bank "SIEMPRE ADELANTE" and is from the city of Cusco.

She is 48 years old and is married with four sons.

She mixes her housework with her work attending to a small business that sells fruits wholesale and individually in the market "Virgen Asunta" in the city of Cusco.

She requests a loan to increase the capital of her fruit selling business.

She is grateful for the opportunity offered through this loan and she promises to comply with the repayment time line.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the capital of her fruit selling business

loans.name: Mirando Al Futuro Group

texts.es: En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Villa Adela, se encuentra la Asociación Comunal Mirando al Futuro,  con diez integrantes, desarrollan su reunión elaborando el reglamento interno se su grupo, liderizadas por su mesa directiva (presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas). Ellas se agruparon por vecinas y amigas que viven alrededor del Centro Focal por la necesidad de contar con mayor  capital de trabajo que les permita incrementar sus productos, todas tienen sus propios negocios, en un 50% tienen negocios de venta de comida, un 40% venden cosméticos y un 10% vende artículos de construcción, repostería y tapicería. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y seguir dando fuerza a sus negocios, sobre todo en esta época que el nivel de demanda ha subido por las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
The Community Association Mirando al Futuro is located in one of the Focal Centers of Pro Mujer Villa Adela. There are 10 members that hold their meetings according to the internal by-laws of their group. They are led by their board (president, treasurer and minutes secretary). They formed the group with neighbors and friends that live near the Focal Center. They needed to have greater working capital which would allow them to increase their products. They all have their own businesses. Fifty percent have businesses selling food, 40% sell cosmetics and 10% sell building materials, baked goods and upholstery. All of them need the loan to purchase goods and continue to strengthen their businesses, especially at this time when the level of demand has risen because of the new year holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE PRODUCTS FOR DIVERSE BUSINESSES

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane K. desigs bedsheets in the local market and requests a loan to stock more bedsheets to design and sell.  Jane is 30 years old and widowed.   She has five children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to open up a training school for tailoring.
-----------------
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bedsheets to design and sell.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: El Señor Javier vive con su esposa que tambien se dedica al comercio de articulos del hogar y tienen una pequeña hija, el Sr. javier vende viveres por mayor y por menor, normalmente el compra mercaderia de las mayoristas que llegan de otras ciudades de nuestro pais, y reparte según los pedidos que el tiene, el señor tambien esta aprendiendo el arte de la orfebreria ya que el abuelo de su esposa reliza este trabajo y el desea  mas adelante poder tambien ofrecer sus productos al mercado con diseños propios, la venta de los viveres le generan un buen ingreso pero le ocaciona un desgaste fisico ya que este tipo de viveres le llega en quintales y normalmente el carga y descarga su mercaderia. El Sr. Javier es una persona responsable y esta  agradecido con la institucion por la oportunidad que se le brinda en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Javier lives with his wife who also sells articles for the home, and they have a small daughter. Javier sells goods at wholesale and retail. Normally he buys merchandise from wholesalers that come of other cities to our country, and the delivers according to the order he has. He also is learning the art of gold/silver smithing as his wife’s grandfather does this work and he wishes to be able to offer his products with his own design in the market in the future. The sale of the household goods generates good income but he has a disadvantage in that these types of goods arrive to him every 15 days and then he carries and distributes the merchandise. Javier is a responsible person and is grateful to the institution for providing him this opportunity to have a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita D. is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. She is 56 years old, married, and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2010, Carmelita joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.en:
Tatiana is a 34-year-old mother of four who lives in Goicoechea Canton of San Jose, in the central valley of Costa Rica.
 
This will be Tatiana’s 3rd loan from Fundacion Mujer. In the past, she has maintained an excellent repayment record. The loan consultant that has been working with Tatiana describes her as a hardworking entrepreneur with a fighting spirit. 

Tatiana has a retail business in her community where she sells items such as clothing, household and health products, and facial treatments. After performing her daily domestic tasks, she dedicates six hours to her business from Monday to Saturday. Going door to door, she offers her clients various household products, clothing and cosmetics among other items. This loan will be used as working capital so she can buy clothing and facial treatment products.

Tatiana has been working in sales for the past ten years. In a good month, she can earn 500,000 colones; in a bad month, only 150,000. She says her main obstacle is fluctuations in demand. For example, because the schools open on February 10th, most Costa Rican families are spending money on school supplies for their children, rather than retail products. As a result, Tatiana’s business takes a hit in February.

In the past, Tatiana worked as an administrative assistant while also running her sales business. Recently, she has decided to dedicate all her energy to her business, because it allows for a more flexible schedule. As her own boss, she can allocate the hours of the day she needs for domestic tasks and taking care of her children, while allotting other hours for her sales activities. 

Tatiana hopes to combine her increased investment of time with the money from this loan to increase sales and expand her business. By the end of the year, her goal is to buy a car, which would allow her to expand operations further and facilitate her daily activities. Some of Tatiana’s long term goals are to buy a house and be able to invest in a university education. Tatiana would like to study business administration with a concentration in marketing.

loans.use: For the purchase of retail products.

loans.name: Frida

texts.es:
Frida es una alegre y atenta mujer de 35 años, que vive con su esposo Néstor de 35 años y sus 2 hijos: Kevin de 10 y Joel de 1 año. Ellos viven en la comodidad de su casa propia fabricada a base de madera. 

Desde hace 2 años se dedica al comercio de comestibles, mientras que su esposo cultiva plátano, maíz y café desde hace 10 años. “Mi esposo vive íntegramente dedicado a la chacra, pues al comercializar los frutos cubrimos nuestros gastos domésticos, mientras que el dinero que yo gano de la atención en la bodega lo ahorramos para comprar más terrenos”.

Actualmente, Frida y su esposo vienen invirtiendo en un vivero de plantas maderables (cedro, moena, copal, nogal entre otras especies).

Para el futuro, su anhelo es construir su casa de material noble (cemento y ladrillos), para que pueda ampliar su tienda, también desea sembrar más en busca de una mayor productividad.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP, y su agradecimiento es para todas las personas que hacen posible que pueda salir adelante, lo que ha demostrado desde la primera reunión de su banco comunal y cada mes con sus pagos puntuales.
