Con los dos mil quinientos soles que esta vez solicita comprará mercadería (comestibles de primera necesidad, bebidas y útiles de escritorio) para surtir su bodega, con el resto del dinero comprará dos sacos de abono para esparcir sobre sus plantas de café.
texts.en:
Frida is a cheerful and considerate 35 year old woman. She lives with her 35 year old husband, Néstor, and their two children. Kevin is 10 and Joel is 1. They live comfortably in their own house, which is made of wood. For two years she has been selling groceries. Her husband has been growing bananas, corn, and coffee for ten years. “My husband is completely devoted to the farm. Upon selling the fruit we cover our household expenses. We save the money that I earn in the convenience store to buy more land.” Frida and her husband are currently investing in a nursery for wood plants (cedar, moena, copal, walnut trees, and other species). In the future she wants to build her house from sturdy material (cement and bricks) so that she is able to expand her store. She also wants to plant more for greater productivity. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She is grateful to all of the people who make it possible for her to get ahead. She has shown this since the first meeting with her communal bank, and she shows it every month with her punctual payments. She will use the 2,500 PEN that she is requesting this time to buy merchandise (basic needs foods, drinks, and office supplies) to stock her convenience store. With the rest of the money she will buy two sack of fertilizer to spread over the coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Vai

texts.en: Mr. Vai V. is a 54 year old farmer who lives in Siem Reap Province. Vai V. is married to Sorm Khy, age 51. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has given birth to seven children: four of the children are married and working and three are single. Due to the coming farming season, Vai V. wants to grow a great amount of crops in order to sell them when they have matured. As he lacks money to make that possible, Vai V. has decided to request a loan from Kiva. Vai V. will use these funds to buy fertilizers and vegetable seeds to plant.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and vegetable seeds to plant.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Mrs. Presentacion A. is from Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay. She is 54 years old and married with three children. She manages her business, which is making sawali (woven bamboo wall products). Both of them are making this project to improve their family's living conditions. They can earn more from this project during the summer season. They also have their farm, which serves as their main source of income.

She joined PMPC to gain access for financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos from PMPC. This loan was used to expand her project. 

She has a new loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC, which is intended for additional capital of her project. She has managed this business for almost two years and is earning approximately 5,000 PHP a month. It is her third loan cycle at PMPC, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: Additional capital for making sawali (woven bamboo walls)

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en:
Ngozi is 42 years old and the mother of three children. She sells notebooks and other writing materials to her customers and does this business in order to make ends meet. She started the business five years ago.

Ngozi joined LAPO three years ago and has a good repayment record. She hopes to expand her business in future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more notebooks at a reduced price to sell. This will enable her meet the demands of students as schools resumes. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To more purchase notebooks to sell

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
EL BANCO D. EMPRENDIMIENTO LAS TRABAJADORAS ESTA CONFORMADO POR 8 SOCIAS 6 MUJERES Y 2 VARONES, SE CONOCEN Y SE GARANTIZAN ENTRE ELLOS, LA MESA DIRECTIVA ESTA FORMADO POR:

LA PRESIDENTA ES LA SRA. SHIRLEY ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 2 HIJOS PEQUEÑOS, VIVE EN UNA CASA EN ANTICRETICO TIENE UNA TIENDA D. BARRIO CERCA AL CEMENTERIO D. SACABA ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA ES MUY BUENA LIDER EN EL GRUPO, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE PUBLICO ES CHOFER ASALARIADO, LOS DOS TRABAJAN DURO PARA SACAR A SU FAMILIA ADELANTE, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA PARA SURTIR SU TIENDA D. BARRIO Y ASI PODER INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL D. TRABAJO. 

LA SECRETARIA ES LA SRA. SOLEDAD VIVE CON SU TIA A UNA CUADRA DEL CEMENTERIO, ES VENDEDORA AMBULANTE D. JUGUETES CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD MANTIENE SU HOGAR YA QUE ES SUS UNICA FUENTE D. TRABAJO CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA JUGUETES AL POR MAYOR D. LOS MAS VENDIDOS Y ASI PODER INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL D. TRABAJO.

ESTE GRUPO D. 8 PERSONAS CADA UNA D. ELLAS TIENEN UNA ACTIVIDAD INDEPENDIENTE, TIENEN VARIOS AÑOS VIVIENDO EN SACABA , SE CONOCEN BASTANTE BIEN ENTRE ELLAS  EXISTE LA PARTICIPACIÓN D. 2 VARONES D. IGUAL MANERA SON MUY CONOCIDOS CON SU RESPECTIVA ACTIVIDAD, TODOS LOS SOCIOS ESTAN AGRADECIDOS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
The Hard-Working Entrepreneurs village bank is maD. up of 8 members, 6 women and 2 men, they know each other well and guarantee eah other's loans. The board of directors is maD. up of: Shirley, the president, is married with two small children. She lives in Anticretico where she runs a small neighborhood store close to the Sacaba cemetery. She is very responsible and hard-working and a great group leader. Her husband works in public transportation as a salaried driver. The two work hard to help their family progress; with the money from the loan, they will buy merchandise to stock their store and increase their working capital. The group secretary is Soledad who lives with her aunt one block from the cemetery. She sells toys around the town in order to support her family; hers is the only source of income. She will use the loan to buy the most popular toys wholesale to increase her working capital. Each of these 8 people has their own business and have lived in Sacaba for years. They know each other very well and the 2 men in the group are also very well-known and well thought of in their businesses. All the members are grateful to Emnprender and Kiva for the support they are receiving through these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 50 years old and lives in Kiambu. Together with his wife, he has been selling milk since 1996. The couple works hard to provide a better standard of living for the family.
Joseph is a member of a group whose members receive loans from Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. He attends the weekly meetings and pays his loans well. So far, his business has been running well but he has insufficient storage facilities. He has therefore requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Faulu Kenya to buy a freezer. He hopes to attract more customers so that he can earn more income to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria M. Cruz es una señora de 51 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Doña María inicio su negocio hace poco más de dos años. Ella tiene una panadería, dice que sus productos son muy aceptados en su comunidad ya que son muy buenos y de gran calidad, además comenta que está muy feliz de poder tener un negocio propio en su casa así puede estar al cuidado de sus hijos y no dejar de lado las tareas del hogar y  que gracias a este proyecto sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia han mejorado considerablemente y dice además que ha crecido como persona y ha adquirido mucho conocimiento.
En estos momentos doña María del Carmen desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢654,000 (seiscientos cincuenta y cuatro  mil colones), para comprar otro  horno industrial, una batidora industrial y diferentes materiales necesarios para elaboración de sus productos. Con esta inversión  espera incrementar la producción para atraer más clientes, ofrecer un mejor servicio y así hacer que su negocio crezca más y lograr ser una microempresaria exitosa. 

Doña Maria es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera mejorar su negocio para tener mayores ingresos asi darle un mejor estilo de vida a sus Hijos.
texts.en:
Maria M. Cruz is 51, and lives with her husband and their two children in a community called Hernández, located in Los Chiles, Alajuela province. This community is known as a mountainous one with great scenery, humidity, and is on the road on the northern border of our country. Its main economic activities are cattle, and agriculture, specifically growing basic grains, tubers and oranges. Maria started her business a little more than two years ago. She has a bakery, and says that her products are very popular in her community since they are very good and of high quality. Besides, she says that she is very happy to be able to have her own business in her house so that she can take care of her children and not have to leave the household chores. Thanks to this project her living conditions and those of her family have improved considerably and she says that she has grown as a person and gained much knowledge. Currently Maria del Carmen wants to have a micro loan of 654,000c (six hundred and fifty-four thousand colones) to buy another industrial oven, an industrial mixer and different materials necessary to make her products. With this money she hopes to increase her production to attract more customers, offer better service, and thus have her business grow more and be able to become a successful micro entreprenuer. Maria is a member of the Communal Credit organization “Unidos por un Desarrolo” (United for Development), one of the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is her first loan, and she hopes to improve her business to have higher earnings and thus give her children a better style of life.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel her working area and to buy an oven

loans.name: Angel Antonio

texts.es:
el señor Angel Z. tiene 64 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 5 hijos, Angel se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, 
don angel se desplaza todos los dias de su casa al negocio ya que el vive en una comunidad que se llama los Llanos de Langue para atender su negocio en donde vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta basica familiar.
como ser granos basicos, refrescos, dulce, mecates, bolsas.
este negocio lo tiene desde hace varios años, 
a podido sacar adelante a su familia. el credito lo utilizara para invertilo en mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Angel Z., age 64, is married and has 5 children. He is engaged in the sale of popular consumer products. Don Angel lives in a community called Llanos de Langue.

Every day, he leaves his house in order to operate his business, where he sells a variety of basic household items such as bulk grains, soft drinks, sweets, rope, and bags. He has been in this business several years and has been able to get ahead. He will use the loan to invest in merchandise in order to stock more in his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of butter, beans, rice, tortillas, wheat and corn flour, soaps, milk, candles, and matches.

loans.name: Sinclair

texts.fr:
jeune commercant de 30 ans, celibataire s'est lance dans l'alimentation et vente des pains il ya bientot 10 ans, tres jeune n'ayant aucun soutien,il ouvre un etalage, avec 50000frs qu'il avait epargner par la vente des pains.Ses ventes sont de 15000 a 25000 frs par jour, et pour sa strategie il se leve de bonne heure et va acheter du pain chaud a la boulangerie, et fait des portes a portes en criant dans les ruelles de son quartier, et partir de 8 h il ouvre son kiosque ou il vend le reste du pains et les produits de son alimentation.
Avec le pret qu'il compte recevoir il va acheter des cartons de lait en poudre comme le lait belle Holandaise,le lait Nido,sac de sucre de 50kg ,les conserves et les differents produits de lessive et bains.
Son ambition, c'est d'avoir un magasin d'alimentation, se marier un jour et fonder une famille.
dans le quartier tout le monde le connait du plus petit au plus grand.
texts.en:
This young merchant, 30, is single and he started out selling groceries and bread almost 10 years ago. Very young and having no one to support him, he opened up a stall with 50,000 francs that he had saved up by selling bread. His sales amount to 15,000 to 25,000 francs a day. His strategy is to get up early and buy warm bread from the bakery, then go from door to door, calling out his wares, in the back streets of his community. At 8 am he opens his kiosk where he sells the remaining loaves of bread and other foodstuffs. With the loan that he is counting on receiving, he is going to buy cartons of powdered milk such as "la belle Hollandaise" and "Nido" milk, a sack of 50 kg of sugar, tinned foods, and various detergents and bath soaps. His ambition is to open up a real grocery store, to get married one of these days, and start a family. In his neighborhood everyone has known him since he was a child.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of powdered milk, butter, sugar, detergents, toilet soap, and tinned goods

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria pertenece al  Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca y lo que mas le gusta es el incentivo al ahorro.
Victoria es casada y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Victoria viaja a las ciudades de Pisco e Ica en donde vende cereales variados, productos que adquiere en el mercado de Abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho y también de productores que le llevan a su casa, en algunas oportunidades dependiendo de la demanda procesa los cereales, Victoria viaja los días viernes y regresa los días lunes. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada y maíz.
Victoria hace algunos meses inicio a construir su casa son sus ahorros del Banco Comunal y espera terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Huanca” and what she enjoys most is having the incentive to save. She is married and has four children in school. Victoria travels to the cities of Pisco and Ica where she sells different grains. She acquires her products at the suppliers’ market in city of Ayacucho. On a few occasions, producers will deliver goods to her house if there is a demand for processed grain. Victoria travels on Thursdays and returns on Mondays.

Her loan of 2000 PEN will be invested in the purchase of wheat, barley, and corn. A few months ago, Victoria started the construction of her house using her Communal Bank savings and she hopes to have it finished.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat, barley, and corn

loans.name: Ana Iveth

texts.es:
Ana tiene 27 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Sociedad Departamento de Morazán, esta acompaña vive con el esposo y dos hijos de las edades 2 y 5 años, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas.
Tiene dos años de experiencia en el negocio, el cual está ubicado próximo a la iglesia y lo atiende de 5:00am- 7:00pm todos los días, los cliente en su mayoría son personas que visitan la iglesia y que circulan por la zona. ella solicita un préstamo para compra de maíz, quesillo, frijoles, chicharon, gas, este dinero ayudara al negocio para que Ana obtenga ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia.

Los sueños de Ana son comprar un terreno donde pueda vivir ella y sus hijos para que tengan una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 27 years old and lives in the municipality of Sociedad in the department of Morazán. She lives with her husband and two children ages 2 and 5. She sells pupusas (a corn dumpling filled with cheese, beans or meat) She has been doing this business for two years. It is located next to a church. She works from 5am until 7pm each day. The majority of her customers are people that visit the church or that visit this zone. She is asking for a loan in order to buy corn, cheese, beans, fried pig skin and cooking fuel. This money will help her business so that she can obtain earnings and improve the lives of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy corn, cheese, beans, fried pig skin and cooking fuel.

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala S. is 43 and married with five children (ages 8 - 20).  She owns a business venture planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Kalala has three years of experience in this business.  Kalala needs a loan of WST $2,000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Kalala joined SPBD. This is her third loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Kalala's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as to Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La Señora Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de Huaynaroque”  ubicado en la provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene  03 hijos,   la señora estudió educación primaria completo.

La señora Faustina esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de  venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad la señora  solicitará de  un nuevo  crédito S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles con el cual  podrá comprar más arroz, azúcar, harina y otros insumos, para poder incrementar su negocio.  También nos cuenta que se dedica al servicio de alquiler de carpas y escenarios.

Su sueño para el futuro  es incrementar su capital y ampliar su negocio de abarrotes.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro que gana y la puntualidad de pago.
texts.en:
Ms. Faustina is a member of the "Señor de Huaynaroque" Communal Bank, which is located in the province of San Román, department of Puno. She is 35 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three children. She finished primary school. Ms. Faustina has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos ["Manuela Ramos Movement"] for 3 years. She reports that her first loan was for 300.00 nuevos soles, which allowed her to increase capital for her grocery store. Currently, Ms. Faustina is requesting a new loan of 2,000.00 nuevos soles. With this loan, she will be able to buy more rice, sugar, flour, and other staple items, in order to grow her business. She says that she also provides a service renting tents and stages. Her dream for the future is to increase her capital and to expand her grocery business. The savings and regularity of payments are the things she most likes about her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Nathaniel V. is from the town of Talibon. He is 26 years old. Nathaniel is married and has three children. To make a living, Nathaniel operates a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish at the market. Nathaniel has been engaged in his business for over three years.

Nathaniel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nathaniel has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Nathaniel is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Ana Doris

texts.es: Ana Doris R. R. de 48 años de edad, reside en Mejicanos, lugar en el cual vive junto a sus dos hijos de 15 y 14 años de edad. Ana es madre soltera y una mujer muy emprendedora quien posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad en la cual trabaja desde hace 10 años. Este negocio nació debido a la necesidad de Ana de poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos, por lo que ha sido muy difícil invertir en la tienda, puesto que la mayoría de ganancias han sido destinas a los gastos del hogar y las necesidades primaria de sus hijos. Ana desea ampliar aún más la tienda ya que de esta manera podrá contar con mayores ganancias, las cuales le permitan seguir dándoles estudios a sus hijos. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar por mayor todos los productos que cuentan con más  demanda como pan, huevos, leche, sopas instantáneas  y  golosinas, así de esta manera Ana se asegura de atender a muchos más clientes, lo cual sea de mucho beneficio para ella.
texts.en:
Ana Doris R. R., 48, lives in Mejicanos with her two children who are 15 and 14 years of age.  She’s a single mother and a very enterprising woman who has had a grocery store for the last 10 years.

The business grew from Ana’s need to provide everything her children needed.  Investing in the store has been difficult because most of the profits have gone toward household expenses and her children’s primary needs.

Ana would like to expand her store a bit more so that she can earn higher profits that will allow her to continue to provide her children with an education.   For this reason, she is asking for funds to buy stock items at wholesale that are in the highest demand like: bread, eggs, milk, instant soups and snacks so that she can tend to more customers which will be of great benefit for her.

loans.use: To buy perishable items.

loans.name: Mujeres De Esperanza 3 Group

texts.es:
Carmen es una de los miembros del Grupo Mujeres de Esperanza 3, compuesto por 5 mujeres microempresarias, todas están dedicados a las ventas de ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, venta de alimentos, etc. Su familia está compuesta por ella, su esposo y 2 hijos, su negocio es una cafeteria donde vende todo tipo de comidas, desde refrigerios como sandwiches y jugos, a almuerzos como mariscos y otros. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil es lograr que su negocio sea firme, y lo que mas disfruta en sus tiempo libre es ver television y cocinar.

Carmen está muy emocionada de recibir su primer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 2 años, el cual inició con cuando trabajaba con la antigua propietaria y la señora se lo cedio. Carmen está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de jugos, frutas, refrigerios y algunas carnes y mariscos, esta asociada va a utilizar sus ganancias para pagar la educación de sus hijos, y para ahorrar, desea que su negocio pueda ser sostenible y le genere buenas ganancias para poder satisfacer todas las necesidades de su familia y poder planear un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Carmen is one of the members of the Mujeres de Esperanza (Women of Hope) 3 Group, composed of 5 women who are small-business owners. They all work selling clothing, natural products, shoes, food, etc. Her family is composed of herself, her husband, and two children. Her business is a cafeteria where she sells all kinds of food, from snacks like sandwiches and juices to lunches of seafood and more. She tells us that her greatest challenge is to have a stable business, and she most enjoys watching television and cooking in her free time.

Carmen is very excited to receive her first loan from Esperanza Internacional. She has had her business for around 2 years and she started it when the former owner she was working with gave it up. Carmen plans to use her loan to buy juices, fruits, snacks, meat, and seafood. She is going to use her earnings to pay for her children's education, and she will also save some money. She desires to have a self-sustainable business that will generate enough earnings to support her family in order to count on a better future.

loans.use: To buy juices, soft drinks, seafood

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Communal Bank group "Pink Women," located in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao, and the department of Puno. She is 26 years old, single and has no children. She has a secondary school education.

Vilma has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years. Her first loan was for the amount of 300 PEN, to buy and fatten small animals, including pigs and chickens. Two years ago, she opened a grocery store, with the help of the first loan. 

She is now asking for a loan of 1,500 PEN, to purchase more products for her grocery selling business. 

Her dream is to open another store in a nearby city, filled with products, and to buy herself a vehicle.  What she likes about the Communal Bank is the group work.

loans.use: The purchase of more products for her business selling groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase two doors and a window for her house

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo L. is from the village of San Jose. He is 38 years old. Romeo is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Romeo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Romeo has been engaged in his business for over 11 years and earns approximately 25000 PHP during harvest season.

In 2007, Romeo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romeo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 26000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. 

Romeo is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Romeo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: María Genara

texts.en:
Maria is fifty-nine years old.  She lives in the district of Las Lomas in the province of Piura.  It is a semi-tropical region populated by small farmers and ranchers.  There are many small fruit plantations alongside cattle and goats.  Maria is a single mother.  She owns her own home and shares it with her daughter.

Out of her home, Maria operates a small general store.  She sells basic items to her neighbors, greatly reducing the time it takes for them to complete their shopping journeys.  Maria sells soap, foods, dry goods and other items.  Maria has the help of her daughter in the daily operations and has a good number of loyal customers.  She is proud to provide for her family and neighbors in an independent manner.

This will be Maria’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  She plans to use the loan proceeds to expand her merchandise and better meet the demand of her clients.  She hopes to be able to obtain bulk discounts.  Maria dreams of expanding her business and making various improvements to her home.  She also hopes to be able to assist her daughter in her education.

loans.use: To expand her merchandise and better meet the demand of her customers

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. She is 42 years old and has a common-law husband and five children. Juana has a business making and selling furniture in the Baratillo part of Cusco, and also will accept and fill specific orders from customers elsewhere. Additionally, Juana has a washing and dry-cleaning business in her house. She is asking for the loan to invest in raw materials for her furniture business. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her furniture-making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy all the necessary tools

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth W. lives in the Ntinda neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 8 children, all of whom are in school. Elizabeth has a business of a retail shop. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Elizabeth sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail. Elizabeth has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of soap, cartons of salt, boxes of biscuits, and cooking oil. 

She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenges for Elizabeth include transportation and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a car to ease transport and sell wholesale only. Elizabeth lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cans of cooking oil

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba M. is divorced and has six children. For the past seven years, Aba has been preparing and selling gari (a major staple in Ghana made from grated cassava) in Dompoase near Elmina, Cape Coast. Her income is used to support her six children and pay for their school fees 
Aba’s focused on growing her business to improve her earnings. She will use the loan to purchase more cassava to prepare more gari for sale. 
In this picture, Aba is in the process of stir-frying the gari.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to prepare more gari for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital for her weaving business

loans.name: Reynaluz

texts.en:
Reynaluz G. is from the village of Brgy. Bagahabag,Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old, widowed and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Reynaluz sells fruit and vegetables at a local market. Reynaluz has had her business for about five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

In 2011, Reynaluz joined Kiva field partner ASKI to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynaluz is requesting her first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use any additional revenue generated from her business to financially support members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Lino Oswaldo

texts.es:
Lino Oswaldo A. T. tiene 18 años, es soltero  vive  con la madre y el padre en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. No Tiene hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS esta constituida por 12 socios esta se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de mora, tomate y maíz, son agrícolas por mas de 10 años los mas antiguos y otros miembros que están comenzando con esta actividad.

Lino se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, tomate y maíz en grandes cantidades, las compras las realiza en Chillanes en Agro y las vende los días domingos en la feria de Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es culminar la carrera.


Le gusta jugar  ser una persona alegre.
texts.en:
Lino Oswaldo A. T., 18, is single living with his mother and father in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.  He has no children.

The “COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS” (Blackberry Farmers Cooperative) communal bank has 12 members and is located 20 minutes from the office in Chillanes.  The members of this communal bank are farmers, especially of blackberries, tomatoes and corn.  The older ones have been farming for over ten years and the others are just starting out in this activity.

Lino farms blackberries, tomatoes and corn in large quantities.  He makes his purchases at Agro in Chillanes and sells at the Chillanes Sunday farmers market.

He’s requesting a loan to buy supplies like seed, manure and fertilizer.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  His dream is to complete his career.

He enjoys playing and being a cheerful person.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cloth and some new design dress making supplies

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.ru: Hamlet I. 45 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Hamlet yavlyayetsya IDP personom, on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy jenoy i detmi. Hamlet uje 11 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom , razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya molochnix produktov dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Hamlet I. is 45 years old.  He is married and has two children.  Hamlet is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his wife and children. Hamlet has been a dairy farmer for eleven years.   Now he needs 2300 AZN to buy cows to increase his milk production.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa E. runs a provision store in Elmina, a fishing town in Ghana’s Central Region. She has run this store for 20 years and she sells a variety of items, including soap, tinned food, toilet rolls, eggs, slippers and diapers.
 
Adjoa plans to grow her business further by adding more items. She believes that more variety and also larger quantities of certain items will cater to the needs of her clients. She also hopes to attract some new customers. With her Kiva loan, she intends to purchase items such as milk, Milo (a brand of malted milk) and sugar. 

Adjoa intends to reinvest some of the additional earnings and save up the rest for her family’s future. She has three children and her income pays for their schooling and the family’s household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase items such as milk, Milo and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Uulkan's Group

texts.en:
Uulkan is the leader of this group. She is 49 and, unfortunately, she is a widow. She takes care of three children: two daughters and a son. The older daughter studies at university and the other children are at school. Uulkan works as a teacher at the local school. Six years ago she saved 10 000 soms from her salary and purchased a calf and two sheep. Since then, Uulkan has been breeding farm animals. With the loan she wants to purchase additional cattle for breeding. In the future Uulkan wants to increase the number of cattle and save some money to purchase a vehicle, but her main purpose is to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción vive con su compañero de vida y su hija en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de ropa en el lugar de su residencia con la mantiene su hogar, la gente la visita porque vende prendas de todo tipo y sobre todo novedosas para damas, caballeros y niños su clientela la prefiere porque tiene siempre lo que necesitan, a precios accesibles y con un excelente servicio. Concepción piensa  que solo aquel que está a la vanguardia es aquel que puede hacer realidad sus sueños, es por eso que siempre está adelante de la competencia y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más prendas como vestidos, pantalones, faldas, camisas, blusas entre otros. De esta forma siempre tendrá que ofrecerles a sus clientes y Concepción tendrá la oportunidad de darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Concepción lives with her life partner and her daughter in their own house. She sells clothes from her home. People visit her home in order to buy all types of items, mostly novelties for women, men and children. Her customers like her business because she always has what they need, at reasonable prices and with excellent service Concepción thinks that only the newest styles are the ones that will reach the dreams of her customers. It is for this reason that she is always ahead of the competition and also is why she is asking for this loan from INTEGRAL. This loan will allow her to buy more items such as dresses, pants, skirts and blouses among other things. In this way she always has something new to offer her customers. She also will have the opportunity to give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy dresses, pants, skirts, shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Zenobia; tiene 19 años de edad; la socia es soltera; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa la socia trabaja viajando a diferentes lugares como Cusco, Lima para comprar ropa al por mayor para la venta, la socia es una mujer trabajadora y desea prosperar, ella desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de ropa al por mayor  para la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa ala por mayor.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "SR. DE TAYANCANI".  She lives in the district of Ocongate in the province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco.

Zenobia, 19, is single and buys and sells clothing, working in different places around Cusco.  Lima is where she buys wholesale clothing for resale.  She is a hard worker and wants to get ahead.  The loan will be used to buy wholesale clothing.

She is very grateful for the loan since it will help her expand her business and improve her lifestyle.  She is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna works hard to support her family. Erna is married and has a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years. Erna requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store like eggs, sugar, groceries, etc.

In the future, Erna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store like eggs, sugar, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Tilman

texts.es: Desde que está vinculado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace 9 años ha recibido 11 financiamientos y el onceavo es justamente su credikiva, con el comprará materias primas e insumos para incrementar su capital de trabajo, pues con el anterior financiamiento logrò mejorar su disponibilidad de sillas y mesas y su negocio ahora es mas visitado y  requiere una nueva inyecciòn de capital de trabajo, la cual planea serà exitosa gracias a su gran experiencia, a su vocacion de servicio y a que es una persona que siempre trabaja para alcanzar sus sueños. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Tilman ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/254936
texts.en: Since he connected with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo 9 years ago, he has received 11 loans and the eleventh is precisely his Kiva credit.  With it, he will buy prime materials and supplies to increase his working capital.  With his previous loan he managed to improve his availability of chairs and tables, and his business is now more frequented.  He requires a new injection of working capital.  He plans it will be successful thanks to his great amount of experience to his service vocation, as he is a person who always works to reach his dreams.  If you want to know Tilman’s history, go to the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/254936.

loans.use: buy more prime materials and supplies to increase his working capital.

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en: Mrs. Sieng is the mother of nine children, and heading such a large family is a significant responsibility.  Two of her children work as factory workers in Phnom Penh. Five are married and have moved away from home.  Four are single.  Presently, Mrs.Sieng is a farmer and her husband works as a palm climber, harvesting coconuts.  He earns $3 per day.  Mrs.Sieng and her husband wish to borrow $500 in order to repair their old and run down house.

loans.use: to repair their old and run down house.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has three children. One of his children works.

Alaa has owned a workshop since 2006. He repairs all kinds of cycles (motorcycles and bikes). He has good experience in this field. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $1,800 loan in order to enlarge his shop and to make sliding doors. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to enlarge his shop and to make sliding doors.

loans.name: Jeyson

texts.es: Jeyson de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y su hijo de  un año, allí mismo tiene un negocio llamado Variedades Jeisylibiana, donde vende accesorios femeninos, ropa, calzado, cosméticos, perfumes, colonias y bisutería en general. El negocio de Jeyson inició como una “chaza” en la puerta de su casa, a la que gradualmente fue adicionando vitrinas, mercancías variadas y todo lo que su creciente clientela solicitaba y él no tenía; finalmente adecuó un local en la vivienda donde habita e hizo de su negocio toda una miscelánea, como en la actualidad se encuentra. Sus ventas son diarias y en su mayoría de contado, por lo cual sus cuentas por cobrar no son significativas, también se refleja un menor valor en muebles y enseres razón por la que sus activos corrientes son más representativos que los activos totales. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y estabilizarlo de tal manera que su trabajo proporcione mayor bienestar cada día a su familia. En la actualidad su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente para responder a su creciente clientela y esta es la razón por la cual quiere aumentarlo con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará la mercancía que más circula, como accesorios femeninos, ropa y la línea cosmética y de perfumería.
texts.en: Jeyson is 23 and lives in the city of Cartagena with his wife and 1-year-old son.  He has a business there named "Variedades Jeisylibiana," where he sells women's accessories, clothing, shoes, cosmetics, perfume, cologne, and costume jewelry.  His business started as a display case at the door of his home, to which he gradually added display cases, various merchandise, and everything his growing customer base requested that he didn't have.  He finally fixed up a location in his home where he lives and made his business a general store, where he currently works.  He makes his sales daily, and the majority of them are paid for with cash.  His sales on credit aren't significant.  He also has a small amount of furniture and household equipment, which is why his current assets are more representative that his total assets.  His goal is to grow his business and to stabilize it in such a way that his work brings more well-being every day to his family.  Currently his working capital is insufficient to respond to his growing customer base, and that is why he wants to increase it with this loan.  It is the first loan that he has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and he will use it to buy the merchandise he sells the most of, like feminine accessories, clothing, cosmetics, and perfume.

loans.use: to buy merchandise that he sells the most of, like women's accessories, clothing, cosmetics, and perfume

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Chantha, 54 years old, is a construction worker who earns $5 per day. His wife stays home to take care of the children. This couple has four children. Three are working in the factory for $2 each per day. Every month, he has to spend $50 on food, and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy wood to repair his house. In the future he hopes to have a good house to live in with his family. He does not want to change his career.

loans.use: To buy wood to repair his house

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es: Octavio casado, hombre trabajador, comerciante, juntos a su familia ha logrado ampliar su negocio. Su proyecto es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. Inicio con fondos propios y a la necesidad de generar mayores ingresos. Se le ha presentado dificultades con el alza en los precios del cerdo. Planes a corto plazo ampliar la comercialización de sus productos e ingresar nueva variedad de producto. El préstamo que solicitad será para la compra de materia prima como es el cerdo entero ofreciéndole a su clientela mayor cantidad y calidad de producto. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Octavio is a married, hard-working merchant. He and his family have been able to expand his business. His project now is to improve his home. He started off with his own funds and the need to generate a better income. He has experienced difficulties with the rise of prices for pork. In the short-term, he plans to expand his sales and introduce new products. The requested loan is for the purchase of basic materials such as a whole hog. He will be able to offer his customers better quantity and quality. He thanks the lenders for their support in developing his business and improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase hogs

loans.name: Kulukan's Group

texts.en:
Kulukan is the leader of this group. She is 55 and unfortunately a widow, and has raised a son and a daughter. Her son provides tractor driver services and her daughter studies at university. In order to earn money for her livelihood, Kulukan breeds poultry and cultivates agricultural products such as wheat and potatoes. Ten years ago she purchased forty hens and she was selling about 30 eggs a day. 

At the moment Kulukan's monthly profit is about 6000 soms. Kulukan has applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase ten hens for breeding and 200 liters of fuel for collecting the harvest. In the future, with the profits gained from the business she plans to improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), planet (remaining environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and fuel for collecting the harvest.

loans.name: Phillip

texts.en:
Phillip has been a farmer for the last eight years. He is 34 years old and married. 

He is client who has been with KADET for a while. This is his third loan, which he plans to spend to purchase farm supplies (pesticides and seedlings) and to buy livestock for fattening. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.

His dream is to be the best and most wel known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and livestock

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 37 years old. She is married and has two children. She has a rented stall at the market where she sells different kinds of vegetables, spices, and the usual cooking condiments like vinegar, soy sauce, and powdered seasonings. She has had this business for seven  years. 

Lucia has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more vegetables, spices, and cooking condiments.  She became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, spices, and cooking condiments for sale.

loans.name: Magidu

texts.en: Magidu wants a loan to buy cattle for slaughter. This butcher shop owner is married with three children whom he would like to see get a good education. He started this business from savings from his farm five years ago. He faces a problem of inflation and higher prices. In future he would like to buy a motorcycle to help him ease transport costs.

loans.use: to buy cattle for slaughter.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is divorced and has five dependents. She sells maize at Dompoase. She has been selling maize for 12 years. Ekua is responsible for the upkeep of her children. She will use her loan to purchase bulk maize. Ekua will expand her business with her profit.

loans.use: to purchase bulk maize

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 33 años, es una mujer buena y muy amable, es conviviente co su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 16 y 11 años de edad, ella vive en una casa propia a lado de sus hijos y su conviviente con quien trabaja mucho para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. EL trabajo de Sonia consiste en la venta de abarrotes en su tienda. Su negocio se encuentra situado en una calle que es muy transitada y por tanto hay mucha afluencia de gente. Lleva trabajando por un año en este negocio y hasta el momento lo ha hehco sola. Le gusta mucho su trabajo por que le permite realizar muchas cosas, como poder disponer de su tiempo y estar a lado de sus hijos al mismo tiempo que genera  ingresos a su familia. Tiene el apoyo incondicional de su pareja con quien vende a diario y se turnan para que el negocio no le sea estresante a ninguno de los dos. Agradece que todo le esta yendo bien y espera mas adelante ampliar su negocio y así poder generar mas ingresos. Este será el crédito número 8 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará productos para abastecer su bodega.
texts.en:
Sonia, 33, is a kind and very friendly woman. She lives with her partner, and they have two children, ages 16 and 11. She lives in her own house with her children and her partner, with whom she works hard to provide a better quality of life for their family. 

Sonia sells groceries in her store. Her business is located on a very busy street, and therefore there is a large flow of people. She has been working in this business for a year, and up to now, she has done it on her own. 

She really likes her work, because it allows her to do many things; such as having time to be with her children, at the same time as she is generating income for her family. She has the unconditional support of her partner, with whom she sells every day, and they take turns so that the store isn't stressful for either of them. 

She is thankful that everything is going well, and hopes to expand her business in future, and so generate more income. This will be her eighth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have a loan, so that she can continue increasing her working capital. With the amount of 2,000 soles she is applying for, she will buy products for stocking her store.

loans.use: To buy products for stocking her store.

loans.name: Vumilia Group

texts.en:
Everline is the facilitator of the Vumilia group. Everline and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Everline takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for her family and to have much technology in production. In the recent 2011 season, Everline had a very good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Everline was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Everline will educate her children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Vumilia group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Everline with her group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mena Aba

texts.en: Mena Aba sells fish at Ankwanda near Elmina. She is married to a farmer with 6 dependents. She has sold fish for the past 10 years. Aba assists the husband in supporting their children. She will use her loan to purchase more fish. Aba will expand her business with her new profits.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Ndatté

texts.fr: Madame Ndatté est âgée  de 36 ans. C’est une femme  mère de 2 enfants qui ont 8 et 11 ans.  Elle s’active depuis plus de 5 ans dans le secteur  du commerce. Elle vend des bracelets et des perles. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par passion. Elle est plutôt intéressée  par les bénéfices que lui procure  son n activité. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de sa zone d’habitation  depuis aout 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit d 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de perles  pour en faire des bracelets  pour les  besoins  de son commerce. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices et  améliorer la situation de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Ndatté is 36 years old. She is a mother of two children, aged 8 and 11. She has been selling things for more than 5 years. She sells bracelets and pearls. She chose this business from passion. She enjoys the profits her business brings. She has been a member of a local U-IMCEC branch since August 2011. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 frs to buy pearls with which to make bracelets to meet her business needs. Her goal is to increase her earnings and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pearls

loans.name: Lwambi

texts.en: Lwambi is a 38 year old divorced man. He has two children who range from 3 to 5 years old. He describes himself as commited and responsible. Lwambi operates a restaurant where he sells food, tea and snacks. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located within a residential area. He describes his biggest business challenge as the high cost of ingredients for food. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more ingredients for food and pay for the furnishing of his restaurant. Lwambi's business goal is to run multiple hotels within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food and pay for furnishing his restaurant.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila lives in Pavlograd and sells drinks and bakery items in the central city market. She is a married mom. Her husband is a coal miner and her son Artyom is 15 and goes to school.
 
After graduation from medical college, Ludmila worked as a nurse. However, she was laid off and decided to try her luck as an entrepreneur. Today, Ludmila’s vending location is well known in the market because the inventory she offers for sale is always fresh and of good quality. She has been in business for 6 years. 

Ludmila is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnas to increase her turnover capital. She is hoping to purchase additional merchandise that would increase her family income. Some of Ludmila's long-term plans are to purchase additional equipment for her kiosk, such as a refrigerator and a microwave.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: 032101020001.định Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyệt has a service to separate the grain from the rice seed coat. She is requesting a loan to purchase a machine to separate the grain from the rice seed coat and do this service for farmers.
Nguyệt is applying for a loan to purchase a rice mill to use for work. She has a retail business selling dry food.

Nguyệt is 36 years old and she is married with 4 children. She lives with her 4 dependents in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Nguyệt is the group leader of the 032101020001.Định Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

Nguyệt has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In 2014, Nguyệt  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Nguyệt hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to separate the grain from the rice seed coat and do this service for farmers

loans.name: T_F_Katelepai_Roseobwana Group

texts.en:
Rose, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years and is now proud to represent her group of 15 farmers in Teso District. She is 40 years old, is married, and has 5 children.

Rose likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had more profits from each harvest. Rose plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Rose’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 12 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a single mother having 2 children and caring for 2 others. She a very courageous lady and active.

She has dealt in this business since 1996 and it has enabled her educate her children and even the ones she is caring for, these children have finished their education and these is out the profits she could get from her business.

She is dealing in selling of Textile and assorted goods and this business has been so helpful to her.

She is currently having too much demand and yet the stock is low. This is why she is applying for a loan to help her increase on her stock.

She is requesting for a loan of $1500 to hellp her improve on the business. She is a very capable woman and will be able to pay back promptly.

loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Sassou

texts.en:
A mason by trade, Sassou A. is married and the father of three. He is the eldest of 12 children in a family in which both parents died prematurely. This predicament has forced him to abandon his studies. And having no money, he no longer practices his trade. To meet the needs of his family which weigh heavily on him, he got eight months of formal training in the truck farming sector producing bundles of vegetables for sale at the marketplace. Now, like a bird, he soars on his own. But devastatingly, he lacks the means to promote his business and to turn a profit. And so he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy tubing and the necessary materials for an electrical installation, fertilizer, and other soil and farming supplies likely to make his business worthwhile. The goal is to meet the every-growing demands of his customers and especially to increase his revenues.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Maçon de profession, Monsieur A. Sassou est marié et père de trois (03) enfants. Il est l’aîné d’une famille de 12 enfants dont les parents sont décédés très tôt. Cette situation l’a amené à abandonner ses études et à apprendre un métier qu’il n’exerce pas faute de moyen. Pour faire face aux charges de la famille qui pèsent sur lui, il s’est fait former sur le tas en maraîchage pendant 8 mois et aujourd’hui, il vole de ses propres ailes. Mais les moyens lui manquent cruellement pour promouvoir son activité et en tirer profit. Il sollicite alors un crédit de $1000 pour acheter des tuyaux, les matériels nécessaires pour l’installation électrique et des intrants susceptibles de rentabiliser l’activité afin de répondre aux demandes sans cesse croissantes de sa clientèle et surtout pour augmenter ses revenus.

loans.use: To purchase tubing and materials for the installation of electrical improvements for his farm and for soil amendments

loans.name: Astid

texts.en:
Astrid works selling shoes to contribute to the family budget. She has two children in school and though her husband works as a laborer for a company, the wages that he receives are very low. The family’s expenses are high, and they are making payments on a house that they were able to purchase through a loan that they received through Infonavit. By bringing in extra income she is able to pay some of the household expenses and support her husband without neglecting her family.

Astrid is asking for a $675 loan to purchase merchandise and to meet her customers’ demand. She offers to repay the loan within 3 to 6 months, and asks for your support to help her to progress and to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Astrid decidió vender zapatos para contribuir al gasto familiar ya que tiene 2 hijos que estudian y su esposo trabaja en una empresa como obrero y por ello el sueldo que el tiene es muy bajo, y sus gastos son altos aparte que están pagando la casa que pudieron comprar ya que la adquirieron por crédito de Infonavit, de esta manera ella puede solventar algunos gastos del hogar y apoyar a su esposo sin descuidar a su familia.

Astrid esta solicitando un préstamo por US$ 675 para comprar mercadería y satisfacer su demanda, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en un período de 3 a 6 meses, espera de tu apoyo para poder salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio has worked for 2 years in computer scanning, printing, and design production. He started this job after gaining experience working in a cybercafe. He also studies graphic design at the university, which has helped him gain a great understanding of this subject. He works everyday and does not have a fixed schedule.

Julio asks for loan to purchase a scanner and reams of paper for larger quantity printing since there is a great demand from his university colleagues, also allowing him to attend to all his clients.

Julio is 23 years old. He is single and lives with his parents, helping with the some of the household expenses. Since a very young age, he started working and helping around the house. He is studying at the university, but he also contributes to the betterment of his family's life through the income generated at his business. He counts on his older brother's and parent's support. He hopes that with the loan his business can grow and improve his income, allowing him and his family a better way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Julio lleva 2 años dedicado a la realización de trabajos en computación como escaneo, digitación, impresiones y elaboración de diseños. El inicio esta actividad porque trabajó en un cyber café y allí adquirió más experiencia sobre el negocio. El además estudia en la universidad diseño gráfico lo que le ha permitido tener mayor conocimiento en esta área. El no tiene un horario fijo para su trabajo ya que lo realizada todos los días.

Julio desea su crédito para comprar un scanner y resmas de hojas para realizar mayor impresiones ya que tiene gran demanda de trabajos que realizar sobre todo de su compañeros de la universidad, lo que le permitirá atender a todos sus clientes.

Julio tiene 23 años, es soltero vive en la casa de sus padres, el ayuda con algunos gastos del hogar. Desde muy adolescente empezó a trabajar y ayudar con lo necesario en su hogar. El esta estudiando en la Universidad hasta el medio día y con el ingreso que le genera su negocio también esta ayudando a mejorar la vivienda de sus padres. El cuenta con el apoyo de su hermano mayor y la de sus padres. El desea con nuestro crédito hacer que su negocio crezca y de esta manera ir mejorando sus ingresos que le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida tanto para el y su familia.

loans.use: To purchase a scanner and paper for a popular scanning and printing business

loans.name: Sarraf

texts.en:
Mr. Sarraf s is a low-income vulnerable person. He is 39, married with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Sarraf has his own bread shop. His bread is in great demand among customers because it is very tasty. His baker (shown in the picture) says that sometimes when breads are sold out, it is hard to see the eyes of the empty-handed customers. Sarraf decided to apply for a $1000 loan from the Normicro Saatli branch. When he receives the loan, he can buy more meal to make his monthly income higher. With the extra income, he will repay back the loan he received and after that save money to buy a microwave oven for the bakery.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia M. Yujra is a single mother of two, and she does different jobs. Her main activity is making cloth handicrafts: tapestry, skirts and others. She has done this job since she was 14. At that age Eugenia had her fist baby, she then needed to develop some workmanship to support herself and her child. Eugenia has a second job selling seeds, roasted peanuts and beans, popcorn and sweet noodles. She brings these from Copacabana to sale them in town festivals and folk events were people consume them in large amounts. Now Eugenia needs some money to carry on with her handicrafts making business, because this represents a steady income. Selling seeds is only an occasional job and she needs to support her kids.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Eugenia M. Yujra, soltera pero madre de dos hijos, tiene muchas actividades, entre las cuales y más importantes podemos mencionar la confección de artesanías en tela, como ser mantas, polleras y otros, oficio al que se dedica desde sus 14 años, edad en la que tuvo su primer hijo, que la obligó a desarrollar alguna destreza para salir adelante. Su segunda actividad principal, es la venta de leguminosas, maní tostado, porotos tostados, pasankallas, y fideo dulce, productos que compra de la localidad de Copacabana y vende en las fiestas de pueblo, entradas folklóricas y otros, donde el consumo de estos es masivo y en grandes cantidades. Actualmente Eugenia precisa de capital para poder continuar con su negocio de confección, que a diferencia de su segunda actividad no genera tantos ingresos, pero es el más constante, puesto que la venta de los productos que trae de Copacabana solo se vende de forma eventual y ella precisa generar ingresos para la subsistencia de sus hijos.

loans.use: Eugenia needs this money to carry on with her making of cloth handicraft for a steady income.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio is man that even at sixty years old still radiates optimism, even though the economic hardships he’s endured have depressed him at times. He works incessantly to help all members of his large family, especially for the development of the young grandchildren that live with him. Daily living requires a necessary amount of money, for this reason Lucio works tirelessly on his small farm cultivating various products and taking care of his animals both of which are sold at the local market. He also sells his products in a little kiosk to supplement the family income. He wishes to upgrade the kiosk as well as improve his agricultural products in hopes of improving his dear wife’s health which has deteriorated with the passage of time. With the desire of watching is family’s standard of living improve, he’ll keep on working hard. Let us support Lucio’s fighting spirit and not let him get discouraged by life’s difficulties through a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Lucio, es un hombre que a pesar de tener sesenta años sigue irradiando gran optimismo, por más que las dificultades económicas por las que ha atravesado en algún momento lo hayan deprimido. Trabaja incesantemente por contribuir con todos los miembros de su numerosa familia y especialmente por el desarrollo de sus pequeños nietos que viven con él. El sostén diario requiere de una importante suma de dinero y es por ello que Lucio trabaja incansablemente en su chacrita cultivando diversos productos y cuidando a sus animalitos, que luego serán vendidos en la feria local, también decidió vender una amplitud de productos en un kiosquito para ayudar incrementar los ingresos económicos de su hogar.Él desea implementar adecuadamente este kiosco y mejorar su producción agrícola, con el propósito de elevar el nivel salud de su querida esposa, que con el paso de los años se ha deteriorado. Con el afán de ver cada vez mejor a su querida familia seguirá esforzándose. Apoyemos a Lucio a seguir lidiando y a no desalentarse por las dificultades de la vida, a través de un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities and varietis of products for the small kiosk.

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria de los Angeles has been selling food for over 2 years. This the main source of income for her family since she is a single mother. Her daughters work with her and help her selling prepared foods. However, they need to purchase more cooking supplies in order to prepare foods at a faster speed. They request a loan for $550 to purchase this equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria De Los Ángeles se dedica a la venta de comidas ella tiene ya mas de 2 años con su negocio. Esta es la fuente de ingreso de mi familia soy madre soltera en mi negocio trabajamos una de mis hijas y yo vendemos comida preparada. Pero nos esta haciendo falta más material y equipo de cocina para preparar más rápido los alimentos. Solicito un préstamo de $ 550.00 Dlls para la compra de equipo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Pigy Lestari Group

texts.id:
Rearing pigs appear to be a common activity performed by mothers living in Sumbersari village. But because limited availability of funding, such activity were not carried out well, until the emergent of the idea of forming pig rearing groups with the hope that being together in a group thus able to have the opportunity to expend activity funding from parties are interested with the existence of small business. The name “Pigy Lestari” (Eternal Pigy) was finally selected as the name of the group with 11 members, with Ni Komang Ratiani as the leader. After the group Pigy Lestari was formed the members submit a start-up loan application with DINARI, whether for capital funding or veterinary assistance. From each funding they attained, will be used to purchase piglets, mother pig and also feed and supplies. Income from the sale varies depending on market situation. Gain is usually greater during religious celebrations because demand for pork is high thus increasing the price of pork. From 1 piglet alone, the net gain is approximately Rp 400.000, - after rearing for 6 months. Each gain will be use to supplement the families financial needs. All members of the Pigy Lestari group hope the start-up funding from DINARI will further advance their business also able to develop.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Memelihara ternak babi merupakan hal yang biasa dilakukan oleh ibu-ibu yang tinggal di dusun Sumbersari. Tetapi karena keterbatasan modal, usaha yang mereka tekuni ini tidak bisa berjalan dengan baik, sehingga munculah ide untuk membentuk kelompok peternak babi dengan harapan bahwa setelah tergabung dalam sebuah kelompok maka mereka akan memiliki peluang untuk mengusahakan modal usaha dari pihak lain yang peduli dengan keberadaan usaha kecil. Nama “Pigy Lestari” akhirnya dipilih sebagai nama kelompok mereka dengan jumlah anggota seluruhnya 11 orang,yang diketuai oleh Ni Komang Ratiani. Setelah kelompok Pigy Lestari ini terbentuk maka mereka mengajukan permohonan pembinaan kepada DINARI baik itu dalam permodalan maupun pendampingan oleh dokter hewan. Dari setiap modal yang mereka peroleh, itu dipakai untuk membeli bibit penggemukan, penginduk dan juga stok pakan untuk ternak mereka. Hasil penjualan yang biasa mereka peroleh cukup bervariasi berdasarkan situasi pasar. Keuntungan tertinggi bisa mereka peroleh menjelang hari-hari besar agama karena biasanya kebutuhan akan daging babi cukup banyak sehingga hargapun juga meningkat. Dari satu ekor penggemukan saja keuntungan bersih yang bisa diperoleh sekitar Rp 400.000,- setelah dipelihara selama 6 bulan. Dari setiap keuntungan yang diperoleh ini mereka pergunakan untuk membantu mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga. Semua anggota kelompok Pigy Lestari berharap pembinaan yang mereka peroleh dari DINARI bisa berlanjut terus sehingga usaha mereka juga bisa berkembang.

loans.use: Purchase piglets, mother and feed supplies (Membeli bibit penginduk dan pakan)

loans.name: Ghazala's Group

texts.en: I am Ghazala A.. I am 38, married and a mother of seven: five boys and two girls. We reside in Lahore, a big metropolis in Pakistan. I and my husband both create ready made garments. We have been in this business for a long time and have forte at our work. We would like to have a loan to assist us in making and developing our business further by the purchase of a computerized embroidery machine. Please also lend to my subgroup members: Mehmooda A. needs this loan for her brother who sells ready made garments.  Bano B. is requesting a loan for her husband who runs a tea stall and needs to buy mugs, tea and sugar. Manda B. is borrowing for her husband who operates a printing press. All these women dream of a comfortable and sound economic life for their kids.

loans.use: Expand ready made garments business

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is 26-years-old and is married with one 3-year-old child. She and her husband also take care of another 3-year-old child. Hadija sells electrical equipment. She started this business in 2006. She works from 6AM to 4PM and earns a monthly profit of $90.

She now hopes for a loan to purchase additional equipment to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of electrical equipment

loans.name: Maximiliana's Group

texts.es:
Justina, Maximiliana, and Yeny have belonged to the communal bank "Milenio" for six years, six years, and one year respectively.

Justina is married, is 34 years old, and has two children. She travels to fairs in the region where she buys grains to sell in the markets of Ayacucho and Pisco. She also works in a garage.

Maximiliana is married, 44 years old, and has six children. Yeny, on the other hand, lives with her partner, is 27 years old and has two children. Maximiliana and Yeny are street vendors in the market "Nery García."

Justina, Maximiliana and Yeny need loans for 300, 1000, and 750 soles ($750 total) which they will invest in quinoa, wheat, beans, potato, peas, and, in Yeny's case, in paying off her land.

The women dream of building a home, having a car, and having their children study to become professionals.
