Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Justina, Maximiliana y Yeny pertenecen al Banco Comunal Milenio hace 6, 6, 1 años respectivamente.

Justina es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Justina viaja a las ferias de la región donde compra cereales que vende en los mercados de Ayacucho y Pisco. Además Justina trabaja en un garaje.

Por otro lado Maximiliana es casada, tiene 44 años y 6 hijos, Mientras que Yeny es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Maximiliana y Yeny venden comida de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García.

Justina, Maximiliana y Yeny necesitan préstamos de 300 soles, 1000 soles, 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de quinua, trigo, haba, papa, arveja, mientras que Yeny invertirá como parte del pago de su terreno.

Los sueños de Justina, Maximiliana y Yeny son construir su casa, tener un carro, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of various grains and foodstuffs for sale at markets, as well as making payments on their land.

loans.name: Eng Rang Group

texts.en: Mrs. Eng R. is the group leader of five members in Sdok Slat Village in Kampong Speu Province. Mrs. Eng R., 29, is a subsistence farmer, and she is always cooking food for her family. In her farming business, Mrs. Eng R. has faced an infertile field and a drought. Therefore, Mrs. Eng R. now wants a loan to buy more fertilizers to support the cultivatable land, and also to rent a pump to water her field. Her husband, Mr. Khorn Khoun, is a construction worker in the village, and he can generate a small income to support the family. Mrs. Eng R. is the mother of three children; one of the oldest children is employed in a garment factory. The second child died in a car accident. The last one is too young to work or study. Mrs. Eng R. has previously obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizers for her plantation.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and rent a water pump

loans.name: Nikolai

texts.en:
Nikolai’s shoe repair business is located on the Koryatovicha square in downtown Uzhgorod. The location is perfect for this type of business, as the central square is a busy place and many potential customers pass by Nikolai’s kiosk every day. Another attraction of his business is the quality service and the welcoming attitude. Nikolai has been investing in his business for the past 6 years and currently has about US$1,600 of turnover capital. His income is about US$300 a month. 

Nikolai is requesting a loan of US$1,125 to be able to purchase additional raw materials for his business wholesale. Nikolai is a skilled shoe repair master and, in the future, would like to apply his skills more fully by not only repairing, but also making footwear. He is hoping that wise financial management and his determination will help him reach this goal.

loans.use: Purchase of additional raw materials for a shoe repair business

loans.name: Tahiya's Uvumlivu Group

texts.en:
25-year-old Tahiya is a divorcee who became a cake and juice seller in 2008. Every day, she works from 8am to 12pm at her business.

Tahiya now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer Y. has been selling loaves of bread since 2003. She is 30-years-old, married and the mother of three children. The family lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. Jennifer is requesting a loan to purchase more loaves of bread for resale to keep up with the demand.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread for resale

loans.name: Wahida's Wanawake Na Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Wahida is 27 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 7 and 2. She has sold charcoal, bites (snacks), and juice since 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90.

Wahida is looking for a loan to improve her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Farida, who sells with perfumes.

loans.use: To improve her businesss.

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.en:
Zuhra was born in 1951 and lives in Gračanica, a small town in Bosnia. She is a widow and receives 396KM/month from her late-husband's pension plan. (The equivalent of roughly $260USD.) This is not enough income to meet her basic needs, so she also takes care of sick people at the local clinic, earning an additional 100KM/month.

At the clinic, Zuhra also takes care of her mother, who is in the photograph. Zuhra requests a 1,500KM loan from Women for Women International, to purchase supplies to take care of her mother and other patients. Her wish is to give her mother the best care available, to make her sickness easier to bear.

loans.use: to purchase medical supplies for a clinic

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mr. Chanthorn S. is 43 years old and he lives in Ponley village in Takeo Province with his wife, Mrs. Mol Nam. They are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. They have five children, one of whom is a teacher in a state school while the other four are enrolled in the local school.

Because their income is low, it is hard to save and they want to increase income. Thus, Mr. Chanthorn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es: La Joven Martha Lidia  está solicitando su1er crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Repellar la vivienda), trabaja como docente en la colonia Providencia a 32 km de Nueva Guinea  desde hace 2 años, todos los dias tiene que  levantarse a las 4 de la mañana para viajar y dejar el desayuno hecho para su esposo, por las tardes cuando regresa de dar clase se dedica a cuidar a su hijo, terminar de hacer los quehaceres del hogar y por la noche a planear la clase para impartirla el siguiente dia a sus alumnos, Martha es una mujer  profesional responsable, honesta, trabajadora, vive en la zona # 5 de Nueva Guinea donde la población cada dia crece mas,  tiene un bebe de 10 meses, su esposo trabaja como agricultor, ambos comparte los gastos del hogar; su sueño es   seguir  estudiando, salud y en el futuro tener una casa bonita con todas las condiciones  para que su hijito crezca en un ambiente sano y tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia ya son de escasos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Martha Lida is asking for her first loan in order to invest in home improvements. Martha works as a teacher in colonia Providencia, 32 kilometers outside of Nueva Guinea. She's been working for two years, and every day she wakes up at 4am in order to make breakfast for her husband and travel to work. In the afternoons Martha returns from class and cares for her son. She finishes her chores and spends her evenings putting together lesson plans for the following day. Martha is a professional, responsible, honest, and hard-working young woman. She lives in zone #5 of Nueva Guinea, where the population is growing rapidly. Martha has a ten month old baby and her husband works as a farmer. Martha and her husband share the household expenses. Their dream is to continue their studies, and to be healthy. In the future they'd like to have a beautiful home where their son can grow up in a healthy environment and have job security, so that he can add to the family's scarce economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: David

texts.es: David cuenta con 24 años de edad, convive hace 8 años con la madre de sus 2 hijos, actualmente están viviendo en la casa de sus suegros, hasta que puedan ahorrar y construir su casa. Hace varios años atrás estuvo trabajando como chofer de motocarro y automóvil, haciendo servicio de transporte interurbano en la ciudad, pero exactamente hace 2 años se compró su motocarro para realizar servicio a domicilio, este trabajo le es muy rentable, ya que al día, descontando todos los gastos, gana entre 40 a 50 soles diarios. David inicia su labor a las 6:00am hasta las 8:00pm. En esta época, debido a que los alumnos están de vacaciones, no le es muy rentable trabajar con su moto, entonces cree que mejor será alquilar su motocarro hasta que mejore la plaza, mientras tanto trabajará como guardián de una cochera de unos familiares, los cuales le darán un sueldo fijo, y más el alquiler de la moto tendrá lo suficiente para cubrir sus gastos. David cree que si no trabaja su motocarro las piezas se vayan a malograr, por ello ha visto por conveniente alquilarla mientras mejore la demanda, y retome su trabajo. Cuando David solicitó su primer préstamo con MFP se comprometió a pagar todas su cuotas, y así lo vino realizando hasta ahora que es su sexto crédito. El dinero solicitado servirá para pagar la tarjeta de circulación de su moto a la municipalidad, con el resto comprará llantas para su vehículo.
texts.en:
David is 24 years old and has lived with the mother of his 2 children for the past 8 years. Currently he is living in his in-laws home, until he can save enough money to build his own house. A few years back he worked as a motorcycle taxi and car chauffer providing intercity transport. Exactly 2 years go he purchased his own motorcycle taxi to provide a delivery service; this job is very profitable for David, given that daily, after discounting costs, he earns between 40 and 50 soles. David begins his workday at 6:00am and ends at 8:00pm. During this time of year, due to the fact that students are on vacation, it is not very profitable for him to work with his motorcycle, which leads him to believe that it would be better to rent out his motorcycle taxi until the main square improves. In the meantime he will work as a security guard at the garage of some relatives who will provide him a fixed salary. This salary and the money he will earn from renting out his motorcycle will provide him with enough to cover his expenses. David believes that if he does not work on his motor taxi the parts will breakdown, for which he sees most convenient to rent out his motor taxi until demand improves and he takes up his job again. When David requested his first loan with the Microfinanzas PRISMA bank he committed himself to pay all his quotas, and he has done so up to date when he is his sixth loan. The money David has requested will serve to purchase a taxi operation permit from the municipality, and with the rest he will purchase tires for his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a taxi operation permit and tires for his motor taxi.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea C. has been growing rice for a long time and she is very skilled at rice farming. She learned these farming  techniques from her grandparents. She is 44 and married with four children. All of her children are single and live in the family home. Her husband, Tin is 47, and earns a living by making traditional cow-carts to sell.  These carts are made from wood. He runs his business very well and a lot of customers recognize the good quality and beauty of his work. In order to become more successful, C. has applied for a loan for her husband to expand his business. C. lives in Pursat Province and she was not available for photographing. Her husband's photo was taken instead.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: María Adela

texts.es:
En el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León, la señora María Adela L. se ha destacado por ser una excelente comerciante de granos básicos tales como maíz, frijoles y arroz siendo vendidos diariamente en su establecimiento el cual posee.

Hoy en día ella requiere del apoyo crediticio de Ceprodel y es por esta razón que ha acudido para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los granos básicos ya que requiere que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta forma suplir sus estantes del producto para mejorar sus ingresos y así continuar beneficiando a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Adela L. operates a small retail business in the Terminal Market in the city of Leon, Nicaragua. She has gotten to be an excellent business person, selling basic commodities including corn, beans and rice, which she offers for sale every day. She now wishes to increase her sales volume and has requested the Ceprodel agency to extend a loan to her to enable her to purchase additional commodities wholesale. Increasing her sales volume will allow her to increase her income, thus improving the life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, beans & rice for resale

loans.name: Raufshon

texts.ru: Рауфчон преподаватель в средней школе. Он женат, ему 37 лет, воспитывает 2 детей. Школу, несмотря на маленькую заработную плату бросать не собирается, поэтому занимается предпринимательством. Направление  его бизнеса  - это купля продажа сушеных абрикосов на местных рынках. Доход небольшой, но дополнительные расходы семьи покрывает. Рауфчон оборачивает свой бизнес небольшими деньгами и поэтому решил обратиться в Микроинвест чтобы получить займ.
texts.en:
Raufshon is a middle school teacher. He is 37 years old, married, and has 2 children. Even though his pay at school is low, he does not plan to quit. So, to support his family, he maintains a small business. His main activity is buying and selling dried apricots at local markets. His income is not large, but still, it is sufficient enough to cover additional family expenses. Raufshon cycles a relatively small amount of money in his business; that is why, he decided to obtain a loan from MicroInvest to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Lĩnh 51 tuổi , gia đình chị có 4 con trong đó có 1 con đang đi học. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005 và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị hiện nay với thu nhập2.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư  mua thêm lợn về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Lĩnh is 51 years old and has four children, one of which is still in school. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2005, using her loans to invest in raising pigs. This is now the activity that provides the main source of income for her family, about 2,000,000 VND (117 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to buy more pigs to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es: Maria Marta R. vive en Soyapango departamento de San Salvador,  junto a su hija. Maria se dedica a su negocio una tortillería ubicada dentro de su vivienda;  la cual es muy demandada en la zona, por los vecinos que prefieren las tortillas de doña Maria; pero Maria no solo hace tortillas, también ha montado una pequeña tienda con productos de primeras de necesidad y otros que sus fieles clientes le exigen, es por ello que Maria esta solicitando un crédito, para invertir en su tienda y tenerla más surtida,  y así sus clientes siempre la preferirán como hasta el día de ahora.
texts.en:
Maria Marta R. lives with her daughter in the Soyapango neighborhood of San Salvador. She operates a tortilleria [a tortilla shop] from her house and her tortillas are in great demand in the neighborhood. But Maria doesn't just make tortillas. She has also set up a small general store selling everyday products and other goods requested by her customers. It's for the store that Maria is applying for this loan. She wants to invest in the store and better stock it so that her customers will always be as pleased with it as they are now.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for general store.

loans.name: María Yadira

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, específicamente en el Mercado Central, la señora María P. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de ropa especialmente ropa interior ofrecida a la intemperie en una localidad del mercado.

Hoy en día la señora P. requiere de una inversión pronta para su negocio por lo que  ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito oportuno para la compra de la ropa interior y de esta manera salir adelante en el negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, specifically in the Central Market, Mrs. María P. tends her business of selling clothes. She sells underwear in the open air in the area of the market. P. needs an investment soon for her business. That is why she has gone to Ceprodel to ask for a timely loan to buy underwear. This is the manner in which she will get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Lila

texts.es:
LILA I. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUESTRA SEÑORA DE LA ESPERANZA”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. CUSCO Mz.I. Lt.24.  Tiene 59 años de edad. Se dedica a la costura desde muy joven, es madre soltera, oficio con el que educó a sus 2 hijos, lo cual la llenan de orgullo y felicidad.

              Ella tiene 5 años en Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para dar mantenimiento de su máquina de coser y poder seguir desarrollando su pequeño negocio. En la actualidad, compra y vende ropa por los caseríos y pueblos que están a fueras de la cuidad.

             Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ropas de damas, caballeros y niños.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque nunca alguna entidad financiera le otorgó un crédito; mientras que Manuela Ramos sin tanto papeleo,  confió en ella y la motiva a ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Lila I. V. is a member of the community bank "Nuestra Senora de la Esperanza" (meaning Our Lady of Hope). She lives in Jr. Cusco Mz.I. Lt. 24. She is 59 years old and she has been a seamstress since she was very young. She is a single mother. With her business she educated her two children who fill her with pride and joy.

She has been with Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for 5 years. With her first loan of S/300 nuevos soles she invested in maintenance repairs to her sewing machine so that she could keep running her business. Currently she buys and sells clothes for the towns and villages outside the city.

With this loan of S/1500 nuevos soles she will purchase lady's, men's and children's clothing.

She is grateful to Manuela Ramos because no other financial institution has ever granted her a loan, and without too much paperwork, she received their trust and this motivates her to be responsible with her payments.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase articles of clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Mrs. Juliana is 69 years old and is married to Mr. Jasinto Rolon. They live in the Alegre neighborhood of the city Caacupe, and work together in a religious articles store. 

The business is located next to the Basilica de Caacupe, which is the large cathedral in the city. Their store has been open for more than 17 years, as it is in a strategic location. Mrs. Juliana has a lot of business on Sundays, but also has a well-established clientele in Asunción, where she sells her traditional Paraugayan thermoses, which are made out of leather.  
Mrs. Juliana travels twice a month to purchase her merchandise in Brazil, where the prices of her articles are much lower.  Even though her sales have decreased slightly in the past couple months because of the crisis, she is still earning a steady income, and likes to work. 

The credit she is given will be for the purchase of religious items, and she thanks the Fundación Paraguaya for trusting her with a loan.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise such as religious articles, and traditional Paraguayan items.

loans.name: Gianina Victoria

texts.es:
Gianina es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida
Gianina es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, de profesión Abogada, Gianina junto a su esposo tienen una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende repuestos de motos, además tienen un taller de reparaciones de motos, para lo cual cuenta con 4 personas. Además Gianina hace poco tiempo aperturó una oficina de asesoría jurídica y contable en asociación con otros profesionales.
Gianina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de muebles para el consultorio.
Los sueños de Gianina son comprar una casa e impulsar su consultorio.
texts.en:
Gianina is a member of the Nueva Vida Communal Bank.
Gianina lives with her partner, is 28 years old and has one son. She is a lawyer by profession. Gianina and her husband own a store in a rented space where they sell spare motorcycle parts. They also have a motorcycle repair garage with 4 employees. Gianina also recently set up a legal and financial consultancy in association with other professionals.
Gianina needs a 600 PEN loan to purchase furniture for her consultancy.
Gianina dreams of buying a house and of kick-starting her consultancy.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture for her consultancy

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Antonia es conviviente, tiene 58 años y 7 hijos, Antonia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carne, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Antonia tiene un pequeño taller de confección de prendas de vestir.
Antonia necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Antonia son descansar e irse a pasear a Brasil.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the community bank "Lirio" (Lily).

She lives with a partner, is 58 years old, and has 7 children. Antonia has a shop in her house where she sells general groceries, vegetables, and meat, which she does every day. Also, Antonia has a small workshop where she makes clothing to sell.

Antonia needs a loan of 1600 soles that will be invested in buying rice and sugar. Antonia's dreams are to rest and to take a trip to Brazil.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn T., 49, is a native of Iloilo but migrated to Manila years ago. She now lives in a village in Pasay City with her husband, Paterno, 48, a security guard.

For ten years now, Merlyn has been selling different fruits in season. In her free time, she engages herself in the direct selling of cosmetics and clothing. She makes PHP 16,000 net income a month from her businesses.

Merlyn joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006. She needs a loan of PHP 19,000 as additional capital for her business. She wishes to expand her business so she can help employ her neighbors.
 

About CCT
The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy more fruits in season

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary Luz es socia del Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 22 años de edad, estado civil soltera no tiene hijos, estudio educación superior completa, pero no ejerce su profesión, vive en la Parcialidad de Alinsuyo Ilave.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, hace 8 meses,  su préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió en la compra de animales menores. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de jabones, champús, jaboncillos, betunes, pilas, etc., para aumentar la mercadería en su negocio ella tiene un puesto en el mercado.

Su deseo es tener un puesto de cabinas de Internet y locutorio  en Ilave.
A ella le gustan las reuniones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Mary Luz is a member of the "June 24th" Communal Bank, located in Ilave District, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 22 years old and single with no children. She completed her higher education, but she hasn't put her studies into practice. She lives in the Alinsuyo Ilave area. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 8 months. Her first loan was for 500 soles, and she used the money to buy small animals. She is currently requesting a loan of 500 soles to buy soap, shampoo, shoe polish, batteries, etc., to increase the supply of merchandise she sells at her market stand. Her dream is to open a call center/Internet café in Ilave. Her favorite part of her communal bank are the group meetings and her savings account.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Buy soap, shampoo, shoe polish, batteries

loans.name: Rosa De Los Angeles

texts.es: Rosa de los Ángeles P. M. tiene la edad de 50 años. Es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad. Por lo que dio inicio con la venta de ropa como ropa para niños, para damas, para caballero y trajes formales, ella se levantaba todos los días por lo que tenía que trabajar muy temprano para viajar a Managua en busca de ropa, ya que es aquí donde la consigue de manera favorable y logro obtener muy bueno lugares en donde encuentra muy favorable los productos. Así con el tiempo fue adquiriendo más productos para distribuirlos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cosméticos, calzado y ropa en general. El deseo de Rosa es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa de los Angeles M. P. is a 50 years old, very responsible and hardworking woman. She is devoted to the sale of general merchandise and has been in this humble activity for more than 4 years.

She started selling cloths for kids, women, men and formal attire. She used to get up early every morning to travel to Managua to look for clothes, as there she gets a better price there.

She is asking for a loan that will be used as working capital for the purchase of cosmetics, footwear and clothing in general. Rosa's desire is to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Caital

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap C. was born in 1967 and she now lives in Speu village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. C. Theng, are vegetable sellers. Since this business is going well, they want to sell door to door so Mrs. Sopheap C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cart to travel the vegetable to re-sell and she would use the rest of the loan to buy more vegetables for her current business. Mrs. Sopheap C. has three children one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study because they are at the age of seven or two years old. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cart to travel the vegetable to re-sell and she would use the rest of the loan to buy more vegetables for her current business.

loans.name: Razya Shabebe Group

texts.en:
The Razya Shabebe Group has four members. Razya is the group leader and works as a quilt sewer. She wants to purchase materials for her business.

Shabibi has a bakery and wants a loan to buy more wood for her bakery business.

Shar Aqa wants to take out a loan for his butchers shop and will use the loan to buy the necessary things for his business.

M. Temor is requesting a loan for his business of selling wood. He wants to expand the business and use his loan to purchase more materials.

All members of the group would like to receive a loan to grow their businesses. Finally, each member of the group thanks Kiva.

loans.use: To buy materials for their businesses

loans.name: Antonia Isabel

texts.es: La señora Antonia S. Tiene 19 años de edad, es Casada y con oficios  Tejedora,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un Taller, habita junto  a su Esposo, ella y su Esposo se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 4 años  de elaborar   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chibatz, del Cantón Poxlajuj del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Antonia S., 19, is married and is a weaver. Together with her husband, who is a weaver also, they have a workshop “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para mujeres." She has worked as a weaver for the past 4 years. She lives in Paraje Chibatz, in the Poxlajuj territory, in the Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Currently, demand from her customers has increased but her financial situation is insufficient for her to be able to increase her working capital. For this reason she turned to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan with the intention of using it to buy more merchandise to be able to increase sales hoping, too, to provide better living conditions for her family and to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital (raw materials purchase)

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan P. G., tiene la edad de 45 años, es casado, y tiene 4 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 17,20,24 y 25 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para asistir 2 hectáreas de café veranero que posee.El darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo va a permitir un buen desarrollo y así tener una mayor producción y por ende mayores ingresos económicos.Don Juan también se dedica a la agricultura de granos básicos y tubérculos.
Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a sus hijos y esposa una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Juan P. G. is 45, married, and has four children who are his greatest priority. They are 17, 20, 24, and 25. The loan that he wants is for two hectares of summer coffee that he has. It is to give the crop adequate maintenance, which will allow for good development and greater production. This will bring greater income. Juan also grows basic grains and tubers. This is his first loan with Fudecosur. He is very happy with the simplicity of the loan. In the future he hopes to give his children and his wife a better quality of life and greater economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help with 2 hectares of summer coffee

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva T. is a 69-year-old widow who lives in the village of Pader Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling dried fish.

Melva has five grown children. Four of them work in Manila as security guards, sending money to Melva each month to help support their mother and their youngest sibling and to help sustain the dried fish business, which is at the Binalbagan market. 

Melva joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1996 in the hope that she would be able to improve the quality of life of her family. With the help of her loans  from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase her family's income by selling dried fish. Now she earns an average monthly income of  PHP 5,000 from her business activities.

Melva is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 was used to fund operations of her dried fish vending, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing PHP 18,000 for her eighteenth cycle loan, which she intends to use for her business of selling dried fish. Melva is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family: to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of  thousands of women through Project "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon  word that means "'Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon"--a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for dried fish vending

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene varios financiamientos con Fundación León 2000, ya que no es la primera experiencia que tiene. Ella se dedica a una pulpería, por lo que esta actividad es el único medio de ingreso que ella tiene para seguirle proporcionando a su familia lo necesario para sobrevivir. Por lo que tiene más de 21 años de dedicarse a este negocio que es su prioridad. Ella inicio este negocio con la ayuda de su familia ya desde hace mucho tiempo atrás se dedicaban a este tipo de actividad económica. Ella sueña con mejorar cada día su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de refrescos, gaseosas, repostería, jugos, pan, galleta y golosinas.
texts.en:
Mercedes has received various types of financing through Fundación León 2000, so this is not her first experience with a loan. She manages a grocery store, which is her only source of income that provides what her family needs to survive. Mercedes has been in this business for 21 years and it has always been a priority for her. With the help her family, she was able to start this business because they were in a similar trade. She dreams of improving her business every day and generating more income. The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to purchase soft drinks, pastries, juices, bread, cookies, and candy.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam V. is 31 years old and she is the village bank president of this group which consists of twenty-two people located in Krang Pou village in Takeo province. The members will each use their loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Sam V. is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) field on which she cultivates rice. She now faces a problem because her field has infertile soil. Thus, she needs a loan 400,000 KHR from AMK to buy fertilizer.

Mrs. Sam V. is the mother of three children, two of whom are workers in a private company while the other is a student in the local school. Her husband, Mr. Phal Ngarn, is a farmer and is also a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to support the family members.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Confianza Group

texts.es:
Banco comunal CONFIANZA está formado por 10 personas, pertenecen a la Zona D. KUPINI, que están ubicados en kupini Central las socias se dedican a la venta D. perfumes, trabajos en tejidos a mano, venta D. comida, venta D. papa, venta D. perfumes, venta D. material escolar, etc. Este grupo D. socias ingresa a su 11 avo. Ciclo con la reestructuración del 40% quedando un 60 % D. socias fundadoras. 

La Sra. Maria  Es su tercer ciclo en este ciclo asume el cargo D. presidenta del grupo es la líder y representante D. la banca, es una socia estricta a la hora D. pago D. cuotas con sus compañeras, este es su 4to ciclo se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos. 
Es una mujer casada tiene 2 hijos su esposo trabaja como empleado en la superintendencia D. pensiones. 
 
Los créditos obtenidos durante su permanencia fueron para invertir en la compra D. materia prima para la confección D. polleras, siendo una actividad que le solventa a su familia y le apoya a su esposo para poder seguir mejorando su calidad D. vida económica.

Durante su permanencia con sus compañeras D. grupo demostró ser una persona solidaria con sus compañeras siempre ayudándolas, a seguir adelante con trabajo, muy exigente con sus cuotas,  muy estricta con sus compañeras a la hora D. pago.

La Sra. Silveria Es una D. las fundadoras del banco asume el cargo D. tesorera, Es una socia alegre dinámica siempre manteniendo la alegría en su banca haciendo gozar a sus compañeras, responsable con sus cuotas, exigente con sus compañeras.

La socia se dedica a la venta D. dulces refrescos y variedad D. dulces, en su puesto D. venta que se ubica al frente D. un colegio, también aprovecha su tiempo realizando tejidos a mano, tiene 1 hija.
El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería para su puesto D. venta, siendo que ya se capitalizo con el anterior, sus deseo es poder comprarse una movilidad para trasladar su mercadería.

La Sra. Juana  En este ciclo asume el cargo D. tesorera del banco, Es una socia que se dedica a la venta D. vajilla D. porcelana como también, tiene una tienda D. barrio, durante su permanencia demostró responsabilidad siendo que su mamita se encuentra delicada D. salud es por eso que se esfuerza para seguir adelante.

Es una socia soltera, ya trabajo tres ciclos con nuestra institución, durante su permanencia aprendió a ser responsable, y comunicativa con sus compañeras, con el grupo gracias a su mama que  trabajo anteriormente con nuestra institución.
Su deseo es poder aumentar su capital D. trabajo y poder comprase una casa


Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Confianza Community Bank is maD. up of 10 members from the Kupini Zone which is located in Kupini Central. The members earn a living by selling perfumes, creating handmaD. weavings, selling food, selling potatoes, selling school supplies etc. This group of members is entering their 11th lending cycle with a 40% restructuring resulting in 60% of founding members remaining. Mrs. Maria: This is her third loan in this cycle and she has assumed responsibility as president of the group. She is the leader and the representative of the bank. She is a member who is very strict on timely repayment of her groups’ loans. This is her fourth cycle dedicated to cosmetic sales. She is a married woman with 2 children. Her husband works as a superintendant of pensions. The loans obtained previously were used to buy basic materials to make skirts. This activity helps pay her family’s debts and helps her husband continue to better their economic quality of life. Throughout her term with her group, she has demonstrated she is a team-player and always helps out in order to advance in the group’s work. She is very demanding with their repayments and very strict with her companions at the time of repayment. Mrs. Silveria: She is one of the bank’s founders and treasurer. She is a cheerful, dynamic member who maintains the joy in the group and takes delight in her companions. She is responsible for their repayments and strict with her companions. This member sells sweet drinks and a variety of desserts from her stall which is located in front of a school. She also spends time creating handmaD. weavings. She has one daughter. Her previous loan was used to buy groceries for her stall. Now that she has capitalized on that, her dream is to be able to purchase something to transport her groceries. Mrs. Juana: In this cycle she has assumed responsibility as treasurer of the bank. She is a member who earns a living selling chinaware. In addition, she has a neighborhood store. During her term, she has demonstrated responsibility. Her mother is in delicate health and for this reason she strives to progress. She is a single member and has now worked three cycles with our institution. During her term she has learned to be responsible and communicate with her companions. She is with the group thanks to her mother who used to work with our institution. Her dream is to be able to augment her working capital and to be able to buy a house. All the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in them by extending credit.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To augment working capital

loans.name: Bernie

texts.en:
Bernie P. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin. He is 36 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Bernie owns and operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Bernie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Kak

texts.en:
Mrs. Kak S. is 41-year-old farmer. She also goes to where there is a lot of fruit sold in bulk in order to buy fruit and she then brings it to sell retail at the market for extra income. She has a life partner in her husband who is a bicycle repairman. This couple have been married for many years and they have five teenage children. Two of the children are helping the parents' business and two attend school. 

Kak S. will use her first loan to buy more bicycle accessories to supply her husband’s business. Any remaining money from the loan will be used to buy a pig to raise.

loans.use: To buy more bicycle accessories

loans.name: Susan Makena

texts.en:
Susan is 30 years old and a married mother of two children. She stays at Kangemi together with her family. Her husband, Isaac, is working as a manager. 

Susan operates an MPESA (mobile money transfer) business in the Kangemi market. This is her primary business, which she has been doing for the last two months. Her clients are mainly people from Kangemi and its environs. Kangemi area is pretty busy in terms of business and has a high population, most of whom are low-income earners.

She was introduced to KADET by an existing member and this is her second loan with KADET. She has not borrowed from other financial institutions apart from KADET. She will use the loan advance to buy more phone accessories.

She hopes and desires to operate a more stable business so as to increase the family income.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accesories.

loans.name: Olabisi

texts.en:
Olabisi has a shop where she sells drinks and dry gin to costumers. She buys in bulk and sells in retail. She likes the business because it gives her the opportunity to interact with her costumers. She buys goods directly from the company sales representative who goes around town supplying big buyers at a discount at their business places.

Olabisi wants to expand her business by buying more drinks and dry gin, so she is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more drinks and dry gin to sell.

Olabisi is 54 years old, married and has six children who are between 23 and 39 years old. At her age, she works hard to assist her husband, who is a driver, to pay their bills, and they intend to renovate their building. She thanks Kiva for their huge support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and dry gin to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba E. is a happily married woman. Aba prepares 'banku' (a staple maize dish) for sale at Abura. She has been educated up to the junior high level. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Aba uses the earnings she generates from her sales to support her husband in the payment of her children’s tuition and utility bills. Aba will use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare 'banku' and also to sell some grains. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: purchase more maize to prepare 'banku' and also sell some grains

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni R. is currently in the business of selling used clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell. Poni is 28 years old and is married, with a husband who is a director. She has 2 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es: Adelina C. B. de 66 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para una empresa privada y junto a un hijo, juntos residen en el departamento de Usulután. Adelina, una señora muy esforzada y trabajadora, posee un tienda de productos perecedero y de productos de primera necesidad, la cual es un gran apoyo tanto para ella como para su esposo ya que es gracias a esta que ellos pueden contar con una estabilidad aceptable en su hogar. Así mismo Adelina elabora platillos típicos como: empanadas, atoles, yuca frita y otros más los cuales vende de forma ambulante por diferentes colonias y ciudades de Usulután. Adelina trabaja muy duro para brindarle una ayuda económica a su esposo, de forma que puedan brindarle todo lo necesario a su hijo, por lo que sus negocios son de mucha importancia, ya que son claves para la estabilidad de su familia. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para la tienda, aumentado aquellos productos los cuales poseen más demanda, así mismo comprar maíz, yuca y otros elementos más para la elaboración de los platillos típicos.
texts.en:
Adelina C. B. is 66 years old. She lives with her husband, who works for a private company, and her son in the Department of Usulután. Adelina is a determined hardworking woman who has a store where she sells perishable products and basic necessities. This business has been a great help to her and her husband because it has allowed them to have an acceptable level of stability in their home.

Adelina also prepare traditional dishes such as empandas, “atole” (a corn porridge), fried cassava, and other items and sells them as a street vendor in different neighborhoods and cities within Usulután. She works very hard to provide her husband with financial assistance so that they can provide their son with everything he needs. This is why her businesses are very important since they are key to her family’s stability.

She is requesting a loan to buy large quantities of merchandise for her store so that she can increase her inventory of those items that are in great demand. Adelina will also buy corn, cassava, and other ingredients for preparing traditional dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store & ingredients for preparing traditional dishes

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora, de 40 años, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo Víctor (50) y a sus 4 hijos, de los 5 que tiene, pues el mayor vive independiente.Se dedica al cultivo de plátano, achiote, café, yuca y maíz en sus terrenos propios, además  produce  algodón, pues observa que en la zona donde vive se desarrolla bien este producto. Le gusta mantener limpias sus plantaciones porque asegura, que así les proporciona espacio suficiente para que disfruten de los  nutrientes que tiene la tierra, sin embargo, le resulta pesado caminar varias horas para llegar a sus chacras porque se encuentran alejadas de su vivienda. Lleva 30 años dedicada a la agricultura y ha logrado vivir tranquila sin pasar necesidades porque su oficio es muy rentable, ya que con las ganancias ha comprado las hectáreas de terreno que tiene. Para mas adelante  tiene planeado plantar  mayor cantidad de productos, como el plátano que cosecha cada quince días, y le genera rápidas ganancias.Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y ante los integrantes de su banco comunal,  promete ser cumplida en cada uno de sus pagos.Flora tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas agrícolas  (machetes, picos y palas) que necesita, además  destinara otra parte para la paga  a los operarios pues necesita  que limpien sus chacras.
texts.en:
Flora, 40, lives in her own home with her husband, Víctor, 50, and four of their five children; the oldest lives independently. She farms banana, achiote (lipstick tree), coffee, manioc and corn on her own farmlands. She also farms cotton because she has noticed that this crop grows well in the area where she lives. She likes to keep her plots weed-free because she is convinced that by keeping her plants clear and well-spaced they can better take advantage of the nutrients in the soil. However, it is a chore to walk for several hours to get to her fields because they are located far from her home. She has been farming for 30 years and has managed to live a peaceful life lacking none of the basics because farming is profitable. She has used profits from it to buy the lands she owns. For later on she plans to plant larger amounts of product, like banana that’s harvested every two weeks and produces profits. This is her first loan from MFP and she pledges to her fellow communal bank members to repay in a timely fashion. Flora will use the requested funds to buy farm tools (machetes, shovels and pickaxes) that she needs and will use part of the funds to pay field hands she needs to clear her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and pay field hands.

loans.name: Malik

texts.fr: B. malik a appris la mécanique, en 2007, il a ouvert son atelier qu’il a appelé « Garage MECASSISTANCE », les outils de tournage et  d’ajustement de pièces d étachées qu’il utilise sont en panne c’est pour cela qu’il sollicite du crédit pour acheter une perceuse à colonne.etant célibataire, le revenu de ce commerce lui permet de pouvoir se prendre en charge
texts.en:
Malik B. learned mechanics, and in 2007, he opened his own workshop which he called «Garage MECASSISTANCE ». The tools that he uses for turning and adjusting the spare parts have broken down, which is why he is asking for a loan to buy a column drill. Being single, the revenue from his business will allow him to care for himself.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a column drill.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita F., 50, resides in Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Alexander F., a machine operator, and is the mother of a teen currently enrolled in high school. Lolita is working hard to send her child all the way through college. She was once a college undergraduate and she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Lolita operates a siomai buying-and-selling business.  Siomai is a small Chinese dumpling filled with either pork, beef or shark's fin.  Lolita buys siomai from wholesalers and sell them piecemeal, making a little profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Lolita is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional siomai and other products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Lolita dreams of being able to give her child a good, high-quality education through her hard work. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year.

loans.use: To expand her product inventory

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie J. is from the village of Kinabkaban, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old. Benjie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Benjie owns & operates a business  selling personal home products from different suppliers and serves as a direct seller to local community members. Benjie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Benjie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Benjie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Benjie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Benjie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn C. is from the town of Talibon. She is 31 years old, single and has a 5-year-old child. Evelyn owns and runs a fishing business, operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish at the market.

Evelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to repair her fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Grecia Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora Grecia Cecilia B. vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza natural, su centro histórico, la variedad de su gastronomía y también por ser la cuna de grandes deportistas.
 
Nuestra socia es muy joven tiene 23 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene 1 hija de 8 años, su esposo trabaja en un bar que es de su propiedad, con el trabajo en conjunto han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Cecilia se dedica a la venta de productos YANBAL, tiene 8 meses trabajando en este negocio, también se dedica a la venta de ropa y joyas de fantasía, no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo y labora de lunes a sábados, sus productos los vende recorriendo la ciudad ya que no tiene un local propio.
 
Es su segundo crédito en la fundación y  fue su cuñada quien la incentivó para formar parte de este grupo de mujeres emprendedoras. Con el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos, ropa  y joyas.
 
Su sueño es estudiar belleza.
texts.en:
Grecia Cecilia B. lives in the center of the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its natural beauty, its historic center, the variety of its cuisine and also because it is the birthplace of some famous athletes. Cecilia is very young. She is 23 years old, lives in a common law marriage and has a daughter who is 8 years old. Her husband works in a bar on his property. With this work together they have managed to build their own home. Cecilia sells Yanbal brand cosmetics. She has had this business for 8 months, and she also sells clothing and costume jewelry. She does not have fixed work hours, and she works from Mondays through Saturdays. She takes her products around the city, since she does not have her own store. This is her second loan with the FUNDACION ESPOIR; her mother-in-law encouraged her to become part of this group of enterprising women. With the new loan from FUNDACION ESPOIR she will invest in the purchase of cosmetics, clothing and jewelry. Her dream is to study beauty.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing, jewelry and cosmetics

loans.name: Consolata Wathenya

texts.en:
Consolata has been in livestock farming for three years now. She also operates a retail shop on the side. She is 26 years old and married to Robert Mugwe. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD. by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the cash to buy two calves and also add stock of rice in her retail shop.

Consolata also hope to build rental houses on her piece of land in the future.

loans.use: To buy  two calves and add stock of rice in her retail shop

loans.name: Fadail

texts.ru:
Fadail G. 22 qoda. On ne jenat. Fadail yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste s semyoy. 

Fadail uje 2 qoda kak otkril kafe . Etomu biznessu yeqo nauchil dyadya i on pomoq yemu otkrit eto kafe. Seychas Fadail nujdayetsya  v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit stoli i stulya dlya svoyeqo kafe.
texts.en:
Fadail G. is 22 years old.  He is single.  Fadail is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from the city of Fuzuli who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family.

Fadail opened a café two years ago.  He started the business with his uncle who helped him open the café.  Now, Fadail needs 2000 AZN to buy tables and chairs for the café.

loans.use: kupit stoli,stulya dlya svoyeqo kafe

loans.name: Teobaldo

texts.es: Teobaldo, de 42 años, es un hombre luchador; convive con Baseliza de 40 años, con la que tiene 5 hijos menores, a quienes alimenta y educa en su casa propia ubicada en la Selva Peruana (comunidad nativa centro Pumpuriani). Pero como buen agricultor, él se traslada constantemente de la comunidad Sankivironi hacia Pumpuriani; donde tienen sembríos de café; “producto bandera de Teobaldo”; ya que sus 17 años de experiencia respaldan su éxito; él tiene 8 hectáreas de terrenos de café y sus sembríos son muy buenos; tanto así que los principales cafetaleros del lugar reconocen su calidad; por ello la fábrica de café natural de la localidad, “Montaña”, lo contrató como su principal distribuidor. Teobaldo siempre tiene la cantidad necesaria, para sus compradores; sin embargo, tiene problemas al trasladarse a las diferentes comunidades donde tiene que cuidar de sus cultivos; por ello está pensando adquirir una casa en la comunidad de Sankivironi, con ello podrá tener mayores facilidades para cuidar sus plantaciones. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, y está agradecido con su banco comunal ya que se apoyan y agrupan para poder subsidiar algunas carencias en la agricultura. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más semillas de café, de la misma manera rozará 2 hectáreas de terrenos de cultivo (quemado de las plantaciones para sembrar una nueva), donde sembrará plátano y maíz.
texts.en:
Teobaldo is 42 years old and lives with Baseliza, who is 40 years old.  They have five young children who they feed and educated in their own home, located in the Peruvian jungle in the native community center Pumpuriani.  

Like a good farmer, he constantly travels to the Sankivironi community from Pumpuriani, where he has coffee fields.  His coffee is called "Theobaldo's flagship product", and his 17 years of experience supports its success.  He has eight hectares of coffee fields and his crops are very good.  The main coffee growers recognize his quality, and because of this, he is contracted as the principle distributor to the the natural coffee factory in his area, "Montaña" [Mountain]. 

Teobaldo always has the necessary quantities for his buyers, however, he has problems moving to the different communities where he has to care for his crops.  He is thinking about buying a house in the community of Sankivironi, where he will have more resources to care for his fields.  

This is is fifth loan with MFP, and he is grateful to his community bank because they support him and have groups to subsidize some shortages in agriculture.  With this loan, he will buy more coffee seeds and clear 2 hectares of arable land (by burning the fields to plant new crops) where he will plant bananas and corn.

loans.use: Purchase coffee seeds

loans.name: Flor De Tulipanes Group

texts.es:
La  A.C. FLOR DE TULIPAN  inicia su ciclo Nº 1 en el Centro Focal de Cascada, de esta asociación podríamos decir que tiene muchas expectativas con respecto al crédito.  Esta asociación está compuesta por nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón. La mesa directiva tiene a la cabeza a la señora Ana como presidenta.

La señora  Ana es una mujer de 40  años de edad, casada, madre de cuatro niños. Este es su primer ciclo en esta asociación, comenta que hace seis años también participó en otro grupo en el Centro Focal de Cascada, sin embargo ahora se constituye en un reto asumir el cargo de presidenta.
  
Desde hace cuatro años trabaja en el tejido de mantas en telar, con lana de vicuña, le enseño su cuñada.  El crédito solicitado de Bs. 1000.- le serviría para la compra de vellón de lana de vicuña, el mismo que será hilado y se transformará en una manta.  El trabajo va más allá, ella tiene el apoyo de una señora que hace el macramé de las mantas.
 Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación, ellos tienen negocios como: tejido de mantas y chompas, tienda surtida, criadero de chanchos y pollos, venta de mandiles, venta de comida, tejido de camas, tejido de mantas de vicuñas, tejido de macramé en bolsas.
texts.en:
The “Flor de Tulipan” (Tulip Flower) Communal Bank is starting its first cycle in the Cascada Community Center.  We could say that the group has a lot of expectations regarding the loan.  This group is comprised of nine members, eight women and one man.  The head of the board of directors is Ana, the president.

Ana, age 40, is married and has four children.  This is her first cycle with this group.  She says that six years ago she participated as a member of another group in the Cascada Community Center.  Now her challenge is taking on the responsibility of being the president.

She has worked on a loom weaving blankets of vicuña wool for four years.  Her sister-in-law taught her.  The 1,000 Bs. loan that she requested is to buy vicuña wool fleece.  It will be spun and transformed into a blanket.  The work goes further.  She has help from a woman who makes macramé for the blankets.

Regarding the ongoing businesses of the rest of the group’s members, they have businesses like:  weaving blankets and sweaters, a stocked store, raising pigs and chickens, selling aprons, selling food, weaving bedding, weaving vicuña blankets, and weaving macramé bags.

loans.use: Buy wool for a loom

loans.name: Lorena De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Lorena es una mujer que ha venido trabajando como pequeña comerciante, y que por su tenacidad en venta ha logrado el aumento de su inventario, y la captación de clientes. 
Iniciando con la venta de frijoles cocidos, ropa usada, y luego comienza  a vender productos de cosméticos, en donde lo hace atreves del financiamiento de Afodenic, el que ha sido que ha impulsado para lograr sus ingresos.
Teniendo el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja como carpintero. Lo que quiere comprar es varios productos de la Avon,  ya que trabaja con catálogos y tiene muchos encargos, también comprara una variedad de perfumes de dama y caballeros, lo que tiene poco en existencia. lo que con este muevo financiamiento podrá hacer su pedido.
texts.en:
Lorena is a woman who has been working as a small merchant.  Thanks to her tenacity she has been enlarging her inventory and has been getting more customers.

She started out selling cooked beans, used clothes but later started selling cosmetics which was made possible through Afodenic loans; this is what has made her income possible.  She has her husband’s, who is a carpenter, support.

What she wants to do is buy Avon products because she works in catalogue sales and she has many pending orders.  She also wants to buy a variety of perfumes for both men and women because she has only a few in stock.  This new loan will make it possible for her to place her order.

loans.use: To buy Avon products.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
This is Rosita C., 64, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Angel C.. At this time, Rosita is working hard to provide income for her family’s needs like everyday expenses.

Rosita operates a retailing business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, then sell them piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Rosita is has  also been intoa  tailoring and curtain making business for ten years now.  She accepts orders from her regular customers who are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php12, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Rosita dreams to have her own commercial space for her tailoring shop as well as for her buying and selling business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more quantities and varieties of items to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita C. is from the city of Gango Ozamiz City. She is 48 years old. Virgincita is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Virgincita owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating service-based services through motor transport. Virgincita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Virgincita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgincita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Virgincita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es: La. Sra. Armandina es una persona muy honesta y responsable, ella es madre soltera, ella quiere el prestamo por que necesita comprar mercancia ya que es el unico medio que tiene para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella tiene una estetica corta cabello ahí en su casa, ella es una persona seria el cual lucha por sacar adelante a sus pequeñines ya que son todo para ella, ella quiere el prestamo ya que quiere ver su estetica completa.
texts.en: Sra. Armandina is a very honest and responsible person. She is a single mother. She wants the loan because she needs to buy merchandise for her business, since it is the only means that she has to raise her children. She has a beauty salon and cuts hair in her home. She is a reliable person who struggles to raise her little ones, since they are everything to her. She wants the loan because she wants to see her salon completely stocked.

loans.use: Buy stock for her business

loans.name: Donato

texts.en:
Donato C. is from the village of Quiling, Roxas, Isabela. He is 36 years old. Donato is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Donato plants and harvests rice for sale. Donato has been engaged in his business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Donato joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Donato is requesting a loan of 24,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken by Donato from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a thirty three year old married woman with five children.  She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.  She has been selling clothes for the last twelve years.  Her hardship is the lack of capital and her vision is to own a boutique and become a wealthy family with educated children.  Jackline needs the loan to buy clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao K., married to Mr. Chang Chuon, lives in Tonle village, Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family; they also cut palm tree leaves used in roof making to earn some extra money. Mrs. Mao K. is applying for a loan to buy a new motorbike for her family's transportation needs. She is the mother of a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: retail business expansion

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora V. is from the village of Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 55 years old. Aurora is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Aurora owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general services to local community members. Aurora has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2011, Aurora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business . Aurora is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Aurora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Louis

texts.fr:
louis est un commerçant de HOPE Congo de 48 ans, célibataire et père de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 6 à 22 ans.
il débute son commerce en 2002 dans vente de la quincaillerie. En moyenne il vend environ 5000 a 50.000frs par jours. 

Avec le second prêt, il compte renforcer son stock  en achetant des interrupteurs, des fusibles, des sanitaires, des robinets, des ampoules. 

A l’ avenir il pense ouvrir un grand magasin, voyager aller acheter de la marchandise en Afrique de l'ouest.
texts.en:
Louis is a 48-year old businessman belonging to Hope, Congo. He is single and father to three children, whose ages range from six to 22 years old. He began his business selling hardware in 2002. He has an average daily turnover of around 5,000 to 50,000 francs. 

With this second loan, he is planning to replenish his stock by buying light switches, fuses, toilets, taps and light bulbs.

He is thinking of opening a large shop in the future and of travelling in West Africa to buy his goods.

loans.use: to purchase fuses, taps and light-bulbs

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha, a 45-year-old married mother of seven children, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines for 30 years and also earns an income from fishing. Having received and repaid nine previous loans from NWTF, Editha is now requesting a PHP 29500 loan to buy additional items to sell in her store such as shampoo, groceries, etc. Editha aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 51 years old and married with five children. Her oldest child is 31 years old and the youngest is 13 years old.

Erlinda is engaged in farming and has been growing rice for 15 years. She is happy to have the farm because it helps her family a lot. Erlinda is in need of fertilizers and rice seeds. The loan she requested will be used to purchase her farming needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is 21 years old, and she has a one-year-old child. She is a tailor and she has done this business for five years. She works together with her husband. They do farming as well, and from this business they built a house in which they live. Diana is requesting a loan to buy more fabrics and make different styles of dresses for sale. With the profits, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy fabrics.

loans.name: Zohir

texts.ru: Зохир проживает в районе Муминобод города Куляб. Возраст, 59 лет. Женат. Имеет 10 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Две сыновей находятся в Российской Федерации. Сам он имеет высшее образование, инженер технолог. По профессии проработал 20 лет. На сегодняшний день он занимается торговлей. Он у себя дома открыл продуктовый магазин. В этой области он уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта магазина и увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Zohir lives in Muminobod district of the city of Kouliab. Age, 59 years. Married. 10 children. His wife is a homemaker. Two of his sons are in the Russian Federation. Zohir has a college degree; he is a technology engineer. He has worked in his field for 20 years. At present he is in retail. He opened a grocery store in his home. He has been in this business for 10 years. He is taking out a loan to renovate his store and increase his stock.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store and increase his stock

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is married and has three children.  She sells watermelon and is also a hairdresser. Her husband is a driver. As a way of supporting her husband, she provides the basic needs of her family. Hannah is requesting a loan to purchase watermelon, oranges, and other types of fruits. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to revive her hairdressing business.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon, oranges, and other types of fruits.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
mOscar, es un joven que vive en la comunidad de Ostional. Es un joven muy respetuoso y le gusta mucho trabajar.
El está a punto de iniciar la universidad y desea comprar una computadora y varios libros que son muy necesarios para los cursos que tiene que llevar, es por eso que el necesita un préstamo de ₡598 000 (quinientos noventa y ocho mil colones) para la compra de la computadora, libro y otros materiales didácticos que necesita para sus cursos.
Oscar  está muy contento porque va a estudiar y podrá tener mejores oportunidades para superarse.
El socio de la empresa de Crédito Comunal de Ostional, una de las 110 empresas de crédito socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Oscar is a young man who lives in the community of Ostional. He is a very respectful young man and he very much enjoys to work.
