He is ready to start going to university and he wants to purchase a computer and various books that are very important for the courses that he wants to take. He needs a loan of 598 000 (five hundred and ninety-eight thousand colones) to purchase a computer, books, and other school supplies that he needs for his courses.

Oscar is very happy because he will be studying and he will be able to have better opportunities to improve himself. He is a member of the communal bank "Ostional", one of the 110 credit organizations which are members of EDESA (Kiva Field Partner) in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and other school supplies.

loans.name: Benkadi  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Benkadi III sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Momina, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SALI ADAMA, qui est le deuxième assise à gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour (sarclage) pour entretenir environs 0,7 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi III group are married women, who average 39 years of age and 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Momina, one of the villages in the Commune of Massigui, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of Mali).

In order to better organize their business as the rainy season begins, they work with Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. Their crops include, among others, rice and peanut. They are seeking their fifth loan from Soro Yiriwaso.

With this new loan, Sali Adama (second one from the left, sitting) intends to buy fertilizers, small tools, and pay the costs of weeding to maintain about 0.7 of rice and peanut fields.

After the harvest, the production is sold in Massigui to a clientele comprising both men and women. The members of the group intend to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 800) during the season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicide, small tools, and to pay for weeding

loans.name: Norma Gladys

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Palabra De Mujer. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Norma, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos viven con ella. El marido es agricultor.
 
Es una gran ama de casa que también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella también vende a base de encargos que sus clientes le piden con anticipación. Trabaja de lunes a viernes en las mañanas ya que a esta hora hace menos calor nos cuenta, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil una vez  al mes. Lleva dos años que dedicada a esta actividad y nos cuenta que fue con el primer crédito que  empezó su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar  pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños y ropa interior.  Lleva dos años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer crédito ella pudo empezar con su negocio. 

Sus sueños son seguir en su negocio y que este crezca cada dia mas.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Palabra de Mujer' loan group meet in the town of Charapoto which is known for its traditional culture and also for the fact that it is located just a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet 50 year-old Norma who lives with her common-law husband.  She has six grown-up children, two of whom live with her.  Her husband is a farmer.
 
Norma is a great housewife who also sells all kinds of clothes.  She makes her sales door to door.  She also sells based on orders that her customers place with her.  Norma works mornings, from Monday to Friday.  She tells us that this is because it is not so hot at that time of day.  She leaves her goods with her customers on credit and collects payment every week.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil once a month.  She has been in this business for two years and she tells us that she started the business with her first loan.

Norma will use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothes and underwear.  She has been a member of her loan group for two years and she likes it because she was able to use her first loan to start her business.

Norma's dreams are to continue in her business and for her business to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, children's clothes and underwear

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a hard-working 52-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with four children. Since the year 2004 he has been offering tailoring services so as to meet the needs of his family. He makes extra money by supplying stationery. He wants in the next five years to have grown and expanded his business so that he can peacefully retire to farming.

He is requesting 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy materials for tailoring and liquid soap. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for training him on how to budget.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and liquid soap.

loans.name: Jack

texts.en:
Jack is 53 years old, married, and has five children aged 12 to 23. He has been running a transportation business for two years and employs one person. He provides transportation for all types of customers along Kambi-Kambiri road. Jack intends to use this loan to purchase more spare parts for his vehicle. 

Jack intends to use the profits from his business to buy another vehicle so that he can expand his business. He also dreams of being able to buy his own plot of land one day so that he can build a house. Jack describes himself as visionary.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Josefa Johanna

texts.es:
Josefa Johanna tiene 28 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de doce, diez y un año de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Josefa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol compra de semillas, insumos, urea y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima.

 Su sueño es poder comprarse una finca para poder aumentar el negocio y tener mayores utilidades. Le gusta practicar el en especial el índor.
texts.en:
Josefa Johanna is 28 years old and lives with her common-law husband and three children (ages 12, 10, and 1) in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.

The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Josefa is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Agro Karlita Commercial Center and sells her products at the Castillo Commercial Market.

Josefa is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. She plans to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. Her dream is to buy a farm so that she can increase her business and have more profits.

Josefa enjoys practicing sports, especially indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has been selling green groceries for the last seven months in Mountain View in the town of Kangemi. He is 33 years old and married to Hyline. They have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be his first loan. He intends to use the loan to buy vegetables, onions and carrots for sale.

In the future, Paul hopes to expand his business and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, onions and carrots.

loans.name: Melnyk Hshley

texts.es:
La señora Melnyk vive en la aldea El Cerro de Marcovia, ahi vive con su hijo, Melnyk es una mujer trabajadora y  dedicada a su negocio, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y carteras para dama, su negocio tiene 2 años de haberlo iniciado, sus ventas las realiza en la cominidad en donde vive y los fines de semana viaja a las comunidades de Los Llanitos y Renacer, ahi tiene muchos clientes que le encargan ropa y carteras, sus ventas las hace al credito.
el prestamo lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia ya que tiene muchos pedidos y no tiene el capital suficiente abastecerse de mercaderia.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Melnyk lives in the small village of El Cerro de Marcovia with her son.  She is a hard-working woman who is committed to her business.  She sells new clothes and women's handbags.  She started her business two years ago.  Melnyk makes her sales in the community in which she lives and on weekends she travels to the communities of Los Llanitos and Renacer where she has many customers who order clothes and handbags from her.  She sells her products on credit.

Melnyk will use her loan to buy merchandise as she has a lot of orders but doesn't have enough capital to stock up with merchandise.  She needs the profits from her business to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, shirts and handbags

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Danilo operates a motorcycle transport in their village to generate additional income to support his family. He is now 47 years old and and has three school-age children. He endures hardships and difficulties in life for he wants to continue sending his children to school in order to give them a better life. He has been in this business for almost nine years and usually earns a profits of PHP 7,000 a month, which he uses for their food and the allowances of their children.

Due to the high cost of commodities, he wants to ask for an additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy gasoline and spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle to provide a better service. He believes that this loan will help a lot to improve the sources of his income.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Diyaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, single and lives with six family members.

Diyaa has owned a furniture gallery since 2007, selling bedrooms, living rooms and dining tables and chairs. He has experience in this field and he has a deep understanding of local customers and a good reputation. His gallery is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot potential customers passing by him.

He is requesting a $1,500 loan in order to buy a tricycle truck for his business so he can deliver furniture. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a tricycle truck for his business so he can deliver furniture.

loans.name: Khayrullo

texts.ru: Хайрулло проживает в районе Восеъ. Он женат. Ему 34 года. У них пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Хайрулло предоставляет услугу. В основном он предоставляет услугу, такси. Кроме того он занимается ремонтом автомашин. В этой области Хайрулло 15 лет. Он берет кредит для приобретения запчастей.
texts.en: Khayrullo lives in the Vose district.  He is 34 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Khayrullo provides a service.  He primarily provides a taxi service and is also involved in auto repair.  Khayrullo has been in this business for 15 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Charles

texts.fr:
Charles  est né au Rwanda et a 59 ans. Il est marié avec 8 enfants de 9 à 26 ans, dont 7 scolarisés. Il a une autre personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de secondaire. 

Charles est salarie. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter une vache. 

Charles voudrait être un grand vendeur de vache et des viandes des vaches dans sa région. Avec le profit  Charles voudrait  scolariser et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Charles was born in Rwanda and is 59 years old. He is married and has 8 children aged between 9 and 26. Seven of his children attend school. Besides his children, he also take care of another person. He attended secondary school for 4 years. 

Charles is a worker who earns a salary. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy a cow.

Charles would like to become a successful merchant of cattle and cattle meat in his region. Charles will use any profits to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Milita

texts.es: Melita, de 27 años, es una mujer joven con muchas ganas de sobresalir. Vive con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 7 y 3 años, tiene una casa propia en donde comparte junto a su pareja la alegría de educar a sus hijos y día a día brindarles lo mejor, además de ellos, también vive ahí su padre. EL trabajo de Melita consiste en el alquiler de mototaxi, desde muy temprano, se levanta y espera a sus cuatro choferes quienes llevan las motos para trabajar en el servicio de transporte, pues lo da en alquiler y percibe ganancia por cada uno de sus vehículos. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 3 años y le esta yendo muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener tiempo libre para poder realizar muchas actividades mientras que sus motos generan ingresos adicionales, cuando empezó sólo tenia un mototaxi y ahora esta aumentando cada vez más, menciona que lo malo de este negocio es que sus vehículos se maltratan mucho ya sea por el mal trato de los choferes o por las malas condiciones de las calles de la ciudad, pero bueno es un riego que asume en este negocio, ahora se prepara para poder seguir aumentando su flota, pero primero desea refaccionar bien a sus cuatro unidades. Este será su primer préstamo con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que le darán un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete en ser una socia muy buena y puntual, además espera poder encajar rápidamente en el banco comunal al que pertenece ya que desea no dejar mal a nadie y siempre ser muy responsable. Con el monto solicitado 800 soles, comprará una mototaxi más ya que ahorro durante mucho tiempo un promedio de 100 soles y solo le falta el monto solicitado para poder completar.
texts.en:
Melita, 27, is a young woman with a strong drive to stand out.  She lives with her spouse and they have two children who are 7 and 3 years old.  She owns her house where she shares with her spouse the joy of educating their children and providing the best for them.  Besides them, her father lives there too.

Melita’s work consists in leasing out a mototaxi.  Starting very early she rises to await her four drivers who take the mototaxis to work providing transportation services.  She leases out the mototaxis and earns profits for each one of them.  She’s been in this business for three years and is doing very well.  What she likes about the work is that it leaves her with free time to do many activities while her mototaxis generate additional income.  When she started out she only had one mototaxi but now she’s increasing more each time.  She mentions that the bad thing about the business is that the vehicles are damaged quite a bit due to the poor way the drivers treat them or because of the poor condition of the roads but it’s a risk one must assume in this business.  Now, she’s getting ready to be able to enlarge her fleet but first she wants to service her four existing units.

This will be her first MFP loan and she is very happy to know that she’ll be getting financial support because she feels she can advance with her business.  On the other hand she commits to be a good, punctual member of her communal bank.  She hopes to fit in quickly in the communal bank she belongs to because she wants to be very responsible always and not disappoint anyone.

She will use the requested 800 soles to buy another mototaxi since she’s been saving up all this time and has about 100 soles and all she needs still is the amount she requested to be able to have the rest she needs.

loans.use: to buy another mototaxi.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés, es una mujer joven de 21 años convive junto a Faustino de 30 años; ambos viven en casa propia y desean tener un buen futuro. Inés, empezó a montar una tienda de abarrotes donde vende arroz, azúcar, conservas. Hace 03 meses empezó con este negocio lo cual le va muy bien; y desde que sus vecinos se enteraron de la tienda, no dudaron en comprarle algún producto. A Inés le gusta su trabajo ya que recibe a sus vecinos con mucha alegría y atiende con amabilidad y considera que lo más difícil es cuando las cosas se terminan rápido pues neceita de capital para volver a invertir. Con el crédito solicitado podrá comprar más productos de abarrotes como variedades de detergentes, galletas, arroz, fideos, entre otros. Este será su préstamo número 01 con MFP, y esta agradecida por darle la oportunidad de cumplir su trabajo. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, podrá comprar productos de abarrotes para su tienda como: galletas, arroz, fideos, conservas, gaseosas, entre otros.
texts.en: Ines is a young, 21 year-old woman who lives with Faustino, who is 30.  They live together in their own home, and they want to have a good future.  Ines started up a grocery store where she sells rice, sugar and preserves.  She started this business 3 months ago, and it is going very well.  Once her neighbors found out about the store, they did not hesitate to buy her products.  Ines likes her work because she receives her neighbors with a lot of happiness and she tends to them in a friendly way.  What she considers most difficult is when she runs out of things quickly, as she needs capital to invest again.  With the loan she is requesting, she will be able to buy more grocery products such as a variety of detergents, cookies, rice, noodles, and other items.  This will be her first loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the opportunity they are providing her to accomplish her work.  With the 1,500 Peruvian soles requested, she will buy grocery products for her store such as:  cookies, rice, noodles, preserves, soft drinks, and other items.

loans.use: to buy cookies, rice, noodles, preserves, and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, handbags and traveling bags.

loans.name: Efua Panyin

texts.en:
Efua Panyin buys fresh fish from the market and comes to smoke them for sale at Ankwanda near Elmina. Efua is married to a fisherman and has 5 children.

She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees.  A loan will help buy more fresh fish to smoke to sell and this will result in an increased income to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He owns a hardware store that he has run for two years. He opened the business using his personal savings.

Juma is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more nails, paint, wood, etc. His main challenge is in finding customers. He will use the extra income to improve his business i.e. purchase more stock.

loans.use: to purchase more nails, paint, wood, etc.

loans.name: Ddc Group

texts.en:
Getrude, who is in his early 30s is married with three children who are still going to school.  She has a business of selling TV sets and DVD machines for one year now.  She works from 8.00 am to 10.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans for household expenses, bought more TVs and DVD machines and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy more TV sets and DVD machines to sell.

She will share this loan with her loan group "DDC" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more TV sets and DVD machines.

loans.name: Mahougnon Ste Cecile Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUGNON STE CECILE est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mariette Florence Afiavi est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Mariette Florence Afiavi est âgée de 35 ans et vit au Bénin. Mariette Florence Afiavi est mariée à un couturier du nom de Constantin. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Mariette Florence Afiavi vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison,Mariette Florence Afiavi vend des condiments ce qui lu permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Mariette Florence Afiavi  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Mariette Florence Afiavi  ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHOUGNON STE CECILE, sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana de 53 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 3 a 15 años. Hace 3 años Ana decidió emprender un negocio de venta de congelados y otro de venta de calzado y bolsos. La primera actividad la aprendió después de haber trabajado con su tía en se oficio y decidió implementarla pues es muy amante de la buena cocina. Inicialmente trabajo mediante pedidos y  cuando tuvo una clientela concentrada adicionó otra actividad comercial como la venta de bolsos y calzado. Ella hace la lista de clientes interesados, compra y distribuye sus productos, después de comunicarse telefónicamente con los solicitantes. Su meta es formalizar su microempresa y conseguir un local, que le permita posicionarse, ganar dinero aun mas y en un futuro generar la posibilidad de que sus hijos tengan estudios de calidad. Ella también tiene como propósito mejorar las condiciones locativas de su negocio y hacer adecuaciones a su vivienda, lo cual es su sueño de prosperidad. Su mayor desafío es hacer más eficiente la producción de más, pues no tiene la maquinaria requerida para ello y el espacio donde funciona resulta muy pequeño. Aun así afrontará estas situaciones y con su gran creatividad y por ahora se enfoca en incrementar su capacidad productiva y en la organización de sus negocios. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer finanaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará harina de trigo,  bandejas plásticas, queso, bocadillo y también invertirá en calzado sobre pedidos de su clientela. Con esta inversión Ana aumentará sus utilidades y con ello sus ingresos familiares, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Ana, age 53, lives in the city of Cartagena with her partner and her four children, ages 3 to 15. 

Three years ago, Ana decided to start a business selling frozen goods, and another one selling footwear and bags.  She learned the first business after have worked with her aunt in that area and decided to put what she learned into practice, because she is a lover of good food.  Initially she worked to order and once she had a dedicated clientele, she expanded to include the other business—selling bags and footwear.  She makes the list of interested customers, and buys and distributes the products after talking with the customers by phone.  

Her goal is to formally establish her micro business and get a shop.  This would allow her to establish herself and earn even more money.  Additionally, in the future it would allow the possibility of her children having a quality education.  She also has as a goal improving the location of her business and making improvements to her home; this is her dream of prosperity.

Her biggest challenge is making a bigger production line more efficient, because she doesn’t have the machinery required to do so and the space where she works is very small.  Even so, she will face up to this situation with her great creativity.  For now she is focusing on increasing the production capacity and organization of her businesses.  This is exactly why she is turning to a Kiva loan, her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With this loan she will buy wheat flour, plastic trays, cheese, and guava paste.  She will also invest in footwear for orders from her customers.  With this investment Ana will increase her profits and with those her family income, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy flour, plastic trays, cheese, snacks, and also footwear

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is a 23-year-old farmer from a remote village in Mema in the Nandihills area of Kenya. She resides with her husband and family. She has been actively involved in farming for the last 4 years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs, and various food crops at the local market. Stellah passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs. 

Stellah is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. She will use her excess maize to feed the poultry and will provide sorghum to give the poultry energy and green grams (beans) for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg production, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will further increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she intends to turn around her living conditions and live a better life. 

In addition to profits, Stellah will benefit from chicken manure, which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will be able to save money that would have been spent to buy fertilizer. 

Thanks to your support, Stellah will succeed in making her dreams come true; take action and give a loan!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the business

loans.name: Adjo

texts.en:
Adjo S., née DANDO, was born on May 10, 1970 in the Republic of Bénin. She has been residing in Gapé-Centre for twenty years and is the mother of five. She had married a poor, polygamous peasant who is recently deceased. To address the basic needs of these children left abandoned for her alone to support, she went into business selling fried fish. This woman lives a life of extreme poverty, but she really devotes herself to small-scale commercial activities in order to pay for schooling for her children. She has already benefited from an initial loan that has been repaid.

As a moral woman with a will to succeed, she is submitting an application for a $700 loan, so that she can meet the demands of her customers. This loan is her only chance of success that will allow her to take care of herself financially.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame S. Adjo née DANDO est née le 10 mai 1970 en République du Bénin et réside actuellement à Gapé-Centre depuis plus de vingt ans. C’est une femme mère de cinq (05) enfants et mariée à un pauvre paysan polygame décédé il y a peu. Pour faire face aux besoins primaires de ses enfants abandonnés à elle seule et sans aucun soutien, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de poissons frits. C’est une femme qui vit dans une extrême pauvreté, mais se dévoue beaucoup pour faire de petits commerces afin de pouvoir payer la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle a déjà bénéficié d’un premier financement qui fut remboursé.

Vu sa bonne moralité et sa volonté de réussir et de satisfaire sa clientèle, elle soumet un dossier de crédit de $700, seule possibilité de réussite lui permettant de s’auto prendre en charge financièrement.

loans.use: Selling fried fish

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Khat A., 25 years old, mother of 1 child, lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is self-employed as a garment worker and generates about $2.50/day in revenue. Her husband is struggling to work hard under pressure in construction and also feeds domestic animals such as pigs, chickens, and ducks. He typically helps his family in financing with his daily income. They have one son who is too young to attend school. In addition, Khat A. hopes the loan will allow her to purchase more pigs, chickens, and other construction tools in order to expand the business. In the future, Khat A. intends to save enough money to open a shop selling many types of construction supplies and to build a concrete house for her family's facility.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs and other construction tools.

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Mrs. Phy is a widow and has  6 daughters. She never obtained formal schooling and has been growing flowers for more than 25 years. She is currently not only planting flowers herself, but also contracting flower and longan farms from other farmers. One of her daughters, Miss. Hun Sopheap, is assisting her in selling flowers. 
Mrs. Phy has borrowed loans from MAXIMA before, and is now asking for a loan of US$600. The loan will be used for contracting flower and longan farms from other farmers and for purchasing a motorbike. Mrs. Phy will be capable of repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Contracting flower and longan farms from other farmers and purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Ayubjon

texts.ru:
Ayubjon M. is 19, single and has a high school education. He sells men's clothing. Despite being only 19, Ayubjon has extensive experience in sales. He has chosen to work and help out his family financially instead of pursuing his education. The reason why he is looking for a loan is because he purchases goods from suppliers for cash. He does not have enough cash to be able to increase turnover, which will allow him to purchase goods cheaper. This is exactly why he came up with the idea of borowing money through MicroInvest. Currently his assets amount to $1500 and he has a permanent sales point. In the future he is planing to open a store and use the left over money to go to college. His father is on the picture.

Translated from Russian by Yevgeniya Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Миркалонов Аюбчон – 19 лет, холост, образование среднее. Торгует мужской одеждой. Не смотря на свои 19 лет Аюбчон имеет большой опыт в этой деятельности, так как оставив учебу ,для поддержания уровни жизни семьи, занимается бизнесом, что в наше время является более доходным . Причиной толкнувшим клиента брать займ стало приобретение товара за наличние у поставщиков. Дело в том, что чтобы увеличить товарооборот у него не хватало достаточно средств купить товар подешевле за наличние. И в такое трудное время для него, пришла мысль о кредитовании в МЗФ «Микроинвест» .Сейчас его активы достигают 1500$ и у него постоянное место деятельности. В будущем хочет открыть магазин и из оставшихся доходов учится в университете. На фото его отец.

loans.use: to open a shop and study in University

loans.name: Phen

texts.en: Mrs. Phen T., age 48, is a housewife. Her husband works as a farmer earning about $1 per day. They have five children: one who is a garment factory worker earning about $50 per month, one who is a student, and three who are unemployed. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to repair her house after the rainy season.

loans.use: To repair her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell basic necessities

loans.name: Zinnatoi

texts.ru:
Zinnatoi O. has been selling women’s and children’s clothing for 5 years. She is married and has 3 children. She rents a space in store #226. She purchases her products herself and brings them from Bishkek weekly. Her husband does not have a job and helps her by carrying heavy packages and meeting her at the border when she brings products in. Thus, Zinnatoi’s business is the sole source of income for her family.

Zinnatoi has turned to Kiva for a loan to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Олимова Зиннатой продает женские и детские одежды протяжении 5 лет на Панчшенбе. Замужем имеет 3 детей . Она арендует место в магазине №226.Товары привозит сама из Бишкека еженедельно.Муж нигде не работает, он помогает поднимать тяжелые сумки с товаром встречает её на границе. Так что её бизнес единственный источник в семье.Она обратилась в Кива для расширения своего ассортимента.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Baqi

texts.en: Baqi lives with his own family (i.e., not in an extended family) in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and an educated  man who has a small business selling wood. He started this business one year ago. He works hard to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and make a better income to help his family and expand his business. He is happy with all parts of his family.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Asia's Subira Group

texts.en:
Asia is a 27 year old married woman with two children, aged 2 and 2-1/2 years. Asia owns a small charcoal store, which she started in 2007. Every day she works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business, where she earns a monthly profit of about $140.

In the past, Asia has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for the business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have small businesses selling timber, food, cosmetics, soft drinks, and alcoholic beverages (saloon).

loans.use: To expand her business by  buying more charcoal.

loans.name: Mirzada

texts.en: Mirzada is a 29 year old married woman, who lives together with her husband in a small village near the town of Travnik. Her husband has a full -time job and his monthly salary is 470 KM. They have 3 cows and they sell milk to the dairy. Mirzada will use this loan to buy animal feed in order to improve the quality of her milk. Her wish is to open a mini cattle farm.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es:
My house lacks a ceramic tile floor. I want to cover the children’s room more so that they will be more comfortable in their place. I request a loan of $1200 in order to lay ceramic tile florring inside the house and make it more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

En mi casa me esta haciendo falta el vitropiso. Quiero cubrir mas el cuarto de los niños y que ellos este mas cómodo en su lugar. Solicito un préstamo de $ 1,200.00 dlls. Para lo colocación del vitropiso dentro de la casa. Y así tener más comodidad en la vivienda

loans.use: To install a ceramic floor inside the house.

loans.name: Noun

texts.en: Noun P. is a vegetable seller in Kampong Cham. Her daily revenue amounts to 3 US$ per day. She is 37 years old and has had her vegetable selling business since the year 2000. Her husband operates a motor-taxi which earns him minimal wages. His profession is one that rarely offers consistent income. They have five children who also work hard to keep the family afloat. One of the older sons is a construction worker. Noun P. would like a loan to help her son develop his trade as a construction worker. If he can buy his own tool set he will be able to get more jobs or possibly even a permanent position. With the remainder of the loan she wants to install a water pump at her family home.

loans.use: To buy construction tools and a water pump.

loans.name: María Graciela

texts.es:
María Graciela G. is separated, 47 years old and has five children, two boys and three girls. For the past 12 years she has been dedicated to selling clothing in different locations, which helped her earn a little money to provide for her children. María, along with her three daughters, would leave each morning to sell clothing in outdoor markets.

Now, María, with her savings and the help of Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya, has been able to also set up a tiny convenience store that her sons can tend while she is out selling her clothing items. She is requesting the loan to stock her store with more merchandise like sugar, flour, meat, milk, noodles, and other staple items. She also plans very soon to set up another store out of her home to sell clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

La señora María Graciela G. es separada, tiene 47 años y tiene 5 hijos, 2 varones y 3 nenas.

Maria Graciela desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropas, esta fue la forma de ganar un poco de dinero para mantener a sus 5 hijos. María junto con sus tres hijas salían a vender ropa en forma ambulante.

Ahora la señora María con sus ahorros y con la ayuda de la Fundación ya habilitó también un pequeño almacén que lo atienden sus hijos cuando ella sale a vender sus prendas. El crédito que solicita es para abastecer a su almacén con mayor stock de mercaderías como azúcar, harina, carne, leche, fideos, entre otros.

Muy pronto piensa levantar otro salón para la venta de ropas en su domicilio.

loans.use: Purchase yerba, noodles, sugar, rice, soft drinks, beer, oil, milk, sweet breads, etc. / Compra de yerba, fideos, azúcar, arroz, gaseosas, cerveza, aceite, leche. panificados, etc.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla N. (shown in the picture with her mother and her son), 26, and her husband were married in 2004. The couple lives with Phalla's parents along National Road #1 about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh and have two children, one son and one daughter.

Mrs. Phalla has been selling fruit since 2006. She buys them from farmers in her village for resale at her shop in front of her house and some at Kor Ky market. Her husband has full-time employment in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work (and thus save money on the motor taxi) and to purchase fruit for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and wholesale fruit

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora U. is 45-years-old, married and has eight children. The family lives in Afro Media, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells fish in her neighborhood by going directly to the houses of her customers. This proactive approach of selling increases her profit compared to selling the fish from her house. She started this business in 2000.

Flora is requesting a loan to buy one deep freezer so that she can ice the fish before taking it with her on her sales route. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy one deep freezer for icing fish

loans.name: Rauhia

texts.en:
Rauhia is 28 years old. She is divorced with 2 children aged 8 and 6 years old. She has been a bites seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 9:30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Rauhia is now looking for a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of various goods and ingredients to produce fried dishes.

loans.name: Syeda Raheela Syed Aftab Ahmad Shah Group

texts.en:
Syeda Raheela baji is a wife of S. A. A. S. and lives Pakpattan, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 35 years. Raheela baji is the mother of two sons. Her elder son has a vegetable-selling business. Her younger son is in 8th standard. Raheela baji’s husband also has a vegetable-selling business. He buys vegetables from wholesalers and sells them to different shops. Raheela baji helps him pack the vegetables for sale. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more vegetables for her husband. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Syeda Rashida baji requests a loan to buy materials (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business. Uzma baji requests a loan to buy spices to resell. Sakina baji requests a loan to buy vegetables to resell. Shaheen baji and Nawab baji each request a loan to buy seasonal fruits to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy vegetables wholesale for reselling

loans.name: Gladis

texts.en:
Mrs. Gladis E. D. C. is a lighthearted mother of seven with a husband whom works in the mines in Peru.  Gladis is originally from the Junin province, but now lives in Carabayllo, a northern suburb of Lima where she has her own artesanía (traditional crafts) business.  She is requesting a loan of 300 soles to be repaid over 4 months to buy a sewing machine for her business so that it can grow.  

Mrs. E. D. C. sews in her house and travels out to the provinces every 15 to 20 days to sell her handicrafts; all of her goods are maD. to order.  Her dream, she says with a laugh hiding behind her eyes, is that her children (5 girls and 2 boys) will do well.  She specifically wants her son (Jenry Omar, who is also raising a loan on Kiva here) to become a professional.

loans.use: To support her Artesanía

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar  vive en la  zona de Achachicala en la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Vive en la casa de sus padres junto a sus hijos, los cuales administran un pequeño taller de costura.

Se dedica  al transporte urbano como chofer  de taxi en una ruta central de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de materiales de construcción ( estuco, cemento, pinturas) y asi realizar algunas mejoras en sus  habitaciones ya que por temporada de lluvias se encuentran deterioradas. 
 
Es el segundo   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Edgar lives in Achachicala, a part of the city of La Paz. He lives in a house with his parents and his children, who run a small sewing factory. He works in urban transit, as a driver of a taxi in a central route of the city. This credit would be used to get the materials for construction (stucco, cement, paint) and so be able to make improvements in his home, which was damaged during the rainy season. This is his second loan with IMPRO, our test qualified him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy stucco, cement, and paint to make improvements on two rooms in his house

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Садиева Шарофат проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 44 года, женат и имеет четверых детей. Работает на рынке шахринау. Выпекает и жарит пирожки для продажи. Опыт в бизнесе уже 16 лет. Работает очень много , так как прокормить такую большую семью не так просто. Кредит планирует получь для того, чтобы сделать запас муки и масла. Таким образом она сможет бесперебойно работать , а так же иметь стабильные цены на производимую продукцию. Погасиь кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharofat S. lives in Shakhrinaw region. She is 44, married, and has 4 children. Sharofat has been in business for 16 years. She makes pies and sells them at the local market. Sharofat works hard to provide for her large family. She plans to take this loan to purchase a reserve supply of cooking oil and flour. Sharofat plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil and flour

loans.name: Ruth Miryam

texts.es:
Ruth es una valerosa mujer de 41 años, vive con sus 2 amorosos hijos y su esposo. Vive en el distrito de Huaraz.

Ella pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “María del Rosario” y como toda mujer emprendedora inició su negocio con una bodega y lo complementó con la venta de alimentos (menú); su negocio tiene aproximadamente 4 años de funcionamiento.

Ella es una mujer bastante entusiasta para los negocios, por ello también se dedica al tejido de chompas (sólo pedido).

Con este crédito de S/. 300.00,  el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, podrá abastecerse de los siguientes productos: 1 saco de azúcar, 2 sacos de arroz, 1 caja grande y mediana de aceite.

Ruth se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad de poder acceder a créditos que permitan hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Ruth, 41, is a courageous woman who lives with her loving husband and their two children in the Huaraz district. She belongs to the group "Maria del Rosario", and just as many other hard-working women, she began her business four years ago with a small general store, and later she added the sale of food. She enjoys having different businesses, so she also knits sweaters by order. Ruth is requesting a loan of 300 soles to be paid back in 4 months, to purchase sugar, rice and oil to restock her store. Ruth is very thankful for the credit that allows her business to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing items to restock general store

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime es un joven muy alegre, a sus 20 años ya tiene un negocio propio y apoya con los gastos familiares, vive en un cuarto alquilado con su hermana, desea salir adelante y tener una buena profesión. Auque todavía es muy joven, ya se siente en la obligación de aportar con los gastos de su familia, él tiene una tienda donde vende de todo, la cual puso junto a su hermana y ahora los dos velan por el progreso de su negocio, ya que saben que sus padres cuentan con ellos para mejorar su vida. Jaime disfruta de vender sus productos, es muy buen vendedor y siempre consigue que sus clientes se lleven algo de su tienda, espera tener en el futuro una tienda más grande y vender todo lo que sus clientes necesitan. Lleva 3 años en este negocio y lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de la tienda cuando le toca atender, ya que como todo joven el quiere salir con sus amigos, pero aunque tiene que hacer algunos sacrificios, sabe que debe trabajar duro si quiere tener un buen futuro. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, desea pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es el miembro más joven y siempre es aconsejado por las demás socias. Con el dinero que solicita planea comprar más productos para aumentar la mercadería de su tienda y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Jaime is a happy youth who, at twenty years old, already has his own business and supports the family household expenses. He lives in a rented room with his sister. He wants to get ahead and have a good career. Although he is still very young, he feels the obligation to contribute to his family’s expenses. He has a store where he sells just about everything, which has put him together with his sister, and now both of them are vigilant for the progress of the business. They know that their parents are counting on them to better their lives. Jaime enjoys selling his products. He is a very good salesman and always managers to get his customers buy something from his store. In the future, he hopes for a larger store to sell everything his customers need. He has been in this business for 3 years and what he likes least, is to have to stay in the store the whole day when it is his turn to attend to the customers. Like any young person, he wants to go out with his friends although he has to make sacrifices. He knows that he has to work hard if he wants to have a good future. This is his first loan with MFP. He wants to make timely payments so he does not have any problems with his community bank where his is the youngest member and is always counseled by the other partner members. With the money that he requests, he plans to buy more products to increase the merchandise of his store and by this, increase his economic profits.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise of his store. / Incremento de su mercadería

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en:
Mr. Yeng Y., 25, and his wife, Mrs. Ra Houn, 21, were married in 2007 and just have a six month-old son. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Yeng has been a motor taxi operator for three months. He used to work in a hotel in Phnom Penh for three years. Mrs. Ra Houn has been a silk weaver for five years. She hires the loom from a villager to weave, but she thinks that “it is not comfortable for her to use like her own”, so Yeng is requesting his first loan of $300 to purchase silk materials and to set up a loom for his wife to weave silk.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and to set up a loom for his wife to weave silk.

loans.name: Tuisuesue

texts.en:
Tuisuesue V., 42, is married with 8 children. She has five years of experience in the pancakes business. She sells to the villagers and the general public five days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (about $150).

SPBD loans are Tuisuesue’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks, and this is her second SPBD loan. She will purchase ingredients such as sacks of flour, sugar, yeast, baking powder, and cooking oil. Part of the loan will also be used to pay for the children's school fees and to buy school supplies.

Tuisuesue's husband is a farmer and he works in the plantation to earn extra income for the family.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients such as sacks of flour, sugar, yeast, baking powder, and cooking oil, as well as to help pay the children's school fees and buy school supplies.

loans.name: Aenahon

texts.ru: Энахон активная клиентка Микроинвест. За время сотрудничества она значительно расширила свой бизнес и займы, которые она получала, использовала целенаправленно. Ее старшая дочь помогает ей, когда Энахон ездит за товаром. Сейчас торговое место Энахон расположено в центральном торговом центре города. Недавно этот торговый центр отремонтировали и с предпринимателей арендующих торговые точки собирали определенные вклады для этого. Это немного уменьшило капитал бизнеса Энахон, и поэтому она решила подать заявку на займ и расширить ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Aenahon is an active client of MicroInvest. During this collaboration, she significantly expanded her business and used her loans purposefully. Her older daughter helps with the business when Aenahon leaves to get her product. Currently, Aenahon’s store is located at the city central shopping center. This shopping center was recently remodeled, and funds for remodeling were collected from all businesses leasing space there. This slightly decreased Aenahon’s business capital. This is why she decided to request a loan and expand her product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand goods assortment

loans.name: Artesanas Emprendedoras San Marcos Group

texts.en:
Here are the members of the Artesanas Emprendedoras group in San Marcos. All but one member seeks a loan to buy thread, string, cloth and fabric to enable them to knit and sew. Norma B. is a street vendor.

Members incluD.:

Elba A., Nancy L., Adorina L., Blasida C., Elsa D. A., Flavia S., Norma B. (Street vendor), Bernarda A., Casimira C., Martina T., Nilsa B., Julia A., Liz C., Marcelina L., Gladys C. and Susana F..

The group is seeking (4500000 PYG), about $900.

loans.use: Buy knitting supplies.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: El Señor Gilberto C. R. tiene la edad de 50 años, es un hombre casado. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de Gilberto es la compra y venta de cerdos. Primeramente se dedicaba a la venta de gallinas, posteriormente con las ganancias logro comprar un cerdo a un precio accesible, por lo que este negocio le gusto mas y las ganancias de eran mejores, el recorre las comunidades en busca de cerdos que le generen muy buenas ganancias, es por eso que puso todo su esfuerzo para no abandonar este trabajo que lo ayudo a salir adelante y proporciónale a su familia el alimento diario. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de compra de cerdos. Su sueño es preparar a sus hijo  con una excelente educación para que no pase por las dificultades que el atraveso.
texts.en:
Gilberto C. R., age 50, is married and has three dependent children. He makes his living buying and selling pigs. He started out selling hens. With the profits, he bought a pig that was affordable. He liked that business better, and it was more profitable.

He travels around buying pigs in the villages. The business is profitable and he worked hard to make it a success and put food on the table for his family. He wants the loan for working capital to buy pigs. His dream is to give his children an excellent education so that they don't have to face the difficulties that he experienced.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Silvia Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Silvia, Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y es madre de 01 hijo, tiene estudios superiores técnicos. Vive en la Comunidad de Chinchero Sector Nueva Alianza.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de lanas para la confección de Artesanías.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, para compra de lana de acrílica para elaboración de artesanías, también comprará pollos para crianza.

Su mayor  deseo es seguir trabajando y poder exportar sus productos.

A ella le gustan la actividades de su organización.
texts.en:
Ms. Silvia C. is a member of the “Cajas Reales” Microfinance Institute, located in the Chucuito district of the Puno province, department of Puno. She is a 34-year-old single mother with one son. She has a technical degree and lives in the Chinchero Sector Nueva Alianza Community.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for a year. She used her first 300.00 PEN loan to purchase wool to make handicrafts.

At this time, she needs a 600.00 PEN loan to purchase synthetic wool to make handicrafts. She also needs the loan to purchase chickens to start a chicken farm.

Her biggest wish is to continue working and to be able to export her products.

She likes her microfinance institute’s activities.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens and different-colored wool

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa B. is from the village of Lilo-an, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Adelfa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Adelfa owns and operates a sari-sari (general store). She sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Adelfa has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Adelfa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelfa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Adelfa from GDMPC. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the business as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Iriva

texts.en:
Irina is divorced and has two grown up children. She sells bed sheets at the central market in Pavlograd city and has been in this business for eighteen years. She has many repeat clients. This business is the only source of income for Irina.

Irina would like to borrow 9,000 UAH to purchase blankets and pillows. She has used Hope loans before and finds them very useful for her business.

loans.use: To purchase blankets and pillows to sell

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra actualmente en su 10º ciclo cuenta con 17 integrantes. 
Las integrantes se dedican a actividades varias entre las que se destaca la venta de comestibles, bebidas, despensa, peluquería, además de venta de ropas, entre otras cosas el destino de los fondos va para la compra de materiales como telas, ropas, hilos, carne, aceite, verduras, entre otras cosas. El comité presenta buena relación interna y respeto entre sus integrantes. 
Entre sus metas inmediatas resaltan la necesidad de que sus hijos se formen académicamente y puedan optar por un buen empleo, es por eso que redoblan esfuerzos para poder darles los materiales que puedan posibilitar lograr sus objetivos. 

El comité “Fe y Esperanza” lleva trabajando con la con la Fundación Paraguaya más de 2 años por lo que la mayoría de sus integrantes ya tiene una actividad productiva en funcionamiento, por lo que el destino que las señoras darán a sus fondos será la compra de ingredientes por ejemplo: aceite, verduras, carne, arroz, harina para aquellas que se dedican a la venta de minutas así también frutas, refrescos, azúcar, vasitos de plástico, cucharitas, para las que se dedican a vender ensaladas de frutas, ropa y abrigos de temporada como gorros, guantes, medias, jeans, camisas, entre otras mercaderías de venta rápida en la temporada, frutas de temporada como banana, naranja, pomelo, mandarina, piña etc.
texts.en:
This committee is currently in its 10th cycle with 17 members.

The members work in various activities including those who excel at the sale of consumables and drinks, a pantry, a hair salon, as well clothing sales and others. The funds will be used to purchase materials such as fabrics, clothing, thread, meat, oil, vegetables and other things. The committee has good internal relations and respect amongst members.

Amongst their immediate goals, what stands out is the need to form their children academically so they can choose a good career. For this reason, they are doubling their efforts to give them the necessary materials to reach their goals.

The committee “Fe y Esperanza” (Faith and Hope) have been working with Fundación Paraguaya for more than two years so that the majority of their members are now operating in a productive occupation. Thus, the women that sell fast food will use the funds for the purchase of ingredients such as oil, vegetables, meat, rice, and flour while those that sell fruit salads will buy fruits, sodas, sugar, plastic cups and spoons. Other merchants will purchase clothes and seasonal wear like hats, gloves, socks, jeans, shirts, for sale in season and seasonal fruits like banana, orange, pomelo, mandarin, pineapple, etc…

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of ingredients such as oil, vegetables, meat, rice, and flour, fruits, sodas, sugar, plastic cups and spoons, clothes and seasonal wear like hats, gloves, socks, jeans, shirts, for sale in season and seasonal fruits like banana, orange, pomelo, mandarin, pineapple, etc…

loans.name: Serina

texts.en:
Serina C. is from the village of Tabo-o in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Serina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Serina plants, harvests, and sells rice. Serina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Serina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Serina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers. Serina is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers . This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Serina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Yesenia Benita

texts.es: Yesenia Benita V. Pacheco tiene 33 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Por lo que siempre tiene que ir a Managua en busca de los productos, por lo que ella recorre los diferentes mercados y algunas comarcas y así todos los días se levanta muy temprano pues tiene alistar sus bolsos y mercadería para ofrecerles a sus clientes su gran variedad de productos. Actualmente ella está solicitando el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para caballeros, cosméticos, ropa para damas y para niños. Su mayor deseo es obtener un carro para brindar el servicio de taxi.
texts.en:
Yesenia Benita V. Pacheco is 33 years old. She works selling general merchandise. For more than 8 years now she has worked in this business. She is responsible for her 3 children, which is why she always has to go to Managua to look for products to sell, going to different markets and regions. Every day she wakes up very early to ready her bags and merchandise to offer to her customers a great variety of products. She is currently requesting financing for working capital to buy men's clothing, cosmetics, and clothes for women and children. Her greatest wish is to buy a car to offer a taxi service.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Genèse Plus Group

texts.fr: Didier Kibwa 50 ans, est président d’une Banque communautaire dénommée « Genèse Plus » constituée de 26 membres engagés solidairement pour obtenir des crédits dans le but de renforcer leurs affaires. Son activité consiste à vendre des emballages au marché situé dans une partie montagneuse à l’ouest de la ville de Kinshasa. Il est devenu client fidèle de l’IMF HOPE RDC depuis 2007 et a déjà bénéficié 4 fois les prêts de cette institution qu’il a totalement remboursés. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un magasin général. C’est grâce aux prêts, à la bonne gestion et au dynamisme que son affaire prospère. Didier est marié et père de 6 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 4 et 19 ans. Tous sont scolarisés.

loans.use: achater des emballages à revendre pour renforcer le capital

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is thirty-five years old. She is married and has children. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Mampong in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Cecilia works to help her husband financially provide for the family. She is a petty trader. She sells cosmetics. Cecilia procures the goods from nearby towns and hawks to sell at the local market. She also treks to other communities to sell.

Cecilia has been in business for eleven years and wants a loan to expand her business. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase food products as well as beauty products

loans.name: Helvia

texts.es:
Helvia tiene 45 años, vive con sus 2 hijos de 14 y 6 años en la casa de su madre.
Desde hace 8 mese implementó una tienda en su vivienda, pues notó que era una buena oportunidad debido a que está ubicada en una zona céntrica de su localidad. Desde ese entonces ya ha visto el fruto de su trabajo, pues tanto ella y sus hijos se encargan de atender a los clientes que acuden a consumir los productos comestibles que expende. De preferencia atiende en las mañanas, pues por las tardes se dedica a las tareas domésticas y a la atención de sus hijos. Con este negocio Helvia se siente muy satisfecha y en crecimiento personal constante.
Ahora, ella se ha proyectado a seguir adelante con su negocio hasta lograr ser una distribuidora de alimentos a gran escala.

Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de más mercadería para su tienda, en esta ocasión para la campaña navideña se abastecerá de “panetones” (queque típico navideño).
texts.en:
Helvia is 45 years old. She lives in her mother’s house with her two children, aged 6 and 14. Eight months ago, she started a store in her house, as she noticed that it was in a good central location.

Since that time, she has seen the fruits of her labor. She and her children attend to the customers who come in for the foods that they sell. She only works in the mornings, as in the afternoons she is busy with housework and care of the children. She is very satisfied with the business, and feels constant personal growth. She plans to pursue this business until it becomes a large-scale food distribution.

This is Helvia’s third loan with MFP, and she is happy to be part of a communal bank. The money from this loan will be used to buy more merchandise for her store, especially “panetones,” traditional Christmas cakes.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Maywah

texts.en:
Maywah P. is a 39-year old married woman who lives in the village of Cross Catalvas, Maquiling, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a restaurant business and operating a rice farm.

Maywah’s husband helps her in running the business, especially in managing a "Habal Habal," a single motorcycle for passengers usually used in a mountainous areas.

They have 6 children; 3 are adults and the 3 younger children currently go to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. 

Maywah joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a restaurant business and operating a rice farm. Now, she earns an average monthly income of 5000 PHP from her business activities. 

Maywah is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 17000 PHP was used to fund operations for her restaurant, and had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions.

Now, she is borrowing her 10th loan in the amount of 20000 PHP which she intends to use on her restaurant and rice farm.

Maywah is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. 

About NWTF

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for restaurant.

loans.name: Olubunmi

texts.en:
Olubunmi is 39 years old and is married with two children. For the past ten years she has sold groceries and this has been her major source of income.

Olubunmi wants to expand the size of her business in order to get maximum profit and also to meet her family’s needs. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. It will also support her in helping her family to meet her children’s academic needs. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Merriam

texts.en: Merriam P. is from the village of Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 31 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Merriam owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products. At the same time she owns a video karaoke machine where she collects payment per song from her customers. She has been engaged in her businesses for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2000, Merriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Merriam is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 16th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Edit

texts.es:
Edit, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 29 años, es conviviente, tiene una hija llamada Daniela y tiene 2 años. Edit trabaja como psicóloga por las mañanas en el centro de salud de Belempampa los días lunes, miércoles y viernes desde las 8am hasta las 2:30pm. Edit tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos, ellas ofrece a sus amigas y familiares los cosméticos mediante un catalogo. Edit forma parte del banco Comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella requiere el préstamo de los 800 soles, que invertirá en pagar a la empresa que le vende los cosméticos. Edit se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
Edit is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman. She lives in Cusco is 29 years old, she is a cohabitant and has a daughter named Daniela who is 2 years old. Edit works as a psychologist at Belempampa's health center on Monday, Wednesday and Friday mornings from 8am to 2:30pm. Edit has a small business selling cosmetics. She offers cosmetics to her friends and family off of a catalog. Edit is part of the Communal Bank "Inti", which is part of the Arariwa Asociation. She needs a loan of 800 soles which she will invest in paying the enterprise which sells her cosmetics. Edit is very thankful for the opportunity granted to her through this medium and she promises to meet the payments according to the schedule. (Inti is a Quechua word that translated to English it means sun)

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay back the enterprise that sells her cosmetics

loans.name: Brigid

texts.en:
Brigid M. is a 58-year-old widow from the Lurambi area in Kakamega. She has five children with the eldest, Linet, being 35 years old and the youngest, Belinda, being 28 years old.

Brigid owns a restaurant which is a regular eating place in Kakamega town. Her clients mainly consist of employees who work in the construction companies in the area. The locals in the neighborhood also enjoy the delicacies she makes.

This is the second loan Brigid will be getting from KADET after servicing the first one very well. She is looking for Kiva lenders to help her get the funds to be able to buy cooking ingredients for her hotel like cooking fat, wheat flour and maize flour and to buy more plates for serving her clients.

Brigid hopes to do some renovations in her hotel (restaurant) for it to be more appealing to her clients.

loans.use: To buy more cooking ingredients and plates to serve clients

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana O. is a hard working and honest woman. She is married with 5 children and she is 50 years old. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. Juliana sells bags of groundnut (peanuts) and soybeans at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for long time. Currently her business income is not enough to meet all her family's needs. Juliana is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more bags of groundnut and soybeans to increase her business income.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of groundnuts (peanuts) and soybeans to sell

loans.name: John Njoroge

texts.en:
John is 40 years old, married and a father of four children. His primary business is operating a taxi in Westland’s which is a high class suburb in Nairobi.

Besides this he is a farmer practicing small scale farming at his home in Rironi about 20 km from Nairobi town. He also has rental houses which bring him additional income. His wife Nelly helps him with the farming.

He learned about KADET through some friends who were already members. This is his first loan with KADET; he has borrowed from other financiers before. With this loan, John plans to buy a dairy cow and in the future he hopes to buy his own car since the one he uses is hired.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow worth 40,000 KES

loans.name: Moyinoluwa

texts.en:
Moyinoluwa is 45 years old and a mother of five. She sells cooked food, before now she sold cooked food from place to place but could sell only what she could carry; after joining LAPO she was able to own a shop.

Moyinoluwa opens her shop every day of the week 8 am to 6 pm except on Sundays. Her biggest priority is feeding the children and making sure their school fees are paid.

Moyinoluwa is asking for a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase raw foodstuff in bulk at a reduced rate, which she said will enable her meet the demand of her customers. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance.

loans.use: Ingredients for food production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Preparation and sale of food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of cement for construction

loans.name: 06.03.05 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en: Thuc L. T. (31) is a 52-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa, Thanh Hoa. Thuc is the group leader of this three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 06.03.05 Hoang Hoa (06,03,05 Hoang Hoa). Thuc is married and has three school-aged children. She operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month. In 2005, Thuc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,124,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Thuc is now requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 6th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. B. T. Ngong (30) is a 54-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 2,124,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. L. T. Hanh (35) is a 36-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Thuc L. T. (31) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa ,Thanh Hoa. Thuc là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 06,03,05 Hoang Hoa (06,03,05 Hoang Hoa).
