Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương. Thuc thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Thuc kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND. Vào 2005, Thuc đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Thuc đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2,124,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. B. T. Ngong (30) là 54 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2,124,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. L. T. Hanh (35) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pedro Alexander

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Chepén,un distrito comecial perteneciente a la provincia del mismo nombres ubicada en la región La Libertad, la zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Tiene desde hace un año un negocio de venta de repuestos y autopartes de motos y mototaxis, el negocio está instalado en su domicilio y tiene como clientes asiduos a los transportistas de la zona. El negocio tiene mucha acogida ya que en Chepén las mototaxis son un medio frecuente de transporte. Esta actividad es la unica que le brinda ingresos los que utiliza en solventar sus gastos personales y en colaborar al sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Pedro desea adquirir mas mercadería para aumentar sus ventas ya que sus clientes han promocionado su establecimiento y su demanda está aumentando, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Pedro es una persona que ha trabajado desde muy joven para salir adelante, el negocio que actualmente tiene es fruto de su propio esfuerzo. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Pedro, 18, is single and lives with his family in Chepén district, a commercial district in Chepén province located in La Libertad region which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. For the last year he has had a motorcycle and mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) spare parts business that he set up in his home. His regular customers are area transportation providers. His business is very well received in Chepén because mototaxis are a common mode of transportation. This activity is his only source of income for his personal expenses and to contribute to the family’s economy. Pedro wants to acquire more merchandise to increase his sales because his customers have talked up his establishment and demand has increased. To meet this goal, he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan. Pedro is a person who has worked from a very young age in order to get ahead in life. The business he has is thanks to his own efforts. He has collaborated with Our Institution in the past and has shown responsibility and punctuality with respect to repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Yawa Edem

texts.fr: A. yawa edem est une célibataire, pour subvenir à ses propres  charges, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de   détail des produits cosmétiques   et des pagnes qu’elle exerce de façon ambulante elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. N’ayant jamais obtenu du crédit de WAGES, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter 17 pièces de pagnes de différentes qualité et divers produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Yawa Edem A. is single, and to support herself she started a retail business seeling cosmetics and loincloths. She is a mobile vendor and she gets her supplies from the main market in Lome. Having never previously obtained credit from WAGES, she is requesting her first loan in order to buy 17 different quality loincloths, and various cosmetic products.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: achat de produits cosmétiques

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 25-year-old married man. To earn a living, he sells charcoal. He has been engaged in the business for two years and has one employee. He has been a member of a group in Faulu Kenya (a Kiva partner) whose members are responsible for any member who takes out a loan. In this group, he saves his money on weekly basis.  

He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to add stock of charcoal. Joseph is a hardworking man who hopes to purchase a lorry (truck) for transporting charcoal in the future.

loans.use: To add stock of charcoal

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en: Eufemia L. is from the village of Tangaro, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old and is married with six adult children. Eufemia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products and also selling well-grown coconut fruit in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Eufemia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Eufemia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie R. is from the village of Macate Diffun. He is 22 years old. Jessie is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Jessie owns & operates a business venture in the transportation sector operating a motorcycle transport business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a motorcycle transport business. Jessie has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jessie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jessie from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Rosa Etelvina

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Etelvina Z. vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad corazón de Jesús, lugar en donde se puede admirar unos paisajes sin igual, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.

Nuestra socia se tiene de 31 años, es soltera y tiene 4 hijos de 11, 10, 4, 3 años de edad, sus 3 primeros hijos están en la escuela, con su duro trabajo ha logrado sola construir su propia casa.
 
Doña Rosa se dedica a la cría de animales como: pollos, chanchos, estos los vende en su casa y también hace entregas a domicilio, tiene 13 años trabajando en este negocio,  también se dedica al tejido en su tiempo libre, realiza gorras, bufandas, etc.
 
Es su segundo crédito en la fundación y está  muy contenta ya que en las reuniones se encuentran con sus amigas en donde conversan  de varios temas.
 
El nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR  le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, pollos y en su alimento.
 
Su sueño es comprar un vehículo para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Etelvina Z. lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca in the Corazón de Jesús community. It is a place where you can admire the incomparable scenery. The people there devote themselves to agriculture and raising animals. She is 31, single, and has four children. The children are 11, 10, 4, and 3 years old. Her first three children attend school. Through her hard work she has managed, on her own, to build her own house. She raises animals like chickens and pigs. She sells them at her house, and she also makes home deliveries. She has been working in this business for 13 years. She also knits, and in her free time she makes hats and scarves, etc. This is her second loan with the Fundación. She is very happy because she and her friends talk about various topics at the meetings. She will use the new loan from the Fundación Espoir to buy pigs, chickens, and feed. She dreams of buying a vehicle for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens, pigs, and feed for the animals

loans.name: Vũ

texts.en: H. Vũ Thị (20213050019) is a 34-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, H. makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling rice products in the local community. H. has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 4.000.000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) a month from it. In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. H. is now requesting a new loan of 8.736.000 VND, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her fourth loan from SEDA. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. H. Vũ Thị (20213050019) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương. H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.736.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh hỗ trợ tài chính cho các thành viên trong gia đình mở rộng của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Childekan

texts.en:
Childekan A. is a 47-year-old widow with two children. She married in 1982 and had an excellent example of a close-knit family. Unfortunately, in 2006 her husband died of cancer and Childekan became the only bread-winner for her children. It was a very hard blow for the family, however, Childekan braced herself to make her children’s lives stable.
 
For many people in rural areas, cattle breeding is the main means of subsistence. Childekan took on this activity, which had been started by her late husband. Her success was achieved due to hard work and strong efforts. Childekan managed to increase the number of cattle but had to sell them in order to pay for her children's education. In their own way, her son and daughter do their best to help Childekan in the household. 

Now Childekan is applying for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase one horse, sheep and bull calves for fattening and reselling. With the revenue from the loan, she plans to pay for the next year of her children's edcuation. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Grace Jazmin

texts.es:
Grace de 20 años, es conductora de una moto haciendo taxi y llevando mercadería, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.

Como vive en una población a las afueras de Playas llamada "Las Villas" decidió después de salir de colegio independizarse y tener sus propios ingresos siendo una de las primeras motociclistas mujeres transportando gente como taximoto en Playas. Aunque normalmente los hombres son los que hacen esta profesión ella continua trabajando en la motocicleta para tener ingresos suficientes para sus estudios y demostrar que las mujeres pueden hacer lo que se proponen. Realiza expreso a estudiantes de la Universidad y recoge pasajeros desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar herramientas, carrocería y sillas para dar una mejor atención al sus clientes. En el futuro quiere tener una pequeña empresa de motocicletas y así obtener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Grace, age 20, works as a motorcycle taxi driver and also hauls merchandise. She lives in Playas canton, one of many tourist spots in Ecuador with a diverse variety of seafood.

Grace lives in a town on the edge of Playas called “Las Villas”. After she finished high school, she decided to become indpendent and earn her own income by becoming one of the first female motorcycle taxi drivers transporting passengers in Playas. Although men typically make up the majority of this profession, Grace continues to work as a motorcycle taxi driver because she earns enough income for her studies and it demonstrates that women can pursue whatever they want. She caters to students at the University and offers her services to passengers between the hours of 6am and 10pm.

With this loan, Grace will be able to buy equipment, a passenger compartment, and seats so that she can provide better service for her customers. In the future, she wants to have a small motorcycle business and acquire a house of her own.

loans.use: Purchase equipment, a passenger compartment, and seats for her vehicle

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
Jovie B. 43, of talibon Bohol has been a sari-sari (convenience) store owner since 1990. He is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to offer to his customers. 

Jovie plans to include rice in his inventory. He also plans to venture into other business opportunities to increase his income.

The additional income will be used to finance his child education and to meet his family's daily needs.

loans.use: sacks of rice, softdrinks and other merchandise to sell

loans.name: Cesar Gonzalo

texts.es:
Cesar de 44 años, tiene una tienda de víveres. Vive en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada suburbio de Guayaquil.  

La tienda la empezó el papa pero cuando el falleció Cesar tuvo que hacerse cargo de ella para poder tener estabilidad económica. Con la ayuda de su esposa pudo surtir mas la tienda y seguir con el negocio de su papa. En su tienda vende arroz, aceites, enlatados, snack, bebidas, panes etc. Con ayuda de sus hijos también puede atender la tienda ellos al llegar del colegio le ayudan. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como granos, enlatados y harina para tener más variedad en sus productos. En el futuro quiere tener una panadería bien surtida.
texts.en:
Cesar, 44, has a grocery store.  He lives in an urban zone in Guayaquil, called Suburbio, which is notable because most of its residents are merchants.

The store was started by his father but after he died Cesar had to take charge of it in order to have economic stability.  With help from his wife they were able to stock it better and continue with his father’s business.  He sells rice, oils, canned goods, snacks, beverages, baked goods, etc. in the store.  His children also help tend to the store when they get home from school.

He will use the loan to buy groceries like grains, canned goods and flour to have more product variety.  In the future he’d like to have a well stocked bakery.

loans.use: For flour, canned goods, grains.

loans.name: Cherryvel

texts.en:
Cherryvel S. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 28 years-old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Cherryvel owns and operates a business in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and  junk food in the local community. Cherryvel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Cherryvel joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherryvel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell.  Cherryvel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Cherryvel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital.

loans.name: Tilegen

texts.en:
Tilegen S. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia.  He and his family all live together in their ger /Mongolian nomadic housing tent/.  All of his daughters attend a local secondary school. 

Tilegen owns his own car and is a taxi driver in his town.  He began his business in 2005 and has gained a lot of business experience over the years.  His earnings have enabled him to improve his old car.  His daily business income is between 15,000 and 20,000 MNT, of which 10,000 and 12,000 MNT is his net profit.  His car consumes 7 liters of petrol for every 100 km.  By operating his business, he is able to provide for his family.  He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan as working capital for his business.

loans.use: Working capital for his business.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Teresa del Carmen S. García tiene 58 años y comenzó a vender varios sabores de helado de coco, nancite, leche, maní y papaya. Con el tiempo, ella comenzó a invertir en productos cosméticos, ropa y otros productos que se venden a pedido del cliente.
Teresa es un ejemplo que demuestra que la perseverancia y el trabajo duro tienen sus recompensas. Ella quiere seguir trabajando y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa del Carmen S. García is 58 years old.  She started selling different flavors of ice cream: coconut, 'nancite' (a berry native to Nicaragua), milk, peanut and papaya.  Over time, she also started investing in cosmetics, clothes and other products that her customers order from her.

Teresa is an example which shows that perseverance and hard work have their rewards.  She would like to continue working and to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Perlito

texts.en:
Perlito M. is from the village of Quiling. He is 54 years old. Perlito is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty-nine years and earns approximately 8000 Php a month for these activities.

In 2010, Perlito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 24,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for services to increase his crop yield. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily lives in the the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She is married and has three kids aged 16, 15 and 8. To make a living, Emily owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Emily has been engaged in her business for over 3 years.

Emily joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emily is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. This will be the first loan taken out by Emily from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Michelle May

texts.en:
Michelle May V. is from the village of Bayombong in Nueva Vizcaya. She is 26 years old. Michelle May is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Michelle May owns & operates a business selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Michelle May has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Michelle May joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michelle May is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Michelle May from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is from the village of Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Arlyn runs a business selling fish.  Arlyn has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities. Arlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP with which she will purchase additional inventory and use some for working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Arlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional capital for her fish vending

loans.name: Brield Silve Garclem

texts.fr:
Brield est un commerçant de HOPE Congo de 29ans célibataire sans enfant. Il se lance dans la vente des ustensiles de cuisine en 2004. Ses ventes sont de 15000frs à 40000frs. 

Avec ce second prêt il va renforcer son commerce en achetant des ustensiles de cuisine pour cérémonie. Il à un bon étalage de ses marchandises. 

Il aimerait devenir le plus grand fournisseur de Brazzaville. Il veut fonder une famille ainsi que être capable de bien nourrir ses enfants dans le futur. 

Dans son entourage on dit qu'il est courageux et sérieux.
texts.en:
Brield is a 29-year old businessman belonging to Hope, Congo; he has no children. He began selling kitchen utensils in 2004. He sells between 15,000 to 40,000 francs.

With this second loan he is going to strengthen his business by buying kitchen utensils for special occasions. He has a good display of goods. He would like to become the largest supplier in Brazzaille. He wants to create a family and be able to feed his children well in the future. Those people who know him well say he is courageous and serious.

loans.use: to buy glasses, china plates and saucepans

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia A. is 61 years old and married with eight children.

Virgenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Virgenia has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 25 years and also earns an income from food vending, vegetable farming and raising livestock .

Virgenia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items for her general store

loans.name: Husnidin

texts.ru: Разаков Хуснидин проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 27 лет. Он холост. У него среднее образование. Живет вместе с родителями. Дома она занимается изготовлением мебели. В основном он изготавливает диваны и кровати. В этом ему помогает его друг. Изготовлением он занимается три года. Кредит берет для приобретения досок, ДСП, инструментов и обоев.
texts.en: Husnidin R. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 27 years old and single. He has a secondary education. He lives with his parents. He makes furniture at home.  He primarily makes sofas and beds. His friend helps him.  He has been doing this work for three years. He is taking out a loan to buy boards, particleboard, tools, and wallpaper.

loans.use: to buy boards, particleboard, tools, and wallpaper.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa G. is a peddler of second-hand clothing at Elmina. Her husband is a petty trader. She lives with her six dependents. As part of her responsibilities, she assists her husband in paying utility bills. Her loan will be added to her initial capital to buy more quantities of clothes for resale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns an additional income from food vending, charcoal sales and raising pigs.  

Delia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.
